{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"New Adventures Learning Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/fwxNsZBsB9nJgJXi0uE6fQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(256) 770-7237","address":{"streetAddress":"301 Hale St","addressLocality":"Oxford","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36203"},"review":[{"author":"Leslie D.","datePublished":"2015-10-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I was fortunate in that I had plenty of time to find the perfect daycare for my son. We didn't have to rush. Just before his second birthday, and after about 6-7 daycare tours, I called NALC. They answered the phone the FIRST TIME. I spoke with a very friendly teacher that told me the director was out. I asked when I could stop by and she said ANYTIME. I went that afternoon and the afternoon assistant knew I was going to be stopping by. She took us on a tour and was very friendly. She gave me the information. I spoke with the director the next day and she was aware of me coming by and calling. My son started the next week! They truly care about him. The staff communicates and everyone seems to know what is going on. I'm not sure how, but his teacher has taught him colors and shapes and several numbers in his three months there (he turned 2 in August)! His speech is more clear, his attitude and personality have also further developed. There is just a wonderful feeling at NALC. It's clean. It's secure. It's a fun environment. And each teacher really cares about their kids. I love that other teachers know my son's name and he tells them hey and bye and waves at them. NALC is much more than just a "daycare." They do take the time to educate children. Price is extremely reasonable. And they communicate with parents so much better than I ever thought. Everything there is above my expectations. Highly recommend this facility. You should give them a chance to love your child(ren) the way they love mine!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside). 

Concession stands had the typical staples you'd expect to find at a High School football game, including hot dogs and burgers as well as an assortment of candy and drinks. Also, it looked like they had brought in Chick-fil-A sandwiches and were selling those too!

Good atmosphere for all ages! Would recommend for a place to check out some local HS football."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Fortis Institute","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qYNmK9_FP4MDpUU-DxkO-Q/l.jpg","telephone":"(334) 244-1827","address":{"streetAddress":"100 London Pkwy\nSte 150","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35211"},"review":[{"author":"Amy J.","datePublished":"2019-08-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I graduated the Dental Hygiene program in 2018. If you are thinking about becoming a hygienist, please do not hesitate you will not regret! I am happy I had a well educated group of instructors to educate me. I am now using that education everyday when it pertains to working clinically."},{"author":"Deaven W.","datePublished":"2019-09-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Graduated from the Dental Hygiene program in 2016 & highly recommend the education I received! The hygiene instructors are very well educated & always concerned with their students success. If you're considering dental hygiene, you will not be disappointed with the education you get from here!"},{"author":"Geralle B.","datePublished":"2019-09-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I attended the Dental Hygiene program at Fortis and I have nothing but great things to say about this program. Ill start with the wonderful Professor Guillory, she truly wants all students to succeed. She will go out of her way to make sure students have all information and skills they need to become a phenomenal Dental Hygienist. Other staff such as Dr Braxton, Dr skinner, Professor King are amazing as well. Ive learned so much from each and every one of them. With this program you have to find your own patients. With help of family and advertising finding patients wont be in issue. The dental clinic is inside of the school which is very convenient. Hours were flexible so I still was able to work. I can go on and on about how great this program is, I high recommend if your thinking about going in the hygiene field. I am the successful hygienist I am today because of this staff and program."},{"author":"Lindsey J.","datePublished":"2019-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I went through the dental hygiene program at Fortis. There was never a time that I thought my professors were not in my corner. Dr. Braxton knows his stuff. He'll get you excited to learn what he's teaching. Mrs. Swofford had the best associations to help us through radiology. And Ms Guillery always there to listen and push us. As a hygienist now, I am confident and able to help my parents because of the education I received at Fortis. My patients always mention how knowledgeable and through I am. That was instilled in me by the professors in the dental hygiene program at Fortis. I'm happy to have attended the program and would recommend it to anyone."},{"author":"Lauren F.","datePublished":"2019-08-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I am a former Dental Hygiene student. I am very thankful that this program was available in the BIRMINGHAM area. I am now a RDH and loving every minute. I am very knowledgeable in educating my patients and very efficient in what I do. That is because I have had some of the best teachers there are. One in specific has helped me and my other class mates get ready for our boards side by side and is still continuing to help me reaching my future goals of a bachelors degree. Professor Guillory is the best there is!"},{"author":"Blackbarbei G.","datePublished":"2019-08-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I graduated from the Dental Hygiene program at Fortis a few years ago and because of that program I am now a successful and practicing Registered Dental Hygienst! I would recommend this program to anyone interested in dental hygiene! I had a great experience - the teachers are knowledgeable, helpful, and care about your success as a student. Best decision I've made ‍"},{"author":"Christian N.","datePublished":"2019-09-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I graduated from Fortis in 2017 from the Dental Hygiene program. I spent almost 3 years of my life there and I considered everyone there family! My instructors and program directors taught me everything I needed to prepare me for my National boards and clinical boards! I get compliments from my patients in my practice that I'm so knowledgeable in my degree. I would recommend this program to anyone that is interested in pursuing a career in Dental Hygiene. My employer loves how I was taught clinical hygiene and also admires that I have a associates degree. I felt fully prepared for all of my exams and I had fun doing it! The instructors at Fortis are amazing and they made my almost 3 years enjoyable! There were hard classes but they made sure we had the resources and spent time with us to make sure we understood! I met some of my best friends are this school and it will always be near and dear to my heart!!"},{"author":"Rayshard S.","datePublished":"2017-10-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great school all around with great instructors and the President is very active in the education process. Very family friendly campus."},{"author":"Phillip Z.","datePublished":"2018-05-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Excellent 2 year Associate degree Medical Laboratory Technology program.  100% placement in Clinical Laboratory field, !00% graduation rate from third quarter of program, 75% Pass rate of ASCP BOC or AMT certification."},{"author":"Brad G.","datePublished":"2015-04-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"They have an amazing Phlebotomy program and the CPR instructors are very experienced!"},{"author":"Katrina G.","datePublished":"2015-04-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Awesome school! {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Small Wonders","telephone":"(251) 865-9595","address":{"streetAddress":"11100 Hwy 188","addressLocality":"Grand Bay","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36541"},"review":[{"author":"Me 2.","datePublished":"2018-02-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I didn't realize how great this Daycare was until I moved to Birmingham. The ladies at Small Wonders helped me get everything I needed to get my son in daycare and to figure out how I was gonna pay for it. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sugar & Spice Child Care & Learning Center","telephone":"(251) 865-4628","address":{"streetAddress":"9851 School House Rd","addressLocality":"Grand Bay","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36541"},"review":[{"author":"Nicole E.","datePublished":"2014-09-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I started my son here several months ago when he was around 8 months old.
I heard nothing but wonderful things about Sugar and Spice through word of mouth, so when i suddenly (and without prior planning) needed to place him in a program, i decided to meet with one of the owners of Sugar and Spice to tour the facility and get a feel for things...
All of my fears and concerns about putting my precious baby in daycare were immediately put to rest. 
I was very nervous to do this because i am a single first time mom and i've heard horror stories about other daycare facilities...
anyway i absolutely LOVE THIS PLACE.
The staff is amazing and the facilities are extremely clean and organized.!
Most importantly, they provide top notch care! 
This daycare is family owned and operated and the employees have been there for many many years which to me says a lot about this place.   Everyone there is very attentive to the needs of the children and the parents. My son actually enjoys going to daycare! It is so wonderful to be able to trust that  my son is in good hands so that i can focus on my full time job without interruption or anxiety.
I recommend this daycare with 100% confidence to anyone searching for a safe loving environment to place their child/children.  
Sugar and Spice has been such a blessing in our lives, and I intend to keep my son here until he starts kindergarten in about 4 more years."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Auburn City Schools","telephone":"(334) 887-4900","address":{"streetAddress":"335 S Dean Rd","addressLocality":"Auburn","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36830"},"review":[{"author":"Reviewer P.","datePublished":"2018-02-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I visited Auburn High School for the first time this weekend, and the campus was clearly a coalescing of 21st century education. The building was brand-new, and the cleanliness of the building matched its newness. The hallways were long and wide to hold the presumably large student body. My only complaint would be the glass walls that separate the classroom from the hallways, as it could be a safety concern. Overall, Auburn High School definitely resonates as the future of education."},{"author":"Courtney D.","datePublished":"2017-08-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"There is a reason that Auburn City Schools consistently have some of the highest test scores in the state- the educators they hire are exemplary and truly have a passion for the children they work with. Year after year I am increasingly more impressed with the experiences our children have in this school system. As a former educator, I recognize the dedication and discipline these teachers and administrators exhibit. This is truly an amazing school system!"},{"author":"Django B.","datePublished":"2015-12-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Very poorly managed.  I mean the middle school principle is a criminal .  Went here for six years and and the only good people who were working there left after a while.  Go figure. They have a 0 tolerance bullying policy but when someone is actually bullied the teachers could care less. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Ludwig Von Mises Institute","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/CoxqVHlntXBqn1YLY_YhsA/l.jpg","telephone":"(334) 321-2100","address":{"streetAddress":"518 W Magnolia Ave","addressLocality":"Auburn","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36832"},"review":[{"author":"Brandon B.","datePublished":"2021-09-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"If you want to learn about the Austrian School of Economics then look no further. This Mises Institute has a rich history and is a place full of immense knowledge. Their many libraries contain books on everything related to politics, philosophy, history, and economic science. The staff is very friendly and the faculty is incredibly knowledgeable. In addition, the book store has an incredible selection of books that you can purchase, many of which are unique hardcover copies , all at a very reasonable price. The Mises Institute is incredibly intellectually stimulating and a must for anyone interested in free minds and free markets."},{"author":"Nyron V.","datePublished":"2013-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"You wanna learn about economics and stop being a lazy ass you need to listen to Von Mises. They affiliated with great philosophizers like Raul Paul who run for prez and Israel Kirschner and Garret North. I started to read about Australian economics in a correctional facility and learned all about how the system works and how the government prints and prints money and devalue what in your wallet, but we gonna send a brotha to the pen for ten for stealing a wallet? Sheeit! I got to hear a lecture here a number of years ago and though I didn't get all the lingo, I damn well got the flow. I was inspired to talk to brothas and sistahs about melting down they gold chains and they teeth grills as a hedge against Bernuky's printing of dough. This is a flow I wrote in honor of Von Mises. Dig it:
       Speakin' truth to power, from Vienna to Valhalla,
       Keeping it real, from Zoroaster to Allah, 
       A bicycle,
       A trycicle
       Can't beat the business cycle.
       Inflation: The end of the nation.
       Stagflation: Anticipation.
       Capitalism, the savior of the nation.
       Keynsianism: the ruination of the nation.
       Quantitative Easing: A total illusion.
       Big Government, leads to doom.
       Gold: The solution of the resolution.
       Free markets: the only solution.

Peace. Love. Free markets."},{"author":"Walter B.","datePublished":"2013-07-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I am a big fan of the Mises Institute. It constitutes the world's leading scholarly enterprise dedicated to studying Austrian economics, the economics of Menger, Bohm Bawerk, Hayek, Mises and Rothbard. They offer for free an electronic library, free access, that will knock your socks off."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":3}}

There is beauty in the colors, in the lines, in the intricate curves and and curls."},{"author":"Katie K.","datePublished":"2016-05-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My boyfriend and I took a 3 hour glassblowing class. We had so much fun! The owner/instructor explains everything in detail. With the first class we learned to shape a ball with the glass and attach them to one another. Then learned to make a small mushroom and add color. You work at your own pace and he teaches you one step at a time. We can't wait to a schedule another class!"},{"author":"Dee L.","datePublished":"2015-08-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Wow... We just had a Great 3 hour class. I originally had yelp this location and was a little discouraged by the lack of reviews but decided to give it a shot since the person that answered the phone was really nice and super helpful and I'm so glad we decided to try it. The guy helping us was super patient and was totally cool! It was my husband's birthday present and not only did he make really enjoyable. I really recommend this place. Don't shy away because of the lack of reviews! {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Montessori Kids Universe Homewood","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/tTj3FqfkmO95t4n2gaaRsA/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 848-2714","address":{"streetAddress":"2041 Brookwood Medical Center Dr","addressLocality":"Homewood","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35209"},"review":[{"author":"Rashmee S.","datePublished":"2019-05-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We very much appreciate MKU. When we were looking for childcare and early education options for our son, we knew MKU was our choice school upon witnessing first hand the method, the facilities, the teachers, and the diversity of the student body. As American Muslims raised in Alabama, navigating the intersectionality of our various identities was often challenging, and upon becoming parents, we wanted to ensure our son would be cared for in an environment that embraces each individual child and their unique attributes. The staff here is highly professional and caring. The facilities are clean and uncluttered. I'm continually impressed by the activities that our now 14 month old partakes in: various fruit tastings, artwork, Spanish lessons, circle time, etc...So far, despite the expense (comparable to similar facilities in the area) we are so happy with our choice and eagerly look forward to our son's continued growth and development at this school/daycare."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Kid's Town Montessori School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kPs3WRkXku9-ggLtDzgFVQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 598-5437","address":{"streetAddress":"867 Sycamore Ave","addressLocality":"Vista","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92083"},"review":[{"author":"Nicole M.","datePublished":"2017-05-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our daughter Shelby has now attended KTMS for over a year. I cannot even begin to express how much she has grown and how much she has learned in her time at this school. Her teachers Miss Candi and Miss Claire feel like family to us and are so loving and patient with our rambunctious, over zealous, sweet little girl. It is so heart warming to see Miss Claire hugging Shelby on the Watch me Grow web cam or to see Shelby laughing and playing with her friends on the play ground. 

Her teacher Miss Candi is so communicative and makes herself very accessible via the Shutterfly share app. She posts pictures of the kids every week on the app - which is 100% secure and only able to be viewed by the parents - and writes a summary of what the children are learning in the classroom. I know this must be time consuming for her to do every week but as a parent I appreciate it so much. 

Shelby has mastered so many new skills in her year at Kids Town. She can count incredibly high, recognize most of the ABCs, and is SO MUCH more focused. She has learned about geography, botany, entomology, science, math, etc. She has developed a love of learning, a new sense of adventure, and made so many wonderful friends. 

Like I mentioned in my original review, the school offers so many extra circular activities for the kids. I have enrolled Shelby in Amazing Athletes and Mini-Kickers Soccer. Both are wonderful for her since she has a ton of energy. She loves learning about the sports and being apart of a team. Plus, the fact that these 3rd party companies come to the school is is huge bonus! Being a mother who works full time it is hard to make time for sports and such. The school also offers Zumba, music programs, and more. 

The staff at KTMS is also incredibly wonderful. The owner Miss Mehrma and her daughter the assistant director Mahsa are beyond amazing. They are both so loving and kind to ALL of the kids enrolled at their school. I have seen Miss Mehrma in the nap room helping the children go to sleep, and Miss Mahsa comforting children who miss their mommies and daddies. The nap teachers Miss Shireen and Miss Denise are so very patient with the kids during Naptime. Miss Jessica and Miss Tammy who watch the early drop off kids are so kind and sweet. Miss Patricia who is Miss Mahsa's backup is also fantastic. 

I will be so sad when Shelby graduates from KTMS. As long as we can afford it, we will keep her there as long as possible! This school is worth every penny!"},{"author":"Joy F.","datePublished":"2019-04-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I choose Kids Town Montessori after seeing the high reviews and taking a tour of their facilities-- however, I wish I could say my experience was a positive one. I had enrolled my 1 & 3 yo daughters in this program for just one week (my one year old was in the 3 day a week program and I pulled her out on day 3). There were several reasons I chose to stop taking my girls to this program.  But the one issue that drew the line for me was when I saw my one year old sitting for extended periods of time in the table that has chairs built into the center. On day 2, I asked the teacher why she had been sitting for so long and she answered by saying that I had put her in the wrong shoes that day. Even after I spoke with them, they still continued to make her sit in the table chair for extended periods of time. I listed some additional reasons I took her out below. 

The cons:
- one year old class: one of the teachers doesnt speak English. The other teacher let's the kids sit down for extended periods of the day in tables with chairs in them. There is no structured play even though it's a Montessori school. The teacher would just put toys on the table for kids to play with while they sit in the table. 
- 3 - 6 year old class: the teachers don't interact or show any emotion with the children. Not a nurturing environment. 
- teachers don't seem to have any training 
- when I would pick up my girls, there was no one to tell me how they did, if they napped, how many wet diapers. 
- my one year old developed a diaper rash after only 3 days there... I had never seen a diaper rash get so bad

The pros:
- nice facility and classroom set up 
- the one year old class teachers are kind people."},{"author":"Parul C.","datePublished":"2015-02-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Kidstown Montessori is a school that has a rich learning environment. The playgrounds and classrooms are very neat and well equipped. 
The teachers are extremely caring and they make sure that your child feels welcome and comfortable. They provide a warm, positive and structured environment for the children. The director of the school has done wonderful job in keeping it well maintained and safe. I am a big fan of the Montessori method and it's amazing to watch how involved all kids are."},{"author":"Emily W.","datePublished":"2017-02-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Incredible school! I have two children enrolled - both started in the toddler building & one is now in the primary class so we have experienced 3 different classrooms & sets of teachers.

The school itself is clean, organized and well run. A relief to parents everywhere!

My kids have grown so much in the classes & are learning new things every day. I feel strongly that they are being prepared for life and for kindergarten. When my 3 year old perfectly recited the pledge of allegiance yesterday, I nearly cried!

The teachers are patient, kind and so considerate to both parents and children. They are knowledgeable about the age group and are extremely understanding and great at communicating with parents.

We moved to San Marcos in September and I'm so glad we found this school. I used Yelp to help determine which schools to tour so wanted to do my part in helping other parents who are doing the same. 

Couldn't be happier with Kids Town!"},{"author":"Gabi B.","datePublished":"2020-07-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So it's been 3.5 years since my daughter has been attention kids Town!! And honestly, I have absolutely nothing to say but overwhelmed you with so many good and positive things!! This school is one of the cleanest schools I ever had entered too, I saw the cleaning crew after the school closed to come and clean and sanitized the school every day! The Teachers and the assistants that work in each class are beyond the best, the love, warmth, and care that they give to kids are just unexplainable!! The two owners Mahsa and her mom, are one of the sweetest people you will ever meet! And every day when you see them not only do they have a big smile on their face, they welcome you kids so warmly in the morning and they make you feel like you are dropping the other half of your life at your moms' house! I personally wished that as a kid I would've attended a school like Kids Town!! The Montessori program is beyond amazing as it shows and teaches your kids how to love school and give them a very strong foundation for the future, by allowing them to pick and choose what they like to do 1st instead of being forced to do what everyone else doses!! My baby has learned so much at this school and loves it so much that I truly wish kids town would offer after elementary higher level to end of high school! But all that said, I just want everyone to know that this school is by far one of the best schools in Vista that you can possibly send your Kids too. Don't waste your time looking elsewhere!! This is the best place on earth!"},{"author":"Amy M.","datePublished":"2019-06-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We are SO happy with our decision to send our daughter to this school! She is thriving in ways I didn't know she could at her age. She is just over 2.5 years old, and already knows about days of the week, months, countries. KTMS provides a learning rich environment that encourages kids' natural desires to learn. 

They also have such well thought out school-wide events such as Zumba. Our family is so grateful to all of the staff at this school!"},{"author":"Khyati R.","datePublished":"2018-08-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Kids Town Montessori School (KTMS) came highly recommended to us by a friend. I had researched many schools in the area (Carlsbad to Encinitas) and found KTMS to be the best by far. My child went to KTMS for over 3 years and I have only the best things to say about this school. 

The teachers and staff are truly loving, caring and nurturing. Many of them have been with the school for years and their commitment to the children's well-being is evident in everything they do. The school's facilities and playgrounds are clean and exceptionally well-kept. Children learn through hands-on doing. I love how the curriculum includes practical life skills. Reading, writing, Math and Sciences are taught through conceptual learning. Multiplication and division concepts are taught as early as 4-5 years of age depending on the child. The teachers truly cared about an all-rounded development of the child teaching respect of self and others. 

We love Kids Town Montessori!"},{"author":"Karen L.","datePublished":"2016-08-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I enrolled my 3.5 year old son in Kidstown three months ago and I am so happy with the decision!    My son is very high energy and this environment has been such a blessing for our family!  The Teachers have the special ability to be kind but firm which is exactly what he needs and they do a great job keeping his hands busy.   
 
The Teachers I've interacted with have all been wonderful and very patient with him. The Director, Mahsa, has been very communicative and attentive and she has also been a pleasure to work with and takes the time to answer any questions I may have.   The program is very well structured and organized and it is apparent that all of the staff here genuinely care about the children's well being.  
 
They have fun activities happening in the summer program such as visits from the Fire & Police Station, Splash Days, Lizard Wizard and even a field trip to the Zoo!   The year end graduation event was absolutely fantastic and watching my 3 year old son up on the stage doing a dance routine with his new friends was so heart warming.   The facility is extremely clean, bright and welcoming!  The outdoor play areas are large and well kept and there's a great balance of "work" time and outdoor time.  
 
I am so thankful for Kidstown and I can't say enough positive things!  I enrolled my 18 month daughter in the Toddler program and can't wait for her to start in Miss Karina's classroom because we know she will be in excellent hands!

(Please note that both of the negative reviews below appear to be from individuals who do not have their children enrolled at this school.   I would never put my child in an environment that compromised his safety and I would encourage anyone who is doubting this to visit the school to see for themselves)."},{"author":"Toni N.","datePublished":"2016-05-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I scheduled a tour by phone. When I arrived, nobody was at the front desk. Eventually, a parent who was leaving let me in. I waited for a couple of minutes before a staff member noticed me.
The kids were in a dark room watching television. There were three adults in the room with them. When I asked why the kids were watching t.v., she told me that it was conference day, so all the teachers were busy. The school has a nice playground. I cannot guess why the kids needed to watch a movie at 10am on a warm, sunny day. 
She assured me that typically the kids watch only one movie per week, on Fridays, and only two of the classrooms have televisions.
No other preschool or daycare I visited had a television. My son will be attending one of those schools. The prerogative to use the t.v. as a babysitter is mine alone, thanks."},{"author":"Michael H.","datePublished":"2017-05-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great school, have been using for 2 1/2 years and love the facilities, the management, and especially the teachers. Knew nothing about Montessori before beginning, and very impressed at all the skills my child has learned and their whole approach to early childhood education: it is not a daycare, it is a school. In addition to learning and development, the school wears out the kids, lots of outdoor playtime on their covered playgrounds and physical activities throughout the day. Teachers are all very easy to reach whenever you have questions or concerns about the class or your child. The work and "gifts" that come home are priceless and seemingly never ending, had to dedicate a whole wall to our childs assignments! They also make doing special things for kids birthdays very easy, and have special activities and projects for many, many holidays and cultures throughout the year; and lots of special summer activities. 

Only negative:Parking can be tough when big events are going on, and traffic on Sycamore can be ugly."},{"author":"Emily L.","datePublished":"2019-02-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot say enough about KTMS. We have been bringing our twins here for almost 2 years and we have never doubted or been disappointment with our decision. When looking for childcare/schooling, we knew we wanted Montessori based educational program. We took our time touring and making sure we found the best fit for our boys. Out of the four different centers that we toured, KTMS was the only one that I felt welcomed and comfortable immediately upon entering. Ms. Ildi has been the boys' teacher almost the entire time and we have grown quite attached to her. The boys mention her name and names of classmates frequently at home and always seem excited to go to school. They have truly blossomed with fine motor skills and communication.  I would strongly recommend KTMS to anyone!"},{"author":"Chris W.","datePublished":"2016-07-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Kids Town Montessori School is a fantastic place to bring your kids to get the best learning experience anywhere. My daughter just graduated from preschool and will be going to kindergarten in the fall and she just loved coming to school every day. She loved her teacher Ms. Lynn. The director/owner is Ms. Mahsa who cares so deeply for the children. The classrooms are large yet the ratio of teacher to student is really low. Every time we visited the classroom it was quiet. The kids love learning in this environment. My 4 year old has learned numbers and letters and math and sight words and how to clean up after herself and how to take care of the materials. The playground is huge. Lots of stuff for the kids to do. Lots of shady spots to play. I highly recommend this school and the Montessori system for learning."},{"author":"sam s.","datePublished":"2017-07-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter has been here for about 2 months. When I toured the place and noticed the surroundings and the teacher and aides there, I got a good feeling about it, so I decided to move her to this school because I wasn't happy with the quality of care/schooling at her previous school. I know it's been only 2 months..after about 2-3 weeks into it, the way I see her embrace her teacher and all the aides that help run the school, this is very telling of quality of the people that work there. She didn't do that to anyone from her previous school, not that it was a bad school just the caliber of folks there were different. :)"},{"author":"Jeremy A.","datePublished":"2015-10-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"When we moved to CA for a year, we chose this school for our daughter to attend kindergarten.  We really liked the school because: it's super clean, teachers are fantastic and well trained, the facilities are fairly new, and the owners work hard to make sure everything runs smoothly. Awesome school! Honestly, we couldn't have hoped for a better kindergarten experience for our daughter...Kid's Town is worth every penny!"},{"author":"Steffani G.","datePublished":"2015-05-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Yelp needs more stars for this school. 

I sent my daughter to Kids Town when she turned 1 year of age. It was a difficult choice for us to send her anywhere, but I have to say that I am so glad we did and that we chose Kid's Town. This school is a delight and an amazement. What could be more important than the welfare and education of one's child, particularly at so young an age? These teachers excel. They are family to us. 

I have seen my child grow in leaps and bounds. At three she is counting and spelling. She sings and plays with passion and joy. She interacts so effortlessly with others and so much of this is the direct result of her experience at Kid's Town. From her first day there, she has been treated with love, compassion, and care. This facility adheres to the Montessori passion and philosophy and has made me a believer. Children are such natural learners, and at this school, they will learn as well as can be hoped. The teachers and administrators are always available to discuss your child's progress, hopes, and challenges. I honestly love these people.

The facility has recently grown. It is beautifully constructed and always clean. I have been to other schools when I was looking for a place to send my child and their buildings and grounds were far and away the cleanest in appearance (not to mention smell). Seriously, how many other facilities just tolerate urine smell is beyond me. Not Kid's Town....always clean and fresh, and that's not a small matter to my mind.

We are moving out of state soon and we will be so sad to leave this place behind. I will miss seeing my child in such a happy, interesting place."},{"author":"Rae H.","datePublished":"2015-10-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school has the most wonderful teachers, caring and attentive with my children. I have had nothing but great experience in this school. Clean and organized environment with big playgrounds. Drive through pick up and drop off is very convenient. Camera system allows me to view my children throughout the day. Kid's Town has been a great experience."},{"author":"Amanda M.","datePublished":"2015-03-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My son and daughter have attended Kid's Town Montessori School for almost a year now.  The teachers and staff have done an excellent job with preparing our children to become independent learners. In addition to school lessons, they create fun activities that my kids are always excited about. They truly care for the children and we are happy to be a part of the KTMS family."},{"author":"Gary S.","datePublished":"2017-02-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I really like this school, but I agree with Toni. There should not be TV babysitting the kids! Kids look like zombies in front of TV! But the school is great. Staff are kind and caring. Above all, it is clean. And the kind of cleanliness that you don't smell the bleach in the hallways! That gives you a headache and awful for respiratory conditions. They have different after school activities that my kids love to go to."},{"author":"Jennifer E.","datePublished":"2014-10-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our son has been attending Kid's Town since he was 1 and he is now 4 years old. He has had great teachers, a nurturing environment, and has made many friends since his enrollment. We love the cleanliness of this facility, as well as the extra events (Thanksgiving dinner, Cookie decorating night, park picnic, end of year performance, etc.). We feel our son has learned so much in this rich environment and we definitely recommend checking out Kid's Town!"},{"author":"E P.","datePublished":"2016-04-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I have posted a review for Kids Town Montessori School when our son went to it for 3 months. Now he is going to KTMS for 3 years and I am more than happy with everything. The directors, the teachers, the assistants, the classroom, the curriculum... Everything is outstanding! Every day I drive 30 minutes one way to take my child to this school because there are no schools of the same level closer to my home. I will do everything possible to keep him going to this school through Elementary school."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":25}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"cellochan Woods - a retreat for wellbeing and the arts","telephone":"(802) 496-5273","address":{"streetAddress":"7748 Clark Lake Rd","addressLocality":"Chelsea","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MI","postalCode":"48118"},"review":[{"author":"Dory M.","datePublished":"2013-03-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This retreat was an awesome experience for me.  Everything we did, from individual lessons to cello orchestra, to movement and meditation, it all came together to create a really powerful experience for me.  I loved the time we spent outdoors walking or boating on the lake - it was very peaceful.  At first I didn't know how it would be with such a wide age range (13-adult), but it turned out to be extremely special to bring together a small community for 4 days, of many ages.  I can say this retreat was absolutely life-changing - and I am more connected to actual music-making instead of just technique!  I will be attending again this year."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Artisan Knitworks","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/yqvGBLLpXkp429pjj5BL2g/l.jpg","priceRange":"Moderate","telephone":"(734) 562-2682","address":{"streetAddress":"105 N Main St","addressLocality":"Chelsea","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MI","postalCode":"48118"},"review":[{"author":"MaryLou D.","datePublished":"2016-10-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is a very small store, comparatively, although there is more yarn in the downstairs which I almost missed seeing. It carries mostly wool as far as I could see, and mostly finder quality yarn. Because I knit mostly for charity I am always looking for lower priced yarn and mostly acrylics because that is what the hospital's request. If I was needing something good quality for myself or for a gift this would be the place for me. 

The owner informed me they are open everyday except Mondays. I mentioned the other Yelp review which chided them for being closed on a Sunday and he told me they had closed on Sundays during the summer only, being a slower season. He invited me to stop by anytime to just sit on one of their comfortable couches or chairs and knit or crochet for the pure enjoyment of it, which I thought was a very nice invitation. I had occasion to use the restroom and it was nice and clean. 

I found some Christmasy looking yarn that I think will make adorable baby hats, a mixture of green and red. I bought it and left happy. It was worth the stop. They have beautiful samples also."},{"author":"Susan G.","datePublished":"2020-08-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I love going into this shop.  So homey and owner is always in the know.  "He" is quick to make suggestions on what yarn is best for my project.  I know that in small shops the yarn can be pricey but then again, it is of top quality.   Totally worth my time and money.
Susan"},{"author":"Loreen K.","datePublished":"2016-12-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Nice people, wonderful fiber, decent needle selection.  They have good sales and if in need, good classes."},{"author":"Melissa C.","datePublished":"2012-12-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I've visited 5 yarn shops this month in search of a particular shade of red in chunky yarn. Every store has been unique & quaint in it's own way but I felt like I had come home when I visited Artisan Knits
I was greeted by a gentleman who jokingly pronounced the "k" in knitting just like my Irish husband does. They also had a captivating yarn that exceeded my expectations at a very competitive price. 
I noted that instead of the traditional table & chair workspace they had couches & stuffed chairs. Very inviting! Who wants to sit in a hard chair at a table to knit? Even though there are other great stores, this was the first one that felt homelike. I could cozy down for hours."},{"author":"Brik I.","datePublished":"2017-08-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Come for the yarn, stay for the conversation, in the comfy 'living room' at the front of the store.  Filled with active yarn enthusiasts, it's a great place to get advice, fix problems, creatively brainstorm or simply enjoy the kindness of strangers-about-to-be-friends.  The owners are an adorable pair, friendly and helpful.  Shops like these are like little gems, Farmington Hills is lucky to have Artisan Knitworks!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":5}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Robin Hills Farm","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Avv046OqRfZaaYZth7jEPQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(734) 536-6576","address":{"streetAddress":"20390 N M-52","addressLocality":"Chelsea","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MI","postalCode":"48118"},"review":[{"author":"Derek J.","datePublished":"2020-05-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is amazing. Picture a bar that is 100
acres of just nature. (~2.5 miles of trails) with some scattered benches. This place is perfect for distancing and you are welcome to bring the party with you with exception of drinks. Games, food, etc..  Open 9-4 Thursday, Friday, and Saturday 12-9. True local gem!"},{"author":"Bailey D.","datePublished":"2022-04-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The perfect spot for live music and drinks! Best outdoor seating option in the area. Also so beautiful for private events such as weddings."},{"author":"Maeve D.","datePublished":"2021-05-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This is a fantastic, family-friendly nature venue with a full bar. They have 140 acres with 3 miles of walking trails. They also are a possible wedding venue! Located just down the street from downtown Chelsea, it's a nice place to enjoy the views, quiet or music (live bands in the evenings), and a beverage. While the drink selection is smaller, the staff is super friendly and welcoming. They have had food trucks on Friday and Saturday evenings as well, otherwise they have some snacks available for purchase. Highly recommend checking this place out!"},{"author":"Martha R.","datePublished":"2017-10-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Went on a tour with the Yelpers and had a lovely time. The person giving the tour did a nice job, but it might have been nice to keep the time a little shorter as it was right at dinner time and we were surrounded by food that we basically couldn't eat. ;) Ha.

I did end up buying some food stuffs at the end of the tour: arugula (very delicious, though not as good as what I grew at home), cucumber, peppers, and eggs. The eggs were the star of the food for SURE. If it weren't so far away, I'd be heading over there right now to get some more! So so good.

The facility was not quite completely up and running during our tour, but the vision of what it's going to be looks just amazing. I highly suggest stopping in and checking it out. Very excited to have a place like this around."},{"author":"Andrea R.","datePublished":"2020-09-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is a hidden treasure.it has a super cool vibe, like a mix between a cool Malibu restaurant and an aspen ski lodge. They look like they serve food at times but mostly at this point it is bring your own food and they have a really nice bar.  You can sit outside anywhere on the property with tons of nice tables with beautiful overlooks.   We also loved the greenhouse which is Pinterest perfect for a wedding or event.  We will absolutely be going back."},{"author":"Annette J.","datePublished":"2017-07-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I had the pleasure of encountering the Robin Hills Farm at the Ann Arbor Westside Farmer's Market a few weeks ago. I got a dozen eggs and, let me tell you, they were maybe the best eggs I've ever had. Bright orange yolks, rich and flavorful. I have been dreaming about these eggs ever since! I just haven't had a chance to go back and get more! 

The staff running their booth was SO nice. Super chatty and really lovely. With my egg purchase, they generously gave me a lovely tote bag (which I've been using regularly toting around my laptop!) and some literature on the farm itself. I learned so much! I discovered that they have a huge space in Chelsea right off M-52 (129 acres!) that you can tour, a garden you can volunteer in, they also offer classes, etc. They even have an amphitheater where they host events. Next week they're hosting a local theatre company's performance of A Midsummer Night's Dream. They also have a summer day camp for kids to learn about ecology, art, and science. 

Their website explains that they,"have an organic garden, a mushroom forest, a commercial aquaponics system located in our fully-automated greenhouse, 10 acres of pasture for raising happy and healthy livestock, and spring-fed ponds stocked with rainbow trout." But as far as I know you have to contact them ahead of time to take advantage of that, you can't just stop in. 

Can't wait to try more items from them and take a tour of the farm sometime very soon!"},{"author":"Alyssa P.","datePublished":"2020-09-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We were so excited that Robin Hills Farm opened up at the time that it did! This place is beautiful and was everything we wanted in a wedding venue. The barn is beautiful and well kept! It truly does look like it is brand new. There is an upstairs floor level that is perfect for getting ready. I would highly recommend that your Bride stays there to get ready! There are big mirrors, couches, tables, and plenty of outlets to use if necessary. It also has a nice overhang of the reception downstairs. This property is gorgeous and it feels completely secluded from the other areas surrounding it. We had the entire place to ourselves and it made for great memories and beautiful pictures. Adam is wonderful to work with and all of the event staff was extremely sweet and accommodating in every aspect! We couldn't have chosen a better place with better people!"},{"author":"Emily S.","datePublished":"2021-10-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Exceptional customer service, great music, patio, and drinks. Check out online the music and food trucks that change weekly to go along with the experience. As a whole with all these experiences it helps the community come together and have a place to meet up for a great meaningful time."},{"author":"Alfred B.","datePublished":"2018-02-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Visiting the Robin Hills Farm is an adventure.  Located just a short distance outside of beautiful, downtown Chelsea Michigan the farm has plenty of parking.  They were, last time I was there, working on smoothing the entrance area for handicapped patrons but will assist in every way to get everyone up to the restaurant/lodge/headquarters.

The grounds are beautiful.  They have been recently carved out of an old farmstead that had been worked by a family of Michiganders for generations.  They now display various types of farmland landscapes that are common across Michigan.  They are sensitive to the environment and work to support and increase the wildlife in the area.  The work they do also involves ensuring that the plants and other creatures that inhabit the area are kept in stable and then growing populations.

In Spring you may be able to see the elusive Blue Bird nesting and flying about.  There are turtles, frogs and the deer sure like the grazing. 
There are beautiful locations for outdoor parties and weddings.  Plenty of space for other activities too.  

Robin Hills Farm is not short on science either.  Their organic vegetable fields and their greenhouse which features cutting edge aquaculture as well as cold weather growing facilities is a wonderful sight to behold and learn from.  They were very kind to us when we were there.  My favorite part about the place is that everyone who goes there seems to belong.  Have fun!"},{"author":"Jon F.","datePublished":"2017-09-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I'm going to rate this review as 'under construction', because the same can be said for Robin Hills Farm.  We attended a Yelp event over the weekend, so I learned a lot about the farm and you should know this place is a work in progress.  They've been around for 3 years and claim to be an Eco-friendly farm.  The place isn't officially open to the public, though they are hoping to be so as early as November.  It also isn't a full production farm, as it's geared as much to education and learning as it is to farming.  For example, they have a pretty cool vegetable garden which includes two full size green houses, but they aren't supplying the country side with produce.  You will be able to find their produce at local farmer's markets.

I loved the place.  It's big and has several areas to visit (garden, animal pastures, an aquaponics building, ponds) but isn't like going to a working farm, so you weren't overwhelmed with anything.  The pigs and other animals were friendly (pigs were a blast) and the employees did a good job educating us.

I had a geat vibe from the place, and I think as it opens up, it will be a great place to visit.  They are currently mostly about classes and field trip events, but check back in 2018!"},{"author":"Caroline D.","datePublished":"2018-02-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Beautiful facility. Menu appeared better than it actually was. Some fine tuning and attention to detail would be good; maybe we hit them on an off day."},{"author":"Todd A.","datePublished":"2017-07-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I was recently at Robin Hills Farm for a theatrical performance at their outdoor venue. This is a review of that space.

The location is quite pretty, but be forewarned that it is, in significant ways, still a construction zone. The parking area is unfinished, as is the driveway that leads in to the complex. Ticket sales and vending (high-priced snacks, farm goods, and chachki with their logo) are done on the edge of the parking area under a temporary tent structure. The restrooms are also located here in a completed structure.

The performance venue itself is down a steep, grassy, uneven hillside from the parking area. I nearly tripped in a couple of significant holes. It had been some time since the venue was last mowed, as well. Clearly, this is not ADA-compliant in any sense, and was rather shocking that they thought this arrangement was OK, especially considering that the audience had a significant number of older members.

The stage is defined at its back edge by a parabolic concrete wall, meant clearly to reflect sound back toward the audience. The seating area consists of several tiers of grass with concrete walls at the back edge of each. The concrete wall behind the actors did reflect sound toward the audience, which was good, else it would have bene very hard to hear them. However, much of the performance took place off the front edge of the stage, meaning that the direct sound from the actors and the reflection off the wall were slightly out of sync with each other - rather distracting and confusing.

The tiered seating worked well enough, except that some people brought chairs and others sat on the grass, so that those sitting on chairs blocked the view of the grass sitters. This was problematical.

For some reason, a microphone on a stand was placed out in front of the stage. It was apparently connected to a single box speaker that was mounted on a tripod and placed to one side of the stage. It was never used, but did interfere with the performance. What they really needed was wireless microphones on each of the performers, with a proper sound system to bring those voices out to the audience. Such a system would likely include speakers to the sides of the stage and behind the audience.

Curiously, staff at the venue seemed to think that what they did in the line of sight of the audience behind the stage was somehow magically invisible. One person stood with a large camera kitted out with a telephoto lens photographing the audience. (Did you ask our permission to be photographed? hmmm...) Other staff casually walked past behind the stage or, in one instance, drove a noisy vehicle past, all of which was quite distracting. What were they thinking?

In sum, this venue has potential, but it needs a considerable amount of work and investment in additional equipment. The staff also need to learn what it means to respect the performers whom they invite in and the audience that pays to be there."},{"author":"Sheila Q.","datePublished":"2018-01-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The restaurant at Robin Hills Farm is finally open! I had brunch last Saturday with my daughter and friends. The food and service was amazing. My favorite dish was the rainbow trout. The meat was really tender with great flavor. This is definitely a very nice place to bring the family and friends for brunch. This was my first farm to table experience, I could tell how fresh and flavorful the food was. Besides, the restaurant is right on the lake with a beautiful view. Afterwards, we shopped around their retail area, they have a great selection of local products. They even carry products from Cherry Republic. We all had a great time. I'll be back :-)"},{"author":"Angie W.","datePublished":"2017-12-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We went to the Christmas extravaganza.   It was simple and fun.   Very good lunch and gift shop as well"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":14}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Montessori Educational Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/01vSGXl1DnsmWJS7vRYX6g/l.jpg","telephone":"(318) 445-0138","address":{"streetAddress":"4209 N Bolton Ave","addressLocality":"Alexandria","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"LA","postalCode":"71303"},"review":[{"author":"Aubrey B.","datePublished":"2015-03-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The goal of the Montessori program is to help each child reach his or her full potential in all areas of his or her life. \n  The classroom activities support the development of cognitive skills as well as social skills, emotional growth, and physical coordination. \nMontessori is synonymous with hands-on learning, providing children the opportunity to learn by doing."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sylvan Crossing Clubhouse","telephone":"(734) 433-1111","address":{"streetAddress":"23351 Redwood Dr","addressLocality":"Chelsea","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MI","postalCode":"48118"},"review":[{"author":"Michael B.","datePublished":"2021-02-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Complaint
We rent here and we love our neighbours and the community but the management sucks. When things break down or need repair, don't expect them to come, because, they will not. Three years we have waited for windows to be replaced; they leak air horribly and every year we get told that it is on the list.  The bathroom water control, to turn the water on and off, or to take a shower broke months ago.  
They insisted on a walkthrough in the midst of Covid putting our family at risk, but when I wanted to go to the office, they said that they would not let me in because of Covid.  Since then (over a month ago) they have not been back to repair a single issue.  We are still taking baths and showers with pliers (anyone that would like photo evidence of this feel free to email us).  Over three years ago when we moved in we asked them to replace the 15 year old carpet that was in disrepair, stained and honestly disgusting.  They have refused and even turned down our request to professionally clean the carpets.  All of this while still charging nearly $1600 per month.  Recently we logged online to our Sylvan Crossing account to pay our bill and saw charges in the amount of $100 for a non lease renewal fee (we have not had a lease in 2.5 years).  We were not given any notice of the increase. Just logged in and there it was. Nice business practices!
 Or how about when our terminally ill son was home on hospice?
 One evening we lost air conditioning in half the house, we called the emergency maintenance number and got a call back from management, where we were informed that they would address it in the morning.
 Our son was sweating and couldn't breathe due to the heat so  I contacted a contractor friend of mine who called an HVAC friend of his and they came over and made the repairs that night.
Management never called us back.
The electrical wiring in the home is so bad that we doubled our renters insurance coverage due to fear of loss of property. 
Would you like to have a very high sewage and water bill?  Then move here - it will be close to $200 per month.  
 The last time we posted a bad review for Sylvan crossing they promptly removed it.
 I guess it's true...
 The truth hurts."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":1,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sylvan Learning of Alexandria","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/MZaY54FlBQn8972QY_rgtg/l.jpg","telephone":"(866) 963-1308","address":{"streetAddress":"1264 Canterbury Dr","addressLocality":"Alexandria","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"LA","postalCode":"71303"},"review":[{"author":"Sharon B.","datePublished":"2021-08-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I needed a tutor for an Algebra class this summer 2021 and I researched Sylvan Learning as a tutorial assistant.
