{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Carlsbad Country Day School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/ntfRCBGgAS21gKjRH2r89w/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 804-0550","address":{"streetAddress":"5150 Hemingway Dr","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Rena E.","datePublished":"2022-04-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is a great school, probably the best private preschool you can find in the area. I made a thorough research before sending my 2 daughters there and although it is expensive, it totally worths the extra $$ . 
To begin with the half day program is 8.15-3.15pm, long enough compared to other schools. The teachers are all great. Ms Breanna, Ms Leslie, Ms Rachel, Ms Alysse etc. In half day program they also offer lunch and healthy snacks which is great.
My oldest daughter started when she was 2.5 yo and my youngest started at the Infant day care program 16mo, since the first day that I left her at the CCDS I felt safe and knew she was in the best hands. 
I have a very good experience even during covid-19 difficult time they managed to stay open and that was amazing.The staff is great, all friendly, polite and willing to help you. The only annoying part is that they do a lot of % increases in the tuition fees, which sometimes doesn't really make sense. Other than that, I give 5 stars and more, my daughters learned so many things and they were always happy during drop off and pick up time. We also met so many nice families there. 

CCDS you ROCK!"},{"author":"Gary A.","datePublished":"2022-05-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Amazing school.  Quality, caring staff.  

My daughter learned so much!  Love the grounds, great space to get out and play. 

Really enjoyed this place.  Fun learning projects, school chef (so no packing lunch / snacks!) and a fall & spring performance! 

Absolutely worth the cost if it's in your budget."},{"author":"Eugene Y.","datePublished":"2022-06-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"The owner had an appointment with my friend and was so unprofessional! On the day of the appointment, my friend did not even get to meet Melissa who she's scheduled to meet.. Another staff member who also was unprofessional met with her instead for 10 minutes and rushed the meeting."},{"author":"Elisha V.","datePublished":"2021-05-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I am rewriting my review of Carlsbad country day. Not because Yelp contacted me that someone is requesting to have it removed but because Yelp contacted me that someone was requesting it be removed and that upset me. So I went to my training session frustrated and my trainer encouraged me to take that negative energy and turn it into positive energy. So here is my effort to do so. 

I'm giving CCDS a one star because I believe this is not a healthy environment for children to learn and be supported developmentally.  As a parent whose child attended CCDS my 2 year old was restrained to a chair because after he finished snack he wanted to go play.  I saw this on camera and recorded the incident. I then immediately called the school and spoke to Ms Alize. She said she was told it was school policy to make kids at the age of two sit at the table until their friends finish snack. I told her that was NOT a developmentally appropriate practice and that I would speak to Melissa the administrator about the incident. 

I spoke to Melissa and she went to watch her video recording called me back and admitted that she saw the incident. She also said she would talk to Ms Alize. Unfortunately during the conversation I raised other concerns regarding the aggressive handling of the children at nap time, them not providing AM snacks and the overally structured learning environment. Melissa explained to me this is how she has done it for 20 years. I assured her if she is doing things from 20 years ago she has a lot to catch up on cause research shows that is not a conducive learning environment. She then said she does what works for her. I encouraged her to do what is right for the children and families. She then said maybe this is not a place for me and my child and threatened to disenroll my child. I then informed her about Title 22 regulations which do not allow that. But after seeing we had to very different philosophies I agreed that this was not a place I wanted my child. 

Melissa then refunded ALL my money. 

Because I am a mandated reporter I had to report the violation to my sons rights so I did. I notified CCLD and an investigation took place. Melissa denied the incident. 

I was very angry about the denial of what happened to my son and even more worried for no plan of correction. 

Here is the positivity... I wish Melissa and all the staff at CCDS to find it in their heart to do right by our kids. My hope is that they will find it in their heart to get properly  trained to better understand kids and how to care for and educate them in loving and inspiring ways.  I forgive Melissa and Ms. Alize and Ms. Stephanie who stood by and watched. I forgive those ladies for what you did to my son. Wishing the school, the staff and of course the kids all the best at CCDS."},{"author":"Cindy A.","datePublished":"2021-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Carlsbad Country Day school has it all! Management is wonderful. You're definitely lucky if you have the opportunity to send your child here."},{"author":"Reza E.","datePublished":"2021-04-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"My kid was at CCDS for more than two years and he had already been with  5 different teachers! so I think I have a good understanding of the CCDS and staff. 
The school has enough space to be a good day school however the problem is the management and how they run the day school as a family business. Some of the teachers are good though we also had experience with bad teachers. But the main issue is the management and lack of professionality.
Honestly, I wouldn't recommend this daycare to any of my friends."},{"author":"Lindsay C.","datePublished":"2021-01-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So happy to have our son in the infant room. Each teacher is nurturing, caring, and genuinely friendly. They do such fun and engaging activities, even with the littlest students. Highly recommend Carlsbad Country Day."},{"author":"Jennifer N.","datePublished":"2021-02-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love love love CCDS! My daughter is in Ms. Jaqueline's bilingual immersion class and we couldn't be happier. The school is very clean and the materials are kept in very good shape. The front is very responsive to any questions we have and accommodating to my ever changing schedule. Before CCD we went to a few schools that just didn't feel like home. We were hesitant to make another change by pulling our daughter out again and changing schools but now that we have found Ms. Jaqueline and the whole CCD staff, we know we made the right decision."},{"author":"Courtney G.","datePublished":"2019-05-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I am sad to say my daughter just left CCDS :-( Only because we moved out of state. She was there from March 2017 - May 2019. She was in Ms. Lupe and Ms. Mariel's Spanish immersion preschool class. Before deciding to move out state we planned for her to be at CCDS through kindergarten. 

We could not be happier with our experience at the school. The peace of mind we had as parents dropping her off each day and the love our daughter had for the school was priceless. The love and care her teachers provided was incredible to see. The environment at school feels like family. 

Tuition includes breakfast, lunch and two snacks. You never have to stress about bringing food to school. The meal plan for lunches is unlike anything I've ever seen. Definitely not your standard kids menu offerings. There's an on-site chef who prepares their meals each day. 

Another awesome feature at the school is the webcams. You can log in it at anytime and watch what your child is up to from your computer or mobile device. It was especially great in the beginning when  we were leaving her with someone we didn't know for the first time. Then was just fun to sometimes peak in and see her in her school environment. 

The last thing I will highlight is the parent/family involvement. They offer a monthly parents night out at a far less expensive rate than a babysitter and your child gets to be with their friends in a familiar environment. There's a bowling tournament for parents twice a year, a father/daughter dance, another one for mother/son and other fun events. They also have a spring and winter festival where the children perform. 

CCDS is really something special. The campus is immaculate. Everyone is so friendly/helpful, they really take pride in their work. Yes the tuition is on the higher side but it's worth every penny. You absolutely get what you pay for. A huge thank you to Ms. Melissa the director, Ms. Bailey and Ms. Nely the assistant directors. I cannot imagine all the work it takes to keep the school operating as it does... flawlessly! Ms. Lupe and Ms. Mariel, thank you for loving Miss V as your own. We will miss you both so much. Last but certainly not least Ms. Laura in the infant/toddler room. We will never forget the care you provided when we first started at CCDS. We knew she was in the best hands from day one."},{"author":"Cindy F.","datePublished":"2020-08-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Let me start by saying my daughters teacher Miss. Jackie is amazing! The school is very nice as well as their activities they do with the children. My only problem is this school is very expensive so if there is a holiday they also take the day after or before off as well. Overall nice school."},{"author":"Rebecca I.","datePublished":"2020-01-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I I wanted to share a review for Carlsbad Country Day School as this week is our last there before we move out of state.   The experience my 5 year old has had there the past  three years has been extremely positive,  both from a great social experience, but the leaps and bounds he made in learning.   I believe the school has prepared him above and beyond for kindergarten this fall.    The teachers, the methods, the overall positive environment  was phenomenal.   The school itself is safe, secure, laid out beautifully and the staff is always friendly and engaging with both parents and kids.    We will miss the Winter Festival,  field trips and occasional parent night out opportunities the staff provided.    Director Mellissa Reed has built the perfect model for young kids to learn, have fun and learn important skills that I  believe would have been difficult to get anywhere else."},{"author":"Sally S.","datePublished":"2019-03-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our son has been at this school since he was about 5 months old. He is now in the two year old program and I couldn't be more pleased with this school. The teachers are wonderful and treat our son so well.  They are up to date on child development and provide our son with so much stimulating educational experiences. He is thriving and I give this school a lot of credit. 

Most importantly, I have peace of mind that he is safe and being treated well.  The teachers communicate with us frequently regarding milestones and updates. I feel so lucky to have found this school and I highly recommend it. They also have cameras that you can access anytime which is very nice."},{"author":"Rachel F.","datePublished":"2021-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Carlsbad Country Day school is the best!!! The school is clean. The staff is outstanding. The staff go above and beyond for there students. The school has a great meal plan including lunch and snacks!! I would recommend anyone to compare this school to any other school. This school is the top of my list!!"},{"author":"Erin T.","datePublished":"2020-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Our daughter has been enrolled in Carlsbad Country Day School for a year until Covid happened and everyone was asked to stay home.  Carlsbad Country Day School had asked all parents to prepay an entire month of tuition to reserve our spot until it was safe to return.  I received a one line email from Melissa Reed the director that our spot is no longer being held for us and our deposit is non refundable.  Melissa Reed has awful customer service and treats the parents very disrespectfully.  I am one of many parents who have been mistreated by Melissa Reed.  I would absolutely not recommend this school to anyone."},{"author":"D G.","datePublished":"2020-02-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have been at CCD for 7 months now & I wish we would have found this place sooner.
My son is so excited every morning when I tell him to wake up & time to get ready for school.He's even more exited & smiling ear to ear when I pick him up.We signed up our son in the bilingual class & he loves his teacher.All
Of the teachers & staff are amazing especially the director.She's greeting our family when we walk in & always checking in on how my son doing in class & even outside of school like when he's sick.I love that she always hosts events outside of school for families to get to know each other & make memories together with the staff and teachers as well.Its even more cute that they host father daughter dances and date night for mom and son as well.They even do date nights where you can drop off your child for a few hours & squeeze a date night in with your significant other.The teachers are always working on new activities with the children.I love getting those pictures during the day .His teacher is always keeping me up to speed with what's to come the following week .In the beginning my son was a little behind on speech & I have notice a tremendous difference in him since he has started.His pediatrician has told the same thing.I think that's what makes CCD so special and different from other preschools.They truly care about your child during this crucial time of growth & I wouldn't have chosen a better to school for him to be at."},{"author":"Jamil G.","datePublished":"2020-10-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We are so grateful this school has been open throughout the COVID crisis. They have taken extra precautions to keep the children safe so parents who need to work can still function. Thank you CCDS!"},{"author":"Leighla E.","datePublished":"2019-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My words can't express how grateful we are for CCDS. I was a stay at home mom for over 2 years and am often described as a "helicopter mom." I wanted to get back into the workforce but none of the childcare care options were up to our family's standards. When we found Carlsbad Country Day we were so excited! We had big expectations and they've exceeded all of them. Every teacher cares about the kids like their own, and they even provide personalized updates on each child's progress toward developmental milestones. Healthy food, clean spacious areas, the most caring and educated staff, incredible ownership, and an overall beautiful mission. I'm convinced that CCDS is the most superior early education institution of its kind."},{"author":"Vicky K.","datePublished":"2017-09-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have had our son enrolled in CCDS since he was six months. He is our first, so it was really hard to hand him over to someone you just met. But Miss Melissa, Miss Laura and the rest of the infant teachers really made that transition for us amazingly easy! And our son LOVES it. We couldn't be happier with our choice. CCDS stood out for us for us in our daycare selection because of their curriculum. We seriously lucked out to have such great teachers as well! Miss Melissa would give me daily updates on how our son was feeling/eating/sleeping etc. and really take the time to reassure me of whatever new mom worry I had. Even in the infant area, they have structured reading/activities time which is amazing. You set the baby's feeding schedule which is really nice. 

They helped my son transition to the toddler side at one year super smoothly and lucky for us Miss Melissa moved to the toddler side with our son (he happened to turn a year old during the transition) because he LOVES her. For a while she was the only one who could console him if something was wrong. Luckily he has opened up quite a bit! The curriculum on the toddler side is even better, jam packed with activities and outdoor play and set snack/meal times as well as a two hour nap midday. They track our son's milestones as well. They caught his first series of steps on camera for me and we get monthly updates on his progress at school. In the meantime CCDS has great perks for families as well. They host a monthly parents night out where they will watch your kids (for a fee) and they even have Moms night out (which is a great way for you to meet moms of all the other kids in your kids class!)

The last thing I love about CCDS is that they're really there to help the parents out and have since I am still breastfeeding my 15 month old, we even worked out an arrangement that now works for everyone! 

Our son comes home happy every day and that is a testament to the excellent care and curriculum provided by CCDS!"},{"author":"Bobbie S.","datePublished":"2016-01-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"In case anyone is wondering why so many reviews of this school all of the sudden it's because the director specifically  asked for reviews, and is tying teacher reviews to the number of mentions, see photo. Nothing wrong but seems suspect. 

There are some really good things about CCDS. The facilities are excellent, the teachers awesome, and the curriculum worthwhile.  The school serves food, and chef Stas is wonderful. 

On the negative side, teacher turnover is very high and there always seems to be new teachers I don't recognize. I know of one class that's had at least 6 teachers in the past two years. Fees are an issue. Tuition is high, and they charge extra for special classes that should be included at $1500/month."},{"author":"Anne W.","datePublished":"2020-01-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school has been a blessing. Our daughter has learned so much and both she (and I) have made life long friendships. My husband is a marine and last month when the holidays came around and we were short on funds, Melissa, the owner, took care of our bill for us and thanked my husband for his service. You can feel this warmth and generosity from the children to the staff. It's a great school, we highly recommend CCDS."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":52}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Cherokee County Board of Education","telephone":"(256) 927-3362","address":{"streetAddress":"130 E Main St","addressLocality":"Centre","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35960"},"review":[]}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Children's House Montessori School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/X-6UEqT8V7AaFBHGOnkJhg/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 930-9041","address":{"streetAddress":"3093 Rancho Del Canon","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92009"},"review":[{"author":"Madeline L.","datePublished":"2020-04-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"To any parents looking for a quality education with a wonderful, nurturing teacher, you'll find this at Children's House Montessori. My daughter has been a student at Mrs. Manika's school for the past two years. Unfortunately, due to COVID-19, she no longer attends physically at the school. However, Mrs. Manika has continued with online learning, which has been engaging.

The best part of this program is the educator, Mrs. Manika. She is a compassionate teacher, with amazing patience. Children's House is a small, home-based program, that I was extremely fortunate to find. Mrs. Manika is very attentive to the specific needs of your child. In addition to keeping parents updated on the progress of the student, we are also invited to the school multiple times throughout the year to watch our children perform in concerts. I was most impressed when my 3 year old, at the time, gave an oral presentation to both students and adults, about penguins. I've seen my daughter blossom both socially and academically. Highly highly recommend!"},{"author":"Jessalyn F.","datePublished":"2016-08-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Children's House Montessori is a small home based preschool modeled closely after Maria Montessori's methods and philosophy of early childhood education.  The school is run by Mrs. Manika who has taken pain staking care to ensure that the children receive an excellent education with authentic Montessori materials, while nurturing and loving them.  As mentioned, the school is run in Mrs. Manika's home.  She has converted her living and dining rooms into a traditional Montessori classroom with all high quality materials displayed on shelves placed at the children's level for easy access.  She also has a small playground area in her backyard for the children to play on, and the children eat snacks and lunch together at their child size table taking turns serving each other and practicing their manners.

During the school year, Mrs. Manika hosts a winter celebration and a graduation party for families, where the children proudly perform songs and skits they have practiced, and share projects that they have made.  She also plans several field trips each year, which the children always enjoy and look forward to.  Over the years we have been to the pumpkin patch, the flower fields, the aquarium, and the Wild Animal Park to name a few. 

Shalini is a caring and loving teacher who nurtures her students.  She not only guides the children to learn the normal preschool fundamentals, but also fosters compassion, acceptance, self-discipline, respect for others and self confidence in her students.  I personally find her easy to approach when I have any questions or concerns.  I also like that she holds parent-teacher conferences each year after the winter break where we can discuss in detail my son's progress, and she has even upon my request, shared suggestions to help my child grow not only in his education, but also emotionally and psychologically.  She is very tuned into each child's personality and uniqueness.  

My experience with Children's House Montessori spans the last 5 years and will continue for the next 4 years until my daughter completes preschool. During my boys' time at Mrs. Manika's school they learned so much and often came home excited, sharing the new things that they had learned.   My oldest son entered Kindergarten very well prepared (especially advanced from the other Kindergarteners in the area of math) and transitioned nicely to elementary school.   I expect the same for my second son when he enters Kindergarten next year.  

I truly can't say enough positive things about our experience with Children's House Montessori or Mrs. Manika."},{"author":"Sharmini R.","datePublished":"2020-06-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My 3-year old has attended Children's House Montessori School for the past 4 months, and we have already observed a big change in her socially and academically. She truly enjoys school and her friends, and her verbal skills have developed rapidly since she's started. She clearly prefers this school to the large daycare she previously attended. The school clearly provides more education and development opportunities than play-based daycares. The teacher, Mrs Manika, is very warm and caring as well, and provides regular updates to parents. I expect my daughter will be well-prepared for kindergarten, and I'm delighted that she has been enjoying preschool so much. Highly recommended!"},{"author":"Mihir S.","datePublished":"2017-02-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our daughter went to this school for three years. We tried couple of other pre-schools before this one. Other schools were more of a day care/play school rather than a school which focuses on the child's development in social, educational, and personality aspects. Our daughter flourished at this school and graduated with advanced reading and math skills and confidence in herself.

This is a nice home based school run by the able and wonderful teacher Ms. Manika. We cannot say enough good things about her. The kids love and respect her. She is very organized, confident, patient and provides a curriculum true to the Montessori method. The curriculum is advanced but not difficult because it is conducted in a very structured format and catered to each individual student. The props and tools used are genuine Montessori materials. 

Our daughter made some great friends at this school. Our daughter was always very excited to wake up every morning to go to school. It is a great feeling to drop off your kid at school every morning with a big smile on their face.

There are field trips, holiday events and summer graduation parties. At the holiday and graduation parties, the kids perform in a well choreographed play and a few songs.
This is one of the highlights of this school. The kids have so much fun at these events. 

Our daughter is in Kindergarten now. Because of her years at this preschool, she is doing very well in her class. The curriculum at this preschool has helped her to become an advanced learner.
 
Looking back it was one of our best decisions. Honestly we feel blessed to have found this school for our daughter."},{"author":"Cindy C.","datePublished":"2017-02-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot say enough wonderful things about this school and the teacher Mrs. Manika. You will be amazed at the advanced level of reading, math, science, etc your child will achieve here. Two of my children each attended preschool here for 3 years each. It set them up for success for the next several years of school, since due to the progressive learning at preschool, they were advanced for kinder and 1st grade. Your child will definitely benefit from the traditional Montessori material and extremely small, family like classroom. Mrs Manika is kind, patient, organized and disciplined and the children respect and love her. Give your child the head start that will set the stage for years to come by attending this preschool."},{"author":"Ivayla C.","datePublished":"2017-01-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This school is exceptional! I found it on Google Maps and didn't know what to expect. It turned out to be a real gem. It is the first school that offers the right structure and truly lighted my daughter's interest in learning. She is always happy when I pick her up and she loves going to school every day. Mrs. Manika has a very motherly and warm attitude to the kids and besides teaching them various art, science and motor skills, never forgets to teach them values, too. My daughter learned so much about sharing, caring and sympathizing with others, as well as working in a team. There is a small number of kids at the school, so each one gets a lot of personal time and attention from Mrs. Manika. She also helps every kid to integrate in the schoolI and feel accepted and appreciated. I can't be more happy with this school! On top of all this, you don't have to pack lunch, because it is provided. I highly recommend this school!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":6}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Coast Kids Preschool","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QFtiHdx-ieLeLjlKuEM8ig/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 579-4190","address":{"streetAddress":"1330 Poinsettia Ln","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92011"},"review":[{"author":"Sharon V.","datePublished":"2020-11-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I'll start off by saying, I wish we had discovered Coast sooner. We went to a nearby preschool when my daughter was 3 and attended it for 2 years; Preschool 3's and Preschool 4's. The latter was 3 days/week but my daughter loved school so much, she wanted to go to school 5 days/week so mid-year, we enrolled her at Coast Tuesday and Thursday. I realized almost immediately, what she got from those two days from an educational standpoint, was far better than her other school. 

When COVID shut the schools down in March, they continued to do online classes and sent home lots of activities for the kids to do. They really did their best to keep the kids engaged and help parents as much as they could. 5 year olds and distance learning is not a good mix but they really did a great job. They even did fun events when we went to pick up learning materials--and even did a parking lot concert where we stayed in/near our cars and they played songs on a portable sound system where we all got to sing and dance along. It was a fun event for our family during lockdown and we really appreciated it. 

We ended up doing summer school here throughout COVID and my daughter continued to thrive. We were really pleased with how they handled everything during a very challenging time.  Alisa, the Preschool Director is such a pleasure to work with. She always did what was right for the kids and families. I was very impressed because I know first-hand, other schools did not handle the shut down with as much compassion as Alisa and Coast did. Because of our experience here over the past year, I would HIGHLY recommend Coast. You will not be disappointed."},{"author":"Gail L.","datePublished":"2019-08-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Update: We've sent 5 to this wonderful preschool now and it's still fabulous! And in response to one of the other reviewers, the school is totally secured by locked entries and you have to buzz in with security cameras watching to gain entry so it is very secured."},{"author":"Dawn F.","datePublished":"2019-05-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This preschool is AMAZING!!!  First of all it's absolutely gorgeous inside and out.  It is immaculate and they are big on hand washing and sanitizing surfaces constantly in the classrooms.  The directors and teachers are over the top... they are genuine, caring, warm, exceptional and it is evident in every corner you look, just how much love is put into the place.  The staff are very experienced, educated, loving teachers; who take pride in their lessons, their adorably decorated classrooms, and caring for their students to make them feel loved and accepted.  The children and parents who choose this school are some of the kindest individuals I have met in a long time.  My son LOVES attending here, he is learning so much, and I look forward to my other two babies attending here in the future.  If you want a clean, beautiful school, with a great playground, outstanding directors and teachers, kind children, creative/engaging lesson plans that make learning fun for your child, and a Christian foundation that encourages love and kindness, then this is the school for you.  The only downside... they set the bar so high that grade school after here is a big downgrade."},{"author":"Allison T.","datePublished":"2019-01-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love Coast Kids and adore the staff!!! My son is in his 2nd school year here and will have done 3 summers of camps before he starts kinder in the fall, and he has just blossomed, especially this year. The school is clean, fun, great super Pre-k curriculum for school-readiness and such an amazing kid/ parent community. Thank you CK for such a sweet last year of PreK for my son"},{"author":"Danielle D.","datePublished":"2015-03-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I am writing this review on behalf of 3 people one of which has a child that attends the school.   I first visited the school to set up the appointment and walked right in since the door was wide open.   The next visit I took my husband in so he can take a look before work since he wouldn't be able to attend the tour and we waited in the hallway for a full 2 minutes before anyone knew we were there.  I was immediately turned off from the lack of security but my husband noticed there was some construction going on in the area and they were probably in the process of installing one.   I agreed and made it a point to bring it up during the tour. I toured this school  a week a later...The Teachers seemed nice.   Projects and lesson plans were well thought out and the tuition was reasonable.   

At the end of the tour I asked about security.   The director of the school rudely told me and others that if security was important that we should look at other schools that have better security.   I cannot believe that I was made to look silly because I care about my son's safety.   Does this lady watch the news?   I would think they would have even more security since it was a Christian school.  

I really hope they install a gate or lock their doors on a regular basis after reading this review. In my opinion there should be 2 locked doors like most schools have."},{"author":"Nichole G.","datePublished":"2019-12-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is hands down the best school in San Diego. I can't say enough good things. Follow them on FB and you will see just what a fabulous program they run each and every day!"},{"author":"Christine S.","datePublished":"2012-10-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Very well organized.  Great positive environment that promotes learning and socialization.

My twin girls just started this year in one of the 3 yr old classes.  I  loved the flexibility offered- you can do 2,3, or 5 days a week; full or half days.  The teachers are great- very passionate about childhood education.  Most are very experienced with relevant degrees in this area.

The format is play based learning- helping kids learn academic, personal, social skills in a fun format.  It took me a while to understand what the value of all the art projects was-- but I realized that part of it is about developing fine motor skills, creative thought, practice creating shapes, seeing positive and negative space, and gaining 2D and 3D spacial awareness.  The structure of the day also helps children gain an anticipation of routine and independence.

And as a faith based school, I love that so many things are tied back to the spiritual aspects with a holistic approach.  They have chapel at least once a month as a large group."},{"author":"Chantal B.","datePublished":"2016-07-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I LOVE Coast kids. My daughter just finished 2 years here and now my other daughter is starting. I wish they went all the way up to high school. All the teachers and staff are awesome. They run a great program. Can't say enough great things! Clean, fun, friendly, loving environment."},{"author":"Girl S.","datePublished":"2015-10-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Agreed with another person who wrote a negative review about the director. 
If you are looking to surround your kids with loving & supporting adults, this is not the place for you. They run the school like business. Doesn't understand 3 or 4 year old kids are still very little and they need warm, welcoming and un-judgmental adults. My kids hated this school."},{"author":"Ashley E.","datePublished":"2015-09-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Both of my kids went to CKP, and absolutely loved it! All the teachers (we went through four classrooms...two per each kid over a four year span) were fabulous! We used the before and after care as well and never had a complaint from either child. It is very apparent that the staff truly cares and loves the kids, and it shows. I just can't say enough good things about this preschool, such special memories for our family :)"},{"author":"Diane N.","datePublished":"2015-03-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Such an awesome experience for our family.  The staff are attentive, loving, and very patient.  Our son thrived there and was well prepared for kindergarten.  They offer a variety of times you can send your child, which is nice for working parents.  My son always wanted to go to school--a very good sign!!  Thanks Coast Kids."},{"author":"Mike C.","datePublished":"2013-05-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I rarely review anything so this is short.  Both of my children have attended Coast Kids Preschool and I will be forever thankful.  They have been a tremendous blessing."},{"author":"EMarie L.","datePublished":"2015-08-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My 3 year old never participated or socialized until he attended this wonderful preschool. I moved him from another local preschool to Coast Kids and he absolutely flourished. He made is first-ever friends, played hard, learned a lot and has been having the time of his life! Not to mention, he also gets a solid Christian foundation and the support of a loving, friendly staff who truly cares. Ms. Joyce teaches one of the 4 year old classes and I can't say enough about her. Truly worth every dollar spent. We will definitely be returning in the Fall for my son's VPK year. He's excited to be returning (which is a lot, coming from a very shy little boy). Thank you Coast Kids for all you have done for him!!!!"},{"author":"Marti A.","datePublished":"2016-02-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is based on tour only.  Coast kid is compatible with schools around the are based on tours we had.  We like what coast kid has to offer but two main concerns we have: there is no kid size toilet in the entire school and as other reviewer mentioned security could be further improved."},{"author":"Vaiana A.","datePublished":"2010-04-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This preschool is outstanding! They care about the kids and provide the best teaching! The staff is amazing: they engage with the child not with their morning cup of coffee. They are very attentive with the children's personnalities as well.
The director is very hands-on as she is very aware of what's going on in her school and on the playground. She doesn't hide behind her desk.
The classes are very clean and pleasant. It's a brand new facility.
The playground is safe and fun.
There's some balance of academics: creative learning and free play.
The price is reasonnable.

In summary, everybody seems to care about the children and their growth, not just babysitting them."},{"author":"Christi H.","datePublished":"2015-06-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter has attended Coast Kids Preschool for two years now and I cannot say enough positive things regarding this school. The administrative staff and teachers are incredibly caring and nurturing with my daughter and all children that attend here. The entire staff knows my daughter by name even if she's never been a student in their particular classroom. The environment is fun, uplifting and genuinely shows a love for the Lord which is why we placed our daughter in a faith schooled environment in the first place. I'm surprised to read a review discussing the lack of security involved because I've always felt the school has gone above and beyond to place safety of high importance. My daughter was at school on the day we had the fires last year and the school stayed calm and organized while transporting all the children to a safer location and they communicated with each parent individually and I couldn't have felt better knowing my daughter was in good hands until we got to her. On a day to day safety issue ... they check all adults ID's when they come to pick up your child if they do not recognize that individual. Gates are locked, classrooms are looked after ... just because it's not a prison like security system by no means makes me feel like my child is ever in danger. This will be the last year my daughter attends as she moves to Kindergarten in September which they have greatly prepared her for. But with another one on the way ... We'll be back in a few years!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":16}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"California Music Lessons","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EIcM2J-S2t1ROypP0_tvXw/l.jpg","priceRange":"Moderate","telephone":"(760) 632-7577","address":{"streetAddress":"2712 Loker Ave W

She's wonderful. Our daughter loves learning piano from her and looks forward to her lesson each week."},{"author":"Cristine O.","datePublished":"2021-11-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My 6 yo has been taking ukulele lessons for few months now with Ms. Katie. It's a group class with two other kids around has age. It's 45 mins every Friday. I do like it because he is learning hands on how to play simple children songs and understanding the chords. He does enjoy it. Ms. Katie also sends an email after with an outline and progress report of what he learned and how he did in the class. Also says what he will need to practice on at home. 
My son really enjoys it and already I see a progression in his playing."},{"author":"Erin W.","datePublished":"2021-08-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My son (8) and I have both taken in-person lessons at the Carlsbad location: piano and vocal. 
We've had a smooth and easy experience the whole way through! 
The teachers are very talented, professional, and kind. They are also flexible and friendly. 
I am grateful for the enrichment my son and I receive every week as we embrace our creativity and cultivate our talents. The love of music is important to my happiness, and our experience here parallels my life goals of embracing and supporting the arts in all ways possible."},{"author":"Kevin C.","datePublished":"2021-06-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I found out about CML from a random ad I saw online during Covid and thought I'd give it a try. There are many teachers they have available and I took voice lessons with Jiyoung. I really loved them! As someone who's always been a terrible singer, I learned so many things during my lessons and I am a MUCH more confident singer than I am before. I'm never going to be singing on Broadway, but I highly recommend lessons even if you have no intention of ever becoming a singer or even doing a live performance. Besides being really fun, I use to feel shy about singing in the car or trying to sing someone a song that I forgot the name of the song, but the lessons has given me confidence to be more expressive with my voice. I loved that Jiyoung challenged me and pushed me to improve my vocal technique. 
Secondly, I found the CML billing platform very easy to use. They billed me via e-mail every month and it was simply a few clicks to pay and they sent a detailed invoice with every payment that was easy to save.
I can't speak on the other teachers, but for voice lessons Jiyoung is great. I will note though, that you can't just take lessons once a week and expect to improve much. Yes, just learning better technique can already dramatically improve your singing, but it also takes a lot of your own time and practice. I had to unfortunately pause lessons for now because I became busy with a lot of things, but in the future once I have some free time again I'm looking forward to starting lessons back up."},{"author":"Lauren S.","datePublished":"2021-05-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have loved CML and especially Mr. Chris, our piano teacher! 

We started piano for both my 9 year old son and 5 year daughter old during the pandemic. 

Mr. Chris has the perfect touch with little kids.  He knows how to balance kindness with firmness.  He gave positive feedback while still challenging my kids to do better and mind the details of their songs.  He was a pro at handling behavior from my high maintenance 5 year old, which is no easy feat.  

I highly recommend Mr. Chris! 

On top of that, the CML office staff is extremely friendly and competent.  They always answered my e-mails and phone calls promptly.  All around, what a great experience!  We often recommend CML to our friends."},{"author":"Mona R.","datePublished":"2021-06-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hannah is lovely. She is patient and motivates my girls. So happy to find this program. Looking forward to their musical growth. Staff is patient and efficient."},{"author":"Jaime D.","datePublished":"2019-11-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"Pro:  These people found me great piano teachers.

Cons: CMS were total fascists about tuition payments -- they often demanded it for 5 (!) weeks in advance; they always hiked their fees every year; they sent multiple notices every time that payments were late, even after I had mailed the payments; they never gave credit for  lessons that were cancelled without me having to pester them first, but they were quick to remind me that they would not provide any extra lessons during long months (i.e., months that had an extra lesson week).

Also, I really doubt that the teachers saw all that much of the payments that I was forking over to CMS."},{"author":"Jinsoon S.","datePublished":"2020-07-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My two daughters are taking voice lessons.  Their teacher is Jiyoung.  My daughters took voice lessons before and from that they've picked up bad habits. Teacher Jiyoung was able to figure out what my daughters were doing wrong and as a result I could hear the difference in their singing. There's So much difference in the my daughter sings. The teacher is firm but not harsh, she'll correct you if needed, praise you when you are doing well, she'll encourage you when you need it,...etc I highly recommend!"},{"author":"Mark K.","datePublished":"2018-10-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Update: I was called back by the company and they scheduled another lesson with a different teacher. 
My opinion of this place has totally changed. I am absolutely loving my guitar lessons. If you want to learn how to play the right way you def have to try California music studios today..."},{"author":"Lance S.","datePublished":"2018-12-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I really like these guys.  It's easy to sign up for lessons, and even easier to change an appointment.  They have great professional level instructors too.  I recommend them to anyone seeking music/voice lessons."},{"author":"Nicolette W.","datePublished":"2018-12-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I've been studying with Jennifer Paterson for months now. It's my favorite time of the week! She's helping me rediscover my voice after some medical issues. She's incredibly talented and very good at sharing her wisdom. She creates a professional and relaxed vibe that is conducive to development. She has actionable suggestions and is always willing to give extra attention. She's flexible when my schedule necessitate it and I couldn't be more grateful for her encouragement. I've worked with several voice teachers over the years and she stands out as the best!"},{"author":"Ashley J.","datePublished":"2016-01-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter recently started singing lessons with the California music studio about 2 months ago. We love it! She loves her teacher and I do too! The president of the company is very attentive and accommodating. She made sure we had what we needed and were happy with our service. We will be with them long-term. In addition, I can tell they are very picky about the teachers they choose. They are the best!"},{"author":"Frank J.","datePublished":"2018-12-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I haven't had a lesson in months and California Music Studios is still billing me. This has been a problem since the start of working with California Music Studios--even when I was out of town and my instructor told them we had no lessons, they still charged me. Now, as I said, I haven't had a lesson in months and I'm still getting charged. 

I do want to point out that my instructor was great. I honestly wish I could have worked directly with him because California Music Studios--aside from setting up the relationship--has caused nothing but problems. I understand they need to be compensated for putting together instructor and student, but they really mismanage the logistics and I'm sure are taking way too big of a cut for the "service" they provide. You're better off finding an instructor on craigslist and working with them directly. That way, the instructor makes more money and you pay less by cutting out a useless middleman."},{"author":"Brendan M.","datePublished":"2016-04-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our daughters have been receiving singing, piano and flute lessons from CMS for many years now and we couldn't be happier.  The teachers are high quality and really love teaching music.  

The exposure to playing at live events is invaluable to the learning experience and CMS works hard to help make your child's performance experience a positive one. 

If you are looking to expand your children's horizons I highly recommend CMS."},{"author":"Jessica C.","datePublished":"2017-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our sons's piano teacher had to leave abruptly, and I was panicking trying to find another teacher that would be as good and that would be willing to travel to our home.
We feel so fortunate to have found one of the teachers from CMS- his name is Ryan.  He comes to the house once a week.  He also helps our son with guitar.
Our son is 15 and has Aspergers (high functioning autism) and has perfect pitch.
Ryan is extremely patient and really great with him.  Our son can be a real challenge, as far as behavior, but Ryan handles it in stride.
We feel very grateful that we found him.  Our son is very happy to work with him as well.
Highly recommend this school because they will find your child their perfect match."},{"author":"Susan N.","datePublished":"2018-01-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"The music studio contacted me and apologized.  They also reimbursed me.  I think they made a honest  attempt to help the situation and I appreciate that."},{"author":"Linda A.","datePublished":"2018-11-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My 12-year old daughter and I are very happy with CMS. My daughter has been taking lessons for about 6 months now and she loves it! Her teacher, Daniel Griesgraber is outstanding! My daughter's enthusiasm and motivation for playing the piano is strong! It is incredible how much she has learned to play! Daniel is very enthusiastic, patient and positive with my daughter! We could feel his strong love and passion for music! We definitely recommend him!"},{"author":"Mich K.","datePublished":"2018-10-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We are so happy with CMS and our children's piano teacher. We could not be happier. On top of great experiences in the music process, it is so easy to change appointments and auto pay. The recitals are optional but we love them that the kids get this great experience!! Thanks CMS!"},{"author":"Don L.","datePublished":"2014-03-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Take your lesson somewhere else.

They also have 30 day cancellation policy which is extremely inconvenient for music lesson. You don't want to wait 30 days before you quit once you decide that the lesson isn't for you."},{"author":"Tammi F.","datePublished":"2014-04-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I am extremely happy with my experience with California Music Studios.  My daughter has been coming to CMS weekly for the past 10 months.  My daughter loves her teacher (Krystle Cruz) she is amazing, talented, patient and a wonderful teacher.  I have seen my daughter gain confidence and her vocal ability has increased dramatically.  I would recommend CMS to any one who needs or wants music lessons. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Redeemer By Sea Preschool and Kindergarten","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/6kOTMdohleHONjk5FA4Kvw/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 431-8293","address":{"streetAddress":"6604 Black Rail Rd","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92011"},"review":[{"author":"Kate S.","datePublished":"2022-11-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Absolutely love this school. My oldest started last year in TK and we loved it so much we kept her here for kinder. My youngest started this year. The staff is warm and welcoming and my daughters are learning and thriving in this environment. The campus has a nice set up with a great outdoor space that feels so comfortable and safe."},{"author":"Momo B.","datePublished":"2021-06-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I am not a member but a neighbor, and this church has been amazing to work with as a member of our community. They are responsive to any issue immediately (broken sprinklers, trees, lights broken) and so happy to communicate and reach out"},{"author":"Taryn B.","datePublished":"2022-02-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Buyer beware! We learned the hard lesson of paying the non refundable deposit at this school. We were under the assumption that covid guidelines would be enforced from county regulations. After our son attended a couple days of school, we realized what they presented was very different than what they practiced. After discussing with the director we decided that their enforcement was not what we originally signed up for. We lost our deposit when we withdrew our son because we believed the director lied to us and defended her employees about a simple issue. 

We thought it was a good school, in a great area and very moderately priced, but were sadly disappointed. Redeemer is very good at sales and getting your deposit. The business model at this school is: great sales, secure deposits, and accept waitlisting lists- but when you find out what you are getting at this school it's very different than what they sell. Covid has made this a difficult time, but there are certain rules that businesses need to follow. Redeemer does not follow these guidelines and they say they do. 

Looking at the other reviews it seems like I'm not the only one who has lost deposits here, that is sad this is what their business is about. We are happy now at a different preschool that does not require 1 month tuition up front- also our new preschool keeps doors and windows open for ventilation which Redeemer does not."},{"author":"Kathleen C.","datePublished":"2021-07-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I had high hopes for this school, as I had heard our new neighbors say what a wonderful experience they had at this school over the years (later I learned it was because of a different Director) Unfortunately, what transpired over the course of 4 1/2 months was highly unacceptable in how this preschool treated my sweet 5 year old son.
We moved during Covid and had picked this school out of many in our new area. My son was eager to begin school after having his last school cut short, due to the pandemic. The director was seemingly pleasant when we met her & the school had reasonable rates for what it was. My son was in the "TK" class.
We realized soon after starting that a couple of moms in the class had it out for our son. He was a little too rambunctious for these kid's mom's and we realized later, that he was being bullied. Always labeled "bad" or "naughty" by the kids in his class & he was always getting tattled on for anything he did. Naturally, my son began to act out; there were a couple of incidents that were normal playground type behavior, but we felt there was something more going on. We asked his teacher almost daily how he was doing, was anything going on, etc. and she would always say, "i'll let you know if anything happens, he is totally fine. There is NOTHING to worry about. He's just being a normal 5 year old boy." Her words. Also, she let us know in a meeting we had with her later that she never uses the words "bad" or "naughty" in her classroom & that those names must be coming from somewhere else (ahem, other kid's parents). Judging by my son's behavior at home, at how he used to cry at night before school, we knew there was something going on. I mean how, in a classroom of 10 kids with 2 teachers can you not realize what is happening??
About to get to the worst part about this school- THEY HAVE A 3 STRIKES POLICY FOR PRESCHOOLERS.
We didn't realize this so called policy even existed until later- when we wanted to pull him out of this terrible place. There is nothing in the parent handbook, school policies, etc. It sounds like it was almost made up, so that they could push us out. We even had a sit down meeting with his teacher face to face, where she told us he was a perfectly normal 5 year old kid & he's just learning- like the rest of the class. She wanted to make us feel like he wasn't a bad kid & that she had his back.  She made zero mention about him having had 2 strikes at this point.
Also during these incidents, my son was sent to the Director's office without notifying us first. Can the teacher's not handle the incident themselves?? That should have been a red flag.
It seems that Redeemer is more worried about the opinions of overbearing & non empathetic parents rather than trying to help & improve the child.  There should have been some type of plan for my son, but I guess they lack the resources & education on this front.
Had they wanted him to stay, they would have created a plan or let us in our their secret 'policy' that he was almost at 3 strikes and that maybe we should consider looking at different schools/options we may have.
I only hope I can warn other parents in the area that if they have a typical 5 year old boy who is a bit active, they should probably steer clear of Redeemer.  As a Christian school, I would have thought they would have more empathy.
I was hopeful this school would provide the nurturing care that my son needed to grow academically, socially and emotionally. In taking the actions they have, they have failed him.
Partnerships between parents and teachers are imperative to a child's total growth. The communication skills to parents at Redeemer are severely lacking.
We hope that maybe they will change their policy so another family doesn't have to go through what our son did & crush our child's confidence & well being.
*** As a follow up several months after pulling him from Redeemer, he is noticeably more happy, confident & is now enjoying another school. His new teacher has even said this about him recently "He is friends with everyone in class and has been such a great addition to our class. He is an absolute JOY to have in our class."
It was clearly the wrong school for my son. It's unfortunate how they treated us, my son & just having a significant lack of empathy of being a nice human. Do better, Redeemer!!!"},{"author":"M M.","datePublished":"2021-03-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I have been sending my children here since 2015. The teachers are wonderful (hence the 2 and not 1 star). They really are the stars of the show. My kids were very ready for kindergarten and I attribute that to the teachers!

My problem is with the administration. Since coming to this school, I have been through two previous directors before the current director. The previous directors were great, always available, and open to suggestions and ideas. I do recognize the uphill battle this director has had to endure with COVID and all of the precautions they are required to take.

BUT......They didn't require masks. They followed OSHA, etc and their recommendations. These websites did recommend that they "try" to enforce mask-wearing, which was not done at all. It seems they took what they wanted from these sites and claimed that three year olds would not be able to wear masks.

When I pressed for an answer as to why they couldn't just mandate masks on their own, I was either ignored or sent a copy and pasted answer that didn't answer my concerns. They could not answer why they just simply couldn't mandate masks. It is not that hard to make that decision for your own school when it is proven to help prevent the spread. Why would you not do all you can to protect these kids?

I unfortunately had to pull my two kids because I felt like they were not doing everything in their power to keep them safe. On top of this, I was being ignored and dismissed with all of my concerns. I would have been happy to open a discussion, but this was never offered. Something the administration should always be available to do.

Again, I do love the teachers and curriculum, and after all of this, they eventually enforced mask-wearing (yay!). Unfortunately, we had already unenrolled and were never invited back."},{"author":"Cheryl C.","datePublished":"2021-09-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I'll preface this review by noting that our experience was a few years ago, with a previous director. Two months after our 3 year old daughter started at Redeemer, she was diagnosed with cancer, and had to stay home for treatment the rest of the school year. By that point, she was already attached to her teachers and classmates, several of whom she knew even before starting there. Seven days after her diagnosis, I specifically emailed the director asking that her spot be saved for her, as we were going to fight as hard as we could for her to get better, and return to her class. By the spring, I realized I hadn't heard from the school about fall enrollment, and when I emailed the director, she said our daughter's spot was taken and she could be put on a waitlist. Our then- four year old daughter had fought hard and bravely to be able to return to normal life and her class- she would have been devastated to not return to her teachers and friends- and after a lengthy email and offer to go to the local news with our story, her spot fortuitously opened up. After her treatment was done, we also heard from several parents in the school that they had tried to plan fundraisers and other events for our daughter, but all of those ideas were shot down by the director. All of her teachers there were good teachers, in fairness, but hopefully your child won't get a life-threatening illness while at Redeemer, because our experience with a supposed Christian school is that you will get no support at all."},{"author":"Christine S.","datePublished":"2016-11-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Well balanced preschool program that focuses on the whole child.
I've visited a number of preschools in the area, including one down the street which we loved, so I can say that this is a really great place for kids.

It is more structured than other preschools in some regards, and has a stronger academic focus. My 4 yr old goes in and she is immediately tasked with practicing tracing and writing letters with her peers at the table. She is also exposed to phonics as they focus on a new letter each week and practice the sounds in a song.  She usually does a craft each week that involves coloring with crayons and gluing pieces together in a collage type format. Not much painting (I'm guessing that some parents object to paint on clothes)

There are also additional classes offered: Spanish, Art, and Science. These are hr long classes offered in the afternoon. After just one class in Spanish, my daughter came home singing songs in Spanish!

The teachers and admin team are super organized and very friendly. They have very strict policies in place, including no nuts of any kind on campus. I got a note when I sent a granola bar in my daughter's lunch and the label read "May contain a trace amount of peanuts..."

It is very much like an elementary school in some regards- complete with room moms and field trips.

In any case, a great choice for preschool education!"},{"author":"Frustrated Parent P.","datePublished":"2018-06-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"We had a pretty awful experience with Redeemer through the sign up process. We signed up our daughter after being on the waitlist, and paid a non-refundable deposit for tuition, supplies and registration fee. You have no choice but to sign this as you sign up. A couple months later, we got a diagnosis our daughter had a special need and needed therapy, but the only time to do that was during the time we had class at Redeemer. The other option Redeemer gave us was in the afternoon sessions which didn't work for us, since we work. We withdrew 2+ months before school began and they replaced her spot but refused to give us back our deposit, even after we laid out the circumstance to them. 

We had to take them to court to try to recover it. The judge ruled that even though it's bad business for them to do this and a bad way to treat families of those you're supposed to be helping, they could keep the nearly $500 because they offered us an option B (an option which didn't work for us).  This, also despite the fact that the CA Supreme Court has ruled non-refundable deposits ARE refundable if a replacement "buyer" (student) is found. They can't legally enrich themselves over our unfortunate circumstance, but they--a church preschool--opted to do that. 

We are very frustrated, and not the first family to deal with this. Be wary of what you sign, and the fact that Redeemer's people don't necessarily have your best interests in mind, even when it comes to an unforeseen circumstance surrounding a 3-year-old."},{"author":"Cara M.","datePublished":"2019-09-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love this school. The teachers are amazing, my child is learning tons and I love all the bonus program options."},{"author":"Karie T.","datePublished":"2017-04-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Warning: This is going to be long

I enrolled my 3 year old in the afternoon class twice a week. I chose afternoon because of the smaller class size since this was his first time in a school environment. In August when he started, the class had 8 children. After fall break, we came back to a full class of 15. This really had an effect on my son in a negative way. He no longer wanted to go to school. I think a big part of this was the noise. the class became VERY Noisy and he just didn't seem to like it.  it got to the point where it was a constant battle trying to get him in the car. He would scream and cry and kick etc. I contacted the school several times regarding this asking for advice. I spoke to his teacher a few times and the director a few times. In late February I spoke to the director again, at which point we both agreed to pull him out for the remainder of the year and try again the next fall. This was at the same time that the fall registration was due. We didn't want to lose his spot for next year but we were also struggling with what to do. We ended up submitted the $625 fee and registration a day late, which they were not pleased about.

 During his "break" I contacted my older sons former Preschool teacher to see if we could go and "visit" her school.( I would have chosen her school to begin with but we moved and she was much farther away. ) She has a very quiet preschool of 6 kids. he loved it from the minute we went to visit. She happened to have an open spot during the afternoons for the rest of the school year so we decided to enroll him through June.

Seeing how much he enjoyed going to the new school, we decided to keep him there for next year and let Reedemer know that he would not be attending the next school year (which starts in August 2017) I then asked for our deposit back. ( $175 was the supply and registration fee and $450 was the cost of tuition for the month of June 2018. June 2018 is a full 15 months away! 

They replied that I would not be getting any of my $625.00 back.

 I understand keeping the deposit and supply fee of $175 since we were "holding his spot" BUT I do not understand nor agree with them keeping the $450 tuition fee for a tuition that will occur 15 months from now.  When I brought this to their attention, they ignored my email for several weeks.

Yes, I signed a contract and i understand that. However, They made ZERO effort to work with us. Especially knowing we were having problems prior.

It gets better! 

Today i finally received a response. They had the nerve to state that I actually owed them March tuition of $280 AND a late fee of $25.00!. When I spoke to The director in February and she agreed that I should pull my son out, there was NO mention of owing  March tuition.  On March 7th, i was asked to send an email back stating my intentions to pull my son out for the remainder of the year for their records, with again, no mention of March tuition. I sent my intentions email on March 8th. 

Here was part of their response that I received today:

"Based on this information, the required 30 days written notice per your signed agreement ended on March 24th, therefore, the March tuition in the amount of $280 was due by March 5th.  It was not received by that date and a late fee of $25 was added for a total of $305 and as of this date, remains unpaid." 

I signed that agreement 10 months ago. it's amazing I didn't remember the part about the written notice! 

Please note, my son did not attend a single day in March, which they were aware of in February.  

One more thing I wanted to add:

In our conversations, they thought a part of the reason for this behavior was because I was giving in to his tantrums of not wanting to go to school.  Honestly, a few times, yes. I felt bad that he screamed and cried about going. I wanted him to want to go to school. I didn't want this to be a punishment or a negative experience. They made me feel like I was not being a good mom and that he was throwing the tantrums because he knew he would get to stay home.  One day I dropped him off and he was crying and clinging to me asking to go home. The teacher just told me to walk away as she picked him up and carried him away. he was reaching for me and screaming and crying.  I felt awful about it but I walked away. 

Fast forward a month of him being in the new school. ( he had about a week or two break between schools) Not ONCE has he thrown a tantrum about going to school. Not once has he kicked and screamed and begged to stay home.  This speaks volumes.  

Their mission appears to be aimed at making money. They are all about the fine print with no regard to our personal situation and how it may be affecting us.  I have three small children, one with medical issues,  to take care of and the last thing our family can afford is to pay money for something like this.   

So much for christian values and caring about families. I will NEVER recommend this school to anyone!"},{"author":"Nikki M.","datePublished":"2016-12-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"We are in our second year here and my daughter loves it! The teachers are all very friendly and warm. The playground is super cute with lots of areas for the kids to play. The classrooms are big, clean, and everything is made from wood! They have locked gates and a teacher at each one for pick up and drop off. My only complaint is I wish we had opportunities to meet with the teachers to discuss progress of child. They don't offer that until they are 4, and only once half way through the year. In addition, I feel like they could do better at communicating some things, but overall we are pleased to be sending our daughter here."},{"author":"J M.","datePublished":"2017-03-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Poor service and lack of empathy from front office.  Lack of educational structure and teachers and staff are indifferent.  Would not recommend."},{"author":"Ursula M.","datePublished":"2016-12-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"We had been a family with 3 children at this school for the past 5 years. There have been recent changes that include a new school director. I have been compelled to withdraw my 2 girls who were in the Kindergarten program and in the 3's program. This new director is so rude and dismissive of parental concerns. It is obvious to me that she does not care much for the families at the school. This used to be a sweet, family orientated, nurturing school environment - not anymore. So sad. Miss Dee seems more like a stone faced, cold hearted prison warden than a nurturing preschool director. If you want your children to feel safe, secure and loved look elsewhere. I would imagine most of the teachers who have been there for years will soon be leaving working under this new director. They have already lost a kindergarten teacher and quite a few families have withdrawn from the school with similar complaints like ours. I honestly don't know how this woman is working in a preschool."},{"author":"Jennifer R.","datePublished":"2017-11-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"As a mother, we all want to find the best, the most caring and trusted preschool for our little ones. And I found that in Redeemer By The Sea Preschool. Like many of you,  I toured quite a few preschools before we landed on Redeemer By The Sea Preschool. When my family needed the care, Ms. Dee the director and Ms. Rhonda were there to advise and provide what my family needed. Before enrolling, I toured the school twice. Every time I was there early, I observed that other kids seemed to enjoy being there.  My son James has been super-well-taken care of and taught by Ms. Bonnie and Ms. Nina. I just enrolled him in the Enrichment program ago since September, but so far it's been great and he learns to love art. I even sat and observe in both Enrichment classes (Art and Spanish) unexpectedly since I forgot I enrolled him in Enrichment program and I came to pick him up early. A few points I want to make. (1) For the lady who complained about the noise of the 15 children class. My son is extremely sensitive to noise. But so far he has no problem and he can't wait to go to school. Mind you, my son is in the AM class. My only guess is your son (who might have been 3 or 4 at the time) might need his nap/rest instead of going to the PM class. When kids that age get tired, they'd cry and act out since they did not know how to express what they needed. (2)This school is very well-organized and the parents need to read the documents and the contracts of what we are signing. I knew I didn't and I missed out on important details. Fortunately, my overlook in the details did not cause me any monetary setback.  And I learnt from this mistake to always read carefully what paper/documents that come to my hands.  (3) Every preschool will always function as a business, regardless of if it is church affiliated since it will serve a variety of different parents and different personalities. Without written documents and rules, then chaos will definitely follow.  (4) I toured enough preschools around Carlsbad to attest that Redeemer By the Sea preschool is the best choice in this area."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2.5,"reviewCount":14}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Agua Hedionda Lagoon Discovery Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/GP3QDOQbb9-vkmXsNQ_rIA/l.jpg","telephone":"(760) 804-1969","address":{"streetAddress":"1580 Cannon Rd","addressLocality":"Carlsbad","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92008"},"review":[{"author":"Alize R.","datePublished":"2022-06-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"What a great find. It's also kept so clean and It's overall a welcoming environment. We loved it so much we signed up for their family membership when we got home (can be done online) which is $60 a year and tax deductible. I love that we could support a place like this. My kiddo loved it and we will be coming back to explore some more. Thank you to the staff who took the time to show him some of the animals."},{"author":"Caroleann B.","datePublished":"2022-04-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"For the short time my grandkids and I visited one day, they had a very eventful or I should say fun day. That's ok, since I purchased a family membership this will give us plenty of time to explore everything at our leisure.  

This place gives the children the opportunity to learn about plants some reptiles and to be creative.  You have the chance to enjoy time indoors with some learning tools/games and a chance to be outdoors on the trail or feeding the pet turtle and don't forget the secret garden. 

The staff is very friendly and helpful.  This will be a nice little couple of hours getaway for the grandkids, even myself, to discover and learn.

They do have some trinkets as well as snacks for purchase at the front.  Come check the place out with your littles."},{"author":"Cerena P.","datePublished":"2022-02-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place was so cute! I originally looked up "hiking" and stumbled upon this place on Yelp. Once arriving I was blown away at this hidden gem! 

They have lots of animals you can check out, falcons, owls, turtles. Then walking into the building (free) they had more animals! Lots of reptiles, guinea pigs, and star fish, all whom you can hold. It was so fun! 

The hiking trail isn't much of a hike, it's just a short walk down to the lagoon and back up. WARNING be careful if you decide to walk down there as my friend and I came across a bobcat who was stalking us (see vid). 

Other than that super fun and cute place!"},{"author":"Howie K.","datePublished":"2022-02-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"What a cool little find!

One of the things I really dig about Yelp is the way it can enrich the time that would otherwise pass unnoticed. We'd made the obligatory trip to the mall to buy the bathing suit someone forgot to pack for San Diego, and now we had, oh, maybe 90 minutes before we were due somewhere else. What to do? I Yelped "childrens activities" and this random thing popped up. Shall we discover? Sure!

This Center serves mainly as a daycare educational facility, but they'll give you a tour, and you should donate, it's worth while. Alongside caring for all sorts of orphaned animals, they staff the place with kids on various spectrums -- that was our impression, anyway -- who are super informative and dedicated to their conservation and research efforts. Our eleven year-old wasn't terribly engaged, but she enjoy petting sharks and handling coral, and the hike around the property was memorable. If you have younger kids, definitely visit, there's plenty to discover around here."},{"author":"Chris R.","datePublished":"2022-06-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is a hidden gem.
