{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Circus Arts Institute","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/jitpzUhUm8zb86mpkcL22g/l.jpg","telephone":"(404) 549-3000","address":{"streetAddress":"2969 E Ponce De Leon Ave
Ste 370","addressLocality":"Decatur","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"GA","postalCode":"30030"},"review":[{"author":"Camille R.","datePublished":"2017-04-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Let me start by saying, I'm from Arkansas, and have driven to Atlanta 3 separate times to attend the Aerial Teacher trainings and certification courses at CAI. I've also brought several of my staff with me on these trips to do teacher training (I own a Circus studio in Arkansas). 

The owner, Carrie, is an amazing woman with over 25 years of experience under her belt in circus arts and therapy. She feels like a second mom to me!  The studio space at CAI is homey, cozy and super safe. It's perfect for intimate feeling trainings.

The teacher trainings are thorough and include tons of information on safety. Safety is a huge aspect of CAI and they all do a great job with creating boundaries, rules and guidelines. The instructors have grown up in Carrie's program and most of them have been doing circus arts since they were small children. 

If you are just a trickster or looking to become an Aerial performer I would suggest a different training space (although you could totally do that at CAI). I feel that CAI is ideal for kids, teens, families, children with special needs, and teachers looking to become certified or do the Circus Arts therapy program. That being said, they are amazing with beginners, so if you're starting from square one with circus or aerial they will give you all the tools you need to progress."},{"author":"Jennifer E.","datePublished":"2013-03-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Every year, I try something different to change my perspective - hot yoga (loved it), pole dancing (not so much, but loved the studio), and aerial yoga to name a few.  This past year I tried an intro class at the Circus Arts Institute in Atlanta and loved it.

It wasn't a sweaty aerobics workout and I didn't challenge my weight lifting or range of motion limits. What I did do was learn safe baseline techniques for trapeze and rope work, and picked up a hula hoop and juggling, neither of which I'd done in years... maybe decades.  Oh - and it was really FUN.

If I lived in Atlanta full time, I think I'd be a CAI regular. Since that's not exactly in my cards, I'm content with dropping in periodically and logging some play time."},{"author":"Amelia J.","datePublished":"2014-08-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I came here several years ago twice-- both times for the Saturday morning class. For what it's worth, this isn't really meant to be the sort of class you go to over and over-- it's an intro class-- but I had two different friends that wanted to go, so I went twice!

The class is a fun way to spend a Saturday morning. You get to participate in a smattering of circus acts, which is cool-- but none of them are exceptionally unique or fun. For example-- you get to walk on a wire that's a foot or so off the ground. You juggle some scarves. You climb a rope. You do some basic gymnastics on a static trapeze that's just barely high enough that you don't hit your head when you hang from your knees. Cool-- but I didn't feel very circus-y, frankly. Also, I see this class listed as an awesome "alternative workout" in various places, and it's really not much of a workout, unless you are very very out of shape.

I will say that the owner, Carrie, is very kind and clearly passionate about her studio. The place is charming and home-y, and the cats that roam around are delightful. That said, I was never really sure who was teaching the class? It felt like advanced students were just dropping in to instruct, but I was never sure who the actual pro was or who was "in charge", so to speak. While I was there, the instructor ran across his room to answer his cell phone; BUT, I'll hand it to Carrie, she was ON THAT and clearly unhappy with him. I appreciated how close an eye she was keeping on the staff, even if they are mostly advanced students themselves.

All in all, this was a cool thing to do, but I don't know that I'd go back a third time and wouldn't sign up for regular classes (in large part because I was never really sure when/how to do so?). I wound up signing up for aerial silk and trapeze lessons at the Sky Gym, which is a little better organized and more skill-specific."},{"author":"James H.","datePublished":"2010-08-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I'm sure the fitness-conscious have been aware of the non-traditional work-out industry for a while now--the aim is to get people into an activity rather than simple weightlifting or working on machines.  Yoga, tai chi, rock climbing--all of these activities involve a certain body awareness and require a basic level of core strength and fitness, and they're usually fun enough so you're never really thinking about sets and reps and muscle groups.

Last night, I encountered one the toughest but most-enjoyable workouts when I went to the Circus Arts Institute.  Located in a loft complex near Dekalb Ave, I joined a number of students (I was one amongst four beginner students, in particular) for a 90-minute session consisting of a pretty strenuous warm-up and cool-down as well as activities including tightrope walking, rope climbing, and trapeze.  I would find myself both wired and tired after the session, the excitement and fun of what we did clashing with the unexpected amount of exertion required.

Everyone here is all smiles and encouraging, eager to see you succeed in anything that you might try."},{"author":"Sadie S.","datePublished":"2008-08-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I'd been thinking about taking aerial lessons for three or four years, maybe longer - since before I got into burlesque. So, yeah, the circus classes aren't necessarily related to my tassel and glitter endeavors. (Maybe it was sparked by Yvette calling me Cirque de Sadie and suggesting it should be my stage name.) Whatever. Every few months, we'd be at an event and there'd be girls up on a trapeze or in the, um, circle-thing. 

"Freakin' amazing!" I would say to myself. "I can totally do that." I looked into it, and bookmarked the Circus Arts Institute web site. Then another year passed, until a few of us were talking about pole dance classes. I'd like to give that a try, too, but first I had to put up and give the trapeze a go.

I enrolled in May for a 12-week session. Carrie Heller, who runs - and lives in - the Institute, is really fascinating. She encourages everyone to do cardio outside of class; she talks about diet and nutrition; she has a degree in physiology, I think, as well. 

In the first class, I climbed the Spanish Web (the rope), got up on the trapeze, and attempted walking the tight wire and juggling. Not so good with the juggling. Next class, I tried rings and loved it... got totally hooked. 

For my birthday this year, Bryant got our friends to contribute to a gift certificate for a second session. Some of them came to the last night of the first session, which was a sort of show-off day. I did a rings routine; nothing too hard, but it certainly demonstrated what I had learned over the first couple of months. 

Now, my second session is halfway complete. I'm going to have to re-allocate some funding to continue with it. Circus/aerial training is the crack - highly recommended crack."},{"author":"Devon O.","datePublished":"2010-11-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"There is a special place in heaven for Circus Arts and their teachers.  Rarely have I experienced so much kindness, love, and patience directed toward my children.  My kiddos continue to eagerly anticipate circus class every Monday and everyone who works there is a shining example of humanity.  I know that sounds hyperbolic but it's sincerely meant.  Dude, they even took us to Cirque du Soleil.  My children's lives were a little more magical because of it.

Carrie, the owner, is always thinking about how to best encourage and challenge each of them as individuals.  My daughter can't wait for circus camp this summer and my boy is so proud of his expanding tightrope walking and juggling skills. 

If you want to experience some seriously groovy and heartwarming kid stuff, take them to circus class.  One of these days I'll get around to surrendering to the love myself."},{"author":"M A.","datePublished":"2010-07-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Whoa, talk about a fun but difficult work out! If you thought a trapeze looked easy... think again. The amount of upper body strength required for that is insane! Amazing, amazing work out, though, and fantastic instructors to boot.

Your first class is all about teaching you the ropes: literally. Rope climbing, trapeze, tightrope walking, juggling, and balance board or a special little class like I was treated to last night. Most of the activities require a lot of core and upper body strength, though you'll be using every part of your body. Juggling wasn't too difficult as you're using fabric... and it's certainly easier when you don't have a physics teacher grading you for how many reps you can do (true story).

Best part of class was the special session our group had. One guy, Steve, was more than happy to show us acrobatic basics. Imagine me, a little five foot thing, being able to lift up my 6 foot 3 inch boyfriend off the ground with my legs. No, really! Steve taught us how to do that as well as a few other basic moves, and within a few minutes I was not only lifting my boyfriend, but he had someone stand up on my boyfriend so now I've got two people relying on me 100%. Amazing feeling to be able to do that!

This is so fun! Even if you only come once, it's certainly a positive experience to have. Everyone here from student to instructor is encouraging and helpful, always ready to show you something new you never thought you'd ever be able to do. You'll earn that bow and a cheer in no time!"},{"author":"Jill S.","datePublished":"2010-06-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I was set out to find a flying trapeze class in the Atlanta area (think Carrie Bradshaw's trapeze experience in SATC, The Series)...ok, so this is no NYC so no flying trapeze (yet, just watch, someone will read my review and bring it to the A), but nonetheless, Circus Arts gave me a great well rounded trapeze experience and more. 

I was a tad bit late for my lesson, but the instructors was very nice and didn't trip about my tardiness. We started off with stretches and boy oh boy did I need that (and more). 

Depending on your class size (not sure of the max no. of participants), you'll be split into small groups to learn the following: 
**Basic Trapeze moves 
**Rope Climbing 
**Tightrope walk (no worries, its maybe a foot off the ground or less) 
**Juggling (starting with scarves, yes, scarves and it ain't easy) 
**Balance boards 

I would definitely go back to properly learn how to breath (I was holding my breath a LOT while hanging upside down, no good Jill!). The instructors spot and encourage you the entire time, which helped to calm me tremendously. 

The only 'not so great' aspect I could think of is that I zoomed by the gate a couple times before realizing the gate. Maybe a sign on the gate could help. Otherwise, perfect!"},{"author":"Kim N.","datePublished":"2015-04-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Super fun! Come here with an open mind and you will not be disappointed. For the record, we did not stretch for 50 mins like some other reviewer mentioned. We of course stretched a little before & afterwards. The rest of the class was dedicated to playing on trapeze, Spanish web, tight rope, balancing board, & juggling. This is an intro class so don't expect to do crazy tricks right away; it's meant to give you a little taste of the classes they offer at CAI. That being said, we still did some very awesome poses & flows on the trapeze & Spanish web. Overall, I think it was a great intro class, which makes me want to come back for more classes; Michael was so nice & helpful."},{"author":"Katie W.","datePublished":"2011-10-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This is definitely a non-traditional workout and it's very fun. Before going here, bear in mind that this is not an aerial yoga class nor is it a circus-inspired cardio workout. You will execute actual circus moves and techniques, with particular care paid to your safety and the safety of those around you. I know someone who was disappointed in the structure of the class because they wanted to jump right in and start flying, but that just cannot happen in all practicality.

When you take the intro class, you will be assigned to a group and you will rotate between various stations. One is the Spanish web (which most people would probably describe as rope climbing), another is the stationary trapeze (no flying here), then there's the tight rope and juggling, and finally human pyramid building. At each station, everyone in the group gets to try the routine there, and you can repeat it if there's enough time. I've been to two classes and at the end of one of them, the instructors did demos on the high trapeze and the Spanish web - very cool.

Even though this is not an aerobic workout, it is definitely a strength and balance workout and will likely work some muscles you haven't used for a while. It's also really fun to do things I don't normally do in my workouts.

The instructors are really nice and they keep track of whether you've been there before so you can start with something more advanced the next time you go. It may not be your thing but it's definitely worth checking out and giving it a try (they have Groupon and Living Social deals occasionally, which are a great way to try out a class)."},{"author":"Rachel B.","datePublished":"2014-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I was beyond excited to see this deal on Groupon for an hour and a half beginner's class for just $23. It wasn't worth a dime. I'm originally from the northeast and have taken beginner's circus arts classes in the past that were physically challenging, well-organized, and in a very comfortable environment. Circus Arts Institute was the complete opposite of that. The room itself is small and dark with only one trapeze and one Spanish web. The class said it had room for 20+ students, but felt cramped with just 7 of us. The instructor was a complete waste. He was cocky, a show-off, and unprofessional. He made myself and my girl friends feel very uncomfortable, kept complaining about how hungry and tired he was (I am a full-time student and work full-time, you don't have to tell me twice what tired is like), and spent more time showing off his own skills than actually helping us as students to improve our own. We each got one chance to climb and one chance to do a series on trapeze. In an hour and a half class we spent at least 50 minutes stretching (yes stretching is necessary, but this was just ridiculous), 2 minutes on trapeze, 2 minutes on Spanish web, and the rest of the class throwing around scarves and calling it "juggling". I was so incredibly disappointed in this class and my friends were as well. What I thought would be a challenging and fun workout turned into a waste of time and money without even a drop of sweat to be shed. I would definitely not return to CAI and would not recommend this to ANYONE."},{"author":"Autumn S.","datePublished":"2009-09-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"When you walk in you are greeted by smiling happy faces. They offer many exciting lessons. I never thought I would get to swing on a trapese, climb the webb, walk a tight rope, etc... This class is fun, I get a great upper body work out and the people who attend are great. The instructors are very knowledgeable and understanding of your limits. I love it and highly recomend it to anyone.

    * Pros: I've tried things I've always dreamed of trying
    * Cons: None that I can think of"},{"author":"Gill B.","datePublished":"2012-06-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"The Circus Arts Institute is a fun place to go for an off-the-beaten-path type of class.

I went with two of my friends using a Half Off Depot coupons. The classroom was rather small. I was expecting more of a studio feel, but it felt as if we were gathering in a loft apartment. There was a good-sized group of us (about 20), so space was definitely tight. We spent a good part of the class waiting in line for people to take turns on the equipment (i.e. the trapeze, the climbing rope, the tightrope).

The staff was friendly and enthusiastic, but you could tell that they were really trying to push their t-shirts and their other classes. While I enjoyed having my big moment on the trapeze and working on some of my balancing techniques, I would not pay full price to go back there. If another deal comes up I might check it out again, but a return visit is not at the top of my list. I get a better workout from my yoga classes."},{"author":"Tami L.","datePublished":"2014-02-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I participated in the introductory Sat morning class.  It started late as over half the people who registered for the class still hadn't arrived.  That was ok because the instructor asked if we could all stay later and no one had a problem with that.  

We then broke down in groups of 5.  We didn't get much time on the trapeze as only one person could use it at a time,  and we only got one turn.  :(  The 
Spanish Web was the same thing.  But one turn was really all I needed as my upper body strength was not even close to what I thought it was.  :(.  

We did spend quite a bit of time juggling with the scarves.  It was more challenging than I thought it would be,  and I  have been juggling at home with plastic bags at home,  like the instructor  suggested.  It is so much harder than I would have guessed.  

The balance boards were also more challenging that it would seem.  I am also looking into purchasing one of them for my home.  :)  

All in all I really enjoyed the experience.  My 20 something daughter was disappointed and felt like she still needed to work out when she got home."},{"author":"chantal D.","datePublished":"2009-09-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"love this place!

When I first walked in and saw the equipment I was a little nervous, but it wasn't long before I was hanging upside down with a smile on my face. The staff is very knowledgeable and are very encouraging praising every baby step I made. They are also patient and very safe. I was guided through every move with a spotter which made it easier for me to let go of my fear.

The other students were great too, smiles and "great job"s everywhere.

I can't tell you how much fun I had and what a workout!

If you are looking for something new and exciting to try, are looking for a good workout, or just always dreamed of being in the circus (even for just one night a week) this school is for you!

P.S. I love it so much I fly from Michigan every other month just to take classes!"},{"author":"Zewditu D.","datePublished":"2012-11-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I saw a voucher deal for a 90-minute introductory class for adults and thought it would be an interesting change of pace from my aerobics classes.  The classes consisted of a warm-up and cool-down (nice stretching), rope climbing, tightrope walking, and a trapeze routine. Everyone in the class and the instructors were all really nice. And you didn't feel like an idiot if you messed up or had difficulties with things.  I wasn't as scared as thought with the trapeze routine.  But I wasn't able to do the "difficult" move that looked easy to the instructor.  I sucked at the rope climbing, but was happy to get a couple tries at it.  The instructors and classmates were very patient with everyone. The tightrope was easier than it looks.  The cloth juggling was interesting, but pretty boring.  There is a lot of downtime so don't expect this to be a full workout.  Just something ancillary.  I would recommend this to anyone who is interested in a fun night of "exercise" or anyone who always wondered what it would be like to be in a circus."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":16}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Paideia School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/8f9utzmr0-DuWQallGdEUQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(404) 377-3491","address":{"streetAddress":"1509 Ponce De Leon Ave NE","addressLocality":"Atlanta","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"GA","postalCode":"30307"},"review":[{"author":"Squirrel L.","datePublished":"2007-02-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"After 9th grade, when my public school became so violent and overcrowded that it was no longer safe, I got sent to Paideia.  My 3 years here were the best years of my entire educational career  - including college and grad school!  This place really is the most amazing school ever.

I remember my first day just like it was yesterday.  I was accompanied by one of my best friends, who was also making the big switch to a more civilized school.  We sat in front of the bathrooms for like 10 minutes trying to figure out which one was for boys and which was for girls.  Turned out you just use whichever one is open!    

In addition to just being an awesome environment, where you are accepted for being whoever you are, Paideia has a great curriculum.  The year is divided into short and long terms.  In the long terms, you take the standard stuff - physics, math, languages, etc.   The short term is for classes that are a little more outside the box - Sociology of American Rock & Roll anyone?  

The teachers here are absolutely outstanding!  You can totally tell that they love the school and truly believe in it's mission.  And Paul, the headmaster, is just an all around great guy.

Graduation was awesome.  My graduating class was 57 people and Paul made a short speech about every single one of us!  

I am so thankful that I was able to go to Paideia on a scholarship.  I regularly give them money so that others can do so as well.  I am also backing them in their efforts to take over the whole block!  Go Paideia!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Amalgam Arts Atlanta","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/qCDd9zIn72Faltf0Yp-_rw/l.jpg","telephone":"(404) 447-2070","address":{"streetAddress":"743 E College Ave
Ste E","addressLocality":"Decatur","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"GA","postalCode":"30030"},"review":[{"author":"Erin K.","datePublished":"2017-07-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I've been itching to take a jewelry making class at Amalgam ever since seeing a Groupon deal for it, and I finally got to go this weekend! 

I took the 4 hour workshop which was mostly metal working. It was an amazing experience. Wendy is an awesome teacher and explained each step of the process thoroughly. She made herself available to the students and did a lot of one-on-one work.

Although we all made the same project (a ring), Wendy made sure there were many opportunities to customize it. You determine the band size of your ring, decide to have a patterned or smooth band, whether or not to have a stone set in the ring, and the color and shape of the stone. I left Amalgam with a beautiful handmade and custom ring! 

The 10am class went until 2pm with many opportunities for snacks and bathroom breaks in between. The way the class works is Wendy explains each step as you go along and floats around the room to help people complete that step. For the complicated steps (i.e. Soldering), Wendy works with students one by one to ensure safety and correctness. When you're waiting for your turn or letting your ring sit in the "pickling solution" as Wendy calls it, you can relax and do whatever. I snacked (bring food or buy it at the cafe right outside), socialized, and studied for an upcoming exam I had; so, bring things to do or not - just a heads up. 

Remember to wear close toed shoes, and be ready for an easy, relaxing Saturday at Amalgam if you take the 4 hour workshop, which I highly recommend. It's a fabulous activity for mom/dad and daughter/son dates, a girl/guy's day, or plain ol' self care. 

Location and parking: The studio is situated in a grouping of buildings that kind of look like bungalows. When pulling into the lot, you won't immediately see Amalgam. You will see a small cafe and a storefront with a big letter "D" on it. Amalgam is between those about 100 ft farther back. There's a small parking lot so if you're going to a class, I would highly recommend showing up early to nab a spot."},{"author":"Emma H.","datePublished":"2019-04-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I took the jewelry making class offered by Groupon. The studio isn't horribly hard to get to if you're familiar with the Decatur/Avondale area as I am, but if you're not familiar, look for the delightful La Calavera Bakery because they share a lot. 

The teacher is Wendy, who has an incredibly impressive resume in the metal arts. She is very patient and helpful as you go through the process (and believe me, it's a process, involving pliers, soldering, hammers and a dremel) to create a pretty ring. 

The class is a little long because it's a process. You can bring snacks and non-alcoholic drinks. Or you can walk to the aforementioned bakery if there's a lull in action (ask Wendy first). But it creates a really cool result! Mine is pictured here."},{"author":"Joshua C.","datePublished":"2018-06-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Paid 80.00 for the 5 week class I knew materials would be extra was told they would be about 50.00 it was over 100.00 I was lied to by wendy to add salt to the wound was charged an additional 10.00 additional to that you have to drive a 100 miles+  and pay 15.00 in shipping just to get her list when confronted with this I was just told sorry no apology for lying or any compensation I had to make 8 phone calls because she does not pay her bill with captcha verification  so you can complete the form she repeatedly blew me off and made a very stressful situation and is the sole reason I had to spend so much and drive so far this woman does not care about the customer JUST MONEY."},{"author":"Milla M.","datePublished":"2018-08-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I've always collected rings-spoon,poison,irishclad. I've made spiral wrap rings with floral wire too. It was time to play with real silver! I did the 5week course for several hrs every Friday. It was the perfect escape from real estate work! I made 2 rings & a bracelet. Learned how to cut the silver, shape the metal, solder the metal with fun using the torch (wish I could set up shop in my Buckhead condo but that torch would be trouble!), & Finally Sand & file & polish the metal. All I can say is that I have a new found appreciation for jewelry making. Those rings are worth every penny. Instructor Wendy is sweet yet a tough cookie. When you're struggling she really challenges you to get through it when she can easily take your metal and fix it in a second. If you want to just play you can buy studio time by the hour. Great if you don't want to invest in buying all the expensive tools &  jewelry making machines. There's an initial cost for the class and additional cost for the supplies I definitely recommend calling ahead of time before going to the jewelry store located on Buford Highway as they are constantly out of materials. Better yet you can call the online store and just order online your class materials. #MillaInTheCityAtl www.MillaMurad.com"},{"author":"Heather N.","datePublished":"2013-11-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I stepped it up to the five class pass and then did another five after that! It is labor intensive and forces streamlined focus, which is good for my ping pong brain.

I may have a metal addiction...

Cheers-"},{"author":"Lynsey M.","datePublished":"2015-01-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I took a class here and couldn't be more excited with how the experience turned out. Wendy was patient and very helpful. I brought my own stone and she was happy to help me. I wear the ring all the time and look forward to taking another class with her!"},{"author":"Dana W.","datePublished":"2014-12-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I bought the most gorgeous ring.  It was made by Wendy Tonsits at Amalgam Arts, Atlanta.  The ring is sterling silver with yellow toned stones in it.  It is light and airy.  I knew I wanted it the minute I saw it!  Thanks, Wendy!"},{"author":"Lula B.","datePublished":"2015-04-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I took a 5-week class here, and at first was overall fairly happy with it despite a few misgivings. Her teaching style is very hands on, which is great. But she's anti-note taking, which didn't work well for me. Basically she explains the next 8 or so steps (which include using a torch and a saw) and then whenever you forget what's next, you're supposed to ask her for the next step. I (and the other students) spent half the time waiting in line to ask what's next. If I just guessed and moved on because it was taking too long, she inevitably let me know I had messed up. She saw I was being really careful with the torch and started getting impatient, just doing the torch work for me when I had asked for help doing it. Wendy has a very strong personality which you will might love, but I found a little grating after a while. I ran out of time to finish my project and asked if I could pay to come finish it at open shop hours (which she had previously said we were welcome to) but then she told me that was only for more advanced students and I should really just sign up for the next 8 week class (I really just needed an hour or two to finish a couple things). I really wish I had just take notes anyway, and had chosen a different instructor whose style and personality matched mine better. But for a groupon, it was a good deal and I did get one of my three projects finished."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":8}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Clovis Christian School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DY2tqwu2VBgmo7bgfbuf_w/l.jpg","telephone":"(575) 763-5311","address":{"streetAddress":"2000 Humphrey Rd","addressLocality":"Clovis","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"NM","postalCode":"88101"},"review":[{"author":"Nathan H.","datePublished":"2021-08-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"This organization is terribly run. ADDITIONALLY, if you read the reviews here on Yelp, you will find ONE POSITIVE review. Apparently, a mysterious "Jim H." has glowing things to say about the organization. If you are military and forced to be stuck in this city with its absolutely horrendous education infrastructure, don't fall for the hype that this private education center will be any better. New Mexico is trailing the entire nation in education and test scores. At this point, the tragedy of being stationed in Clovis is that your child has ZERO good options in this city if you want them to be on pace with their peers in other states. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Maria's Montessori School","telephone":"(575) 742-1112","address":{"streetAddress":"3316 Lilac Dr","addressLocality":"Clovis","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"NM","postalCode":"88101"},"review":[{"author":"Katelynn H.","datePublished":"2021-08-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Do not enroll here if you intend to ask any questions about what is happening inside the building. Inquiry is taken as immediate attack on the establishment. Read further for experience.  

For the first two weeks of school at Maria's Montessori, pick-ups and drop-offs were alarmingly abrupt. The door is opened long enough for kids to enter, then closed again. So with no view into the school, these were the things I did witness:  full lunches returned every day (except one day when his homemade empanadas went missing, even though he said he'd only taken one bite. I will let the reader consider what happened there). My son would say he drank no water, no "work" done (Montessori language), movies, marshmallows for snack, crying and describing kids punching each other, no books read, teachers hitting kids on the head.  Any concern I had about academics went out the window in comparison to my son's physical well-being.  

My son had never had issues before this school. But, understanding that every story has two sides, I gave some benefit of the doubt and reminded my son and the door contact each day that he needed to eat and drink water. Thursday and Friday of that first week, stomach pain started. My husband and I decided that without any way to see into the school or avenue to ask questions, it was time to follow her procedure for communication and schedule a conference to see if Maria (owner) could shed light on our son's reports. We could also offer them some Montessori-based solutions that his prior school and I used to get him to eat and drink, plus seek some system of transparency.  

We emailed Monday of the second week requesting a conference with a suggested time - no details about our specific concerns. After a followup email to Maria Wednesday evening asking if I could expect a call at the suggested time, the response I got at 6am Thursday morning was alarming. Maria stated that I was expecting immediate results in my son's academics, that I should choose another preschool, and that I could come collect my son's things that day.  Review: I had not spoken with Maria about any of my concerns, seeing as her handbook clearly states that issues require a scheduled conference. In my attempt to follow policy, her response was to kick my son out.  

My husband said we needed to go see her immediately. When we pulled up to the school Thursday morning, I tried to establish a shared purpose (we both want a contract), explain my intentions for a solution, and ask if the email she sent was a formal cancellation of the contract. However, she immediately launched into how her history as a business woman, and that I was not going to question her establishment. Not once did she seek to hear what my son was struggling with, her concerns were in no way child-centered, and always included how much she is having to work. When my husband came up and tried to mention that it was physical nutrition, she LAUGHED! and said they don't "force feed children". Maria kept repeating that our relationship was not going to work. On the third time, I realized she was right.  In seeking a partnership around how to best serve a child to understand how my child is being treated within the school, we were told that we had no place there. She also accused me of not bringing up the issue at pickup and dropoff, when I was trying to respect HER clear guidelines.  

My son is now in a different daycare, and the transparency there is like night and day from Maria's. We met his teacher, we get to meet classmates, we get a letter each day with concrete evidence of what our son worked on. Maria's Montessori is not a safe environment for children if those children are not allowed to voice how they are being harmed. If anything, the incredible defense in response to any attempt at questioning Maria should serve as an immediate warning to any parent considering the school - tell-tale sign that transparency is her enemy."},{"author":"ML G.","datePublished":"2016-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I love Maria's Montessori School! Mrs. Mindy and Mrs.Carrasco are amazing my child loves them both. My child has learned so much, I love it."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Eastern New Mexico University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SbNxH7R7jG_2Oggh51W9wQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(575) 562-1011","address":{"streetAddress":"1500 S Ave K","addressLocality":"Portales","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"NM","postalCode":"88130"},"review":[{"author":"Tony M.","datePublished":"2015-10-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Campus is beautiful and easy to get around. Students are always helpful when trying to find buildings."},{"author":"Beth H.","datePublished":"2010-08-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"ENMU is the youngest university in New Mexico having just celebrated its 75th anniversary. The background of ENMU is that of liberal arts with a recognized music program. The university offers over 60 degrees from associate to masters level. Eastern has one of the lowest tuition rates in New Mexico. The option to work on 100% online degrees is provided with 8 undergraduate and 9 graduate programs.

Eastern is located on the Eastern border of New Mexico and Texas. The campus is located in Portales, NM, a town of about 17,000. Approximately 20 miles NE is Clovis and Cannon AFB with a population of about 35,000. The nearest large cities are Amarillo, TX and Lubbock, TX.

The campus itself is relatively small in size when compared to other universities such as New Mexico State University or University of New Mexico. Several projects to renew/rebuild buildings are currently in works. The most recent upgrade was the building of a new music building. On the books are the building of a new tech building and possible upgrades to the liberal arts building.

The population of the university is very diversified with a noted population of first generation college students. There is a program in place that allows Chinese students to come study at ENMU for two years and then on returning to China they complete the remainder of their education.

Classes are relatively small allowing for more interaction with instructors and professors. There is also a strong athletic program ranging from football to soccer."},{"author":"Greg M.","datePublished":"2011-11-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"My wife went to ENMU and loved it. I've been there several times and enjoy hanging around the university and the area. Everyone's really friendly and you can walk to anything. I went to the alumni homecoming dinner and was treated as if I had been valedictorian or something--people were super nice.

The football team is terrible, but the stadium is nice (small) and you can lounge on the grass by the end zones, which is cool."},{"author":"Michelle N.","datePublished":"2011-10-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My husband and I both attended ENMU.  Now, that he is in his last semester of Graduate school, they have decided to change the rules.  Now they are going to make it impossible for him to graduate.  

So COMMUNICATION Student BEWARE!  You get what you pay for, just don't expect a degree as the rules change with each semester and each new teacher.

Thoroughly disappointed and disgusted."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":4}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Wings Over Water","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/_zJupcOpNXiO2rQGFkRdOA/l.jpg","telephone":"(203) 212-3950","address":{"streetAddress":"2221 Black Rock Tpke","addressLocality":"Fairfield","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CT","postalCode":"06825"},"review":[{"author":"Jenna K.","datePublished":"2022-08-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"After having my second baby I knew I needed to get my three year old into swim lessons as I had been putting it off for too long. On Memorial Day she wouldn't let go of me in the pool and she flat out told me "no swim lessons". She had such a fun time her first class she wanted to go back the next day. I didn't feel like one day a week was enough instruction time for her to pick it up quickly so I enrolled her twice a week and we made sure to practice at home as well. It's been two months and she is doing amazing. She loves going under the water and is jumping into the pool and swimming back to the edge independently. She still needs assistance in areas but I'm confident by the end of the fall she will be almost completely independent. 

I do feel that the classes have a wide range of student ability but the teachers are good about tailoring it to each child's level of needed help. It also can be really crowded depending on the day or time. I wish they would stagger classes more"},{"author":"Kellie R.","datePublished":"2019-10-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Wings Over Water is a great place to take swimming classes for little ones. The boy I nanny for is the only one in the class so it's nice that he gets a one on one with the instructor. His teacher is very calm, nice, and gentle. I love her demeanor! 
The building has weird parking but once you get inside, the place is very welcoming and clean. There's a large locker room and several private bathrooms with showers. There's also a play area while you wait (if you have young children with you)."},{"author":"Emily D.","datePublished":"2021-08-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Being new to the area we wanted to get our children into swim school as soon as we could. Wings of Water is straight forward in their mission - it's a swim school. Some parents told us they move at a snails pace and that was also our experience. That's likely part of the business model. 

After signing up for classes nothing here is straightforward and I don't really know how they run the business, because you have to continually do the leg work. Whomever owns this place isn't involved in how it's being managed. We initially had one teacher and then after one class were told that she was double booked, so we'd have to be flexible and get another teacher instead. Fine. Our regular teacher was engaging and I wouldn't give her 1. 

Over the course of several months there were so many cancellations and the subs ran the gamut from somewhat involved to preoccupied. 
What I really don't like about Wings Over Water is the way they treat clients. At Summer's end, we had the last lesson of the month and the instructor then told us she was no longer offering private classes, so we'd have to get that sorted. There's no continuity. 

When we inquired at the office the woman rolled her eyes, stressed they be on a break for several weeks, and she could add us to the wait list. The utter lack of communication and care for informing people is just shoddy business. Every interaction with the front desk felt frazzled. 

I'm happy to invest in my children learn skills, especially swimming, but after a complete $1200 Summer program my children are more content in the water and eager to learn, but not full swimmers. I'd look elsewhere and now understand the discontentment of other parents. 

Also, there was no enforcing of the current city issued mask mandate, despite hanging signage. Catering to children who cannot yet be vaccinated and noticing the same people flouting rules week after week is the nail in the coffin."},{"author":"Tisha P.","datePublished":"2021-08-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Absolutely awful experience at the first lesson.  My son was treated as if he did not belong there, instructor constantly demanded him to do skills but did not show him how in a beginner's class.  She was extremely rude and kept looking at the clock the whole lesson.  The pool was crowed with multiple lessons at the same time and the children had to maneuver their way around other classes going on.  I watched as my son continued to try and eventually was on the verge of an anxiety meltdown and the instructor ignored him.  I am extremely disappointed and would never recommend this place to anyone.  I give it one star for the person who checked us in."},{"author":"Chris R.","datePublished":"2021-05-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Absolutely dangerous place to take your children. They have classes for toddlers and young children that are 4 kids to one teachers. While the teacher concentrates on one student, the other children are left to themselves - what could possibly go wrong with 3 children that can't swim in a pool - as they say it only takes a second"},{"author":"Dionne E.","datePublished":"2018-02-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Wings over Water has done a great job making swim lessons fun for my kids. I would highly recommend joining the WOW family. 

When we joined WOW, my son was afraid of the water. He did not want to put his face in for fear of drowning but the instructors here have been patient yet firm with him. Now he is swimming and loving it.

My daughter has grown so much since her time here. She swam her first lap, the length of the pool. Her confidence overall and her skills in water safety have been so greatly improved. 

Thanks to all the staff here especially, Georgie and Loiry."},{"author":"Theresa Z.","datePublished":"2015-02-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"First the stars are for the trainer we worked with. Without him they'd get not even 1 star.

They seem like a pyramid scam when dealing with the business side.  You pay a fortune and you get your classes. If your lucky to get a slow day or a time the pool is dead that's when your kid can get attention without chaos. Otherwise if you miss class you get a family swim pass, no make up lesson which is ultimately what you pay for, no? The "lessons". I guessed though..something is not nothing. At least you get at least one make up class during safety week. 

I didn't like that for existing classes when new kids would be added to the roster the while class reverted to the very beginning leaving our kids to sit and wait for "the bubble blowing to finish"

I didn't like the fact the kids who are more advanced are not automatically moved up into next phase after being able to accomplish basics of their current session without having to go the whole session. For my child who doesn't swim, I expected he would be with kids like him so they can grow together. It's intimidating for little kids.

Anyway there are more regimented pools and classes around. Don't be fooled by the colorful child friendly looking decor. The inability to breathe without the smell of chlorine making your eyes tear is a perk...shows chlorine is definitely working...to kill dirt and bacteria.  They just need a really good scrub down. They should look at their pricing.  This is like a holiday inn express pool not Chelsea Piers lol.  They need to understand their audience and competition.

Again, trainers great with beginner swimmers...but aside from that we stopped half way through our session. We went for a good year.  The hype became old very quickly."},{"author":"Mr B.","datePublished":"2012-02-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Wings Over Water is an educational swimming space for children, adults and their families.   It's not just marketing hype that they claim to be "one of a kind" and it's because of their Swimplicity® methodology that is used.  People who seek to get their kids swimming will be shocked at how quickly this place can do the task!  The instructors are indeed professional and can tend to not just those looking to learn but those looking for stroke development, tri-athlete training, and adaptive aquatic skills.  They have family swim, lap swim and birthday parties but I've not tried those options yet.

The facilities are amazing and they've even got some decent gear for those who need the last minute item or two prior to taking a dunk."},{"author":"Annie B.","datePublished":"2013-07-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"My girls have been going here since they opened 2 years ago and I have nothing but praises for them.  We love Melissa/Edie, the owner of the place and the teachers we have had, except for one and he has left.  One of my girls developed a sudden fear of jumping in after she's been there for a session and had been doing so with no issue.  Melissa not only guided her out of that phase, she did so gently, though firm with her request without making my daughter feel afraid or bad.  For weeks, Melissa thought out of box and came up with really creative solutions for my daughter to try until they figured out something that worked and after that within a lesson or two, my daughter was back to water loving self.

Positives:
* facility - awesome heated pool in a warm room so kids don't get cold coming out of the water; separate viewing room at a comfortable temp
* cleanliness - I know they are strict with their swim pants request, but the facility is spotless and their strictness with the policy makes me feel comfortable knowing my kids may swallow some water
* awesome instructors and really amazing teaching methodologies

I completely disagree that they keep your kids in a level longer than necessary just to make money.  I know that it's hard to see your kids in the same level a few times when you think they can swim really well.  But they really evaluate your children accurately based on their techniques and needs.  Just because your kids can "swim" around, it does not mean that they are doing it with the techniques that WOW is looking for in the next level.  Why does this matter?  Well, in the next level, they would be looking to build on that technique, if your kid doesn't have it down, it would slow down the whole class while the instructor works with him/her on it.

Cons:
* definitely VERY expensive, but not more than penguin and some other high end swim schools that don't even have their own facility
* some of the front desk staffs.  While we love the original front desk staff, the new ones have not been of equal quality and some are down right rude or incompetent.  I hate that these are the first impression the school is getting as I know how great the school is.
* they may be getting too big.... it is hard to get a spot, I get it, so some parents are very turned off by it, but they are very busy, I hope they can get the quality staff accordingly.

Bottom line, I HIGHLY recommend Wings Over Water!  My girls love it there and I won't go any where else as long as I am in the area."},{"author":"Amina T.","datePublished":"2014-08-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I went to W.o.W as an adult swimmer, who expressed my fears and anxieties toward the water. The front desk was very encouraging and attentive to my needs. Even though I live in Stamford, they suggested I enroll right away (but my class was a peak-traffic time--that's a whole other story).

I was suggested to enroll in the adult beginner class. I believe this was the wrong call completely. Even though the class size was small, each adult was on different levels. One student had already begun lessons a semester or two prior, one was an elderly woman who had much more experience with water than I clearly did, and one other adult, who was late to register had picked up on what I was having trouble with for a week on her first day. Needlesstosay, this really affected my self-esteem.

The instructor was not personal, and was not able to give me the attention I needed during class. Our interaction was simply, awkward and uncomfortable, and I do not think he took the time to establish a sense of understanding between him and I, and for something I felt completely skeptical and unsure of, that is, the water. I already didn't trust the water, or find my own strength, and he never allowed me to trust him either.

Early on, I considered switching to private lessons, and wondered if one-on-one would be better for me. Upon multiple attempts to bring up my concerns either by speaking to someone at the front desk (before or after class), making phone calls or filling out request forms, my needs had not been met. Ultimately, I ended up spending extra money on a private lesson in addition to the class. 

After feeling as though my performance was not sufficient for the school, and that my needs were not important enough to be met, I decided to simply quit, and not show up. There was no follow-up from the school, so I ended up calling, finally, to inform them that I did not want to be a part of the class. I did not even mention a refund, since that is against their policy. 

I believe there were many things I learned as a young adult in the real-world of service. I was a customer--a nervous, uncertain and confused one at that--but one who paid in full--and A LOT of money, to have the opportunity to be supported in something that is one of my greatest challenges and fears. W.o.W sort of...ruined the idea to ever learn how to swim and did not give me any attention. I felt terribly alone and unsupported. I did not feel as I was part of a team that encouraged me. I understand they were busy, and primarily serve their younger learners; I also understand I was discouraged and insecure. But for adult swimmers, be sure you know what your needs are, and be smart on where you choose to go."},{"author":"Melissa S.","datePublished":"2014-11-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My daughter has been at WOW since she was 2 years old. Their method of teaching is really one of a kind. It's not the same old routine you find at your local pool. They teach swim safety before your child is even learning strokes etc. Because, really that is what every parents wants don't they? ...for their child to be SAFE in the water? 
Case and point 2 summers ago my daughter was 3 years old. We were at a friend's pool and she was playing on a floating mat. She wasn't a STRONG swimmer but Melissa taught her how to be SAFE in the pool. As she was floating and playing with her cousin, I knew in the back of my mind that she as going to fall in and I was ok with it. I actually wanted her to fall in because I want to see if she could react properly while I was safely watching. Within minutes she flipped over and was in water over her head. Now it's one thing to see your child do the safety drills in class but, it's another to watch it in action with no instruction. She fell off and did EXACTLY what she was taught and swam to a safe place and held on until I could pull her out. She has been taught safety in the water which to me in invaluable. The comments about the staff being rude are simply not true. Melissa and her staff are firm yes. But, this to me is imperative in swim instruction. Children need to know while swimming is fun we have to always be safe and listen to instruction. I couldn't imagine having her being taught anywhere else. My now 16 month old is enrolled and loving the water. The owner Melissa is incredibly passionate about swimming and she is just amazing with the little ones. She got my daughter through a really tough patch of being scared in the water. She really gets to know these kids and what works for them individually. Give them a shot. I promise you won't be disappointed."},{"author":"Pat H.","datePublished":"2015-05-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I'm changing my review to 3 stars. It's almost like they read my review...  This week they are being extra accommodating--maybe because I stormed out early last week. Either way, they helped Ellie put her cap and goggles on this week and my daughter seems to be having fun!  I'll continue to improve my review if they keep this up."},{"author":"Amy S.","datePublished":"2015-08-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My son has been taking lessons at WOW since he was six months old.  He's now 2 and starting to be able to swim by himself.  We have found Melissa, the staff and all of the instructors to be helpful, responsive, friendly, and very accommodating.  They even added a class for this fall at a date/time requested because we could not make the other times work because of pre-school/nap schedules.  WOW is more expensive than some other local programs, but you get what you pay for.  We have had other swim lessons here and there, and the instructors are nowhere near as skilled and safety-focused as at WOW."},{"author":"Deb C.","datePublished":"2014-07-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I found Wings over Water after trying a few swim programs with little success.  My four year old loves the pool but could not get comfortable without a vest and i knew i needed a place that would give him to tools he needed to not only learn to swim, but learn to save himself and be confident in the water. 

We signed up the first week of class and had not been there prior to the first lesson.  They gave us a tour of the facility and were super friendly and happy to see new faces.  When my son and i stepped onto the deck, Miss Kristin was ready for us and immediately started talking with my son, walking right into the pool with him.  He normally takes a little while to warm up to new people, but he didn't look back to me at all and just sat on the steps, eager to get in.  Kristin was having so much fun with the kids (a good 4 to 1 ratio) they were learning safety throughout the entire class and my son did more than he's ever done in the water in that 30 min.   Even at the end, when I heard him say he was scared, Kristin thanked him for sharing his feelings, acknowledged him and then gave him two choices to keep going comfortably.  she didnt force him at all, but found a way to instill security so that he could see what he was capable of.  

it was a terrific environment and I was happy to see my son all smiles when he got out.  He asked if we could go home and swim at the pool at our complex so he could practice!    

the only reason i didn't give it a full 5 star review is because this review is based on my first impressions of the front desk and our own instructor, but i've been to many different programs and this is absolutely one of the best.  so good, i'm willing to drive there from Stamford!  :)"},{"author":"Gail K.","datePublished":"2016-06-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Up til this session this was a five star experience. They lost a few really good teachers and have too many inexperienced teachers now. It's too bad because up Til now it was great for teaching safety and encouraging the kids gently but firmly to push themselves.  Not worth the money anymore."},{"author":"min W.","datePublished":"2015-03-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is great place for kids to learn swimming.  My son are with them since he was 3 years old and now he is 6 and he is doing great!  Now my younger son is with them,  They have great teatchers and technique!!."},{"author":"Kevin H.","datePublished":"2014-06-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"They are very very rude. Call them and try to ask questions you will see. I signed my child there teacher was so cold and rude. They have an attitude like they don't need your business."},{"author":"Dolly P.","datePublished":"2015-02-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Wings Over Water changed our family's life.  At eight years old, our son had a profound fear of water and would not enter a pool without both being held and having a floatation device on him.   We had tried private and group lessons at almost every local and well respected swimming school in the area but nothing worked.  The approach at WOW is unique and allowed for a breakthrough for our son.  I cannot speak highly enough about the teachers in this wonderful school.  Our son worked with 3 different teachers and they were incredibly persistent, patient, caring and talented.  The facility is exceptionally clean and well run, it was a joy to be able to sit and watch his progress week by week.  I cannot recommend this school strongly enough, like I said, their program changed our lives."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":18}}

I cant wait to be back"},{"author":"Elle P.","datePublished":"2018-11-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We have been coming here for years. We love coming to Hands on Pottery to make personalized gifts for family and friends. Great little space, always clean. The owner is so nice and accommodating. We'd recommend this as a great experience for adults and children alike."},{"author":"Coco S.","datePublished":"2017-06-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"One and half years ago I attended Hands On Pottery in Fairfield and made a few items with my granddaughter, one of which was a Friends-type large coffee cup.

One morning I was drinking coffee and the handle fell completely off causing the coffee to spill over my Macbook computer destroying it. Not a cheap machine. I had to replace it for $2,000.

I took photos of a rug that was ruined, the cup and my computer and called the company. They hemmed and hawed and offered me a free sitting in their place and nothing more. 

The handle literally broke off from the cup in my hands in thin air. I didn't bump it or do anything to it. It was clearly too small for the size of the cup with the weight of some coffee or it wasn't attached properly.  

For sentimental reasons I kept the cup part and drink from it.  I have put it through the dishwasher many times and it remains standing and just as solvent as day one. Oh, and btw, just got a jumbo coffee cup from Disney about the same size and the handle is about twice the size to accommodate the weight of the cup."},{"author":"Kelsey G.","datePublished":"2019-03-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I do big brothers big sisters and my little and I are always looking for fun activities. Lately she has been into art so we went here. She LOVED it and Has already asked to go back! There were a lot of options of fun things to paint and a lot of colors. The people were very friendly and one of the only places who has ever offered me a discount for BBBS. I didn't even ask for a discount, they were just kind enough to do it. I love doing special activities with my little but it does add up fast so it was very much appreciated! Any place that allows us to be creative is a win in our book, and someone who appreciates a good program like BBBS made my experience even better!"},{"author":"Sara G.","datePublished":"2018-12-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is amazing! Wonderful for young kids! So many fun items to pick from to customize. Jim and his staff are so extremely helpful!!"},{"author":"Tanner M.","datePublished":"2015-08-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I'm not an artsy type but went here today with the gf and her cousin and we had a good experience. The staff was very helpful and professional, and it was a fun thing. Only knock I have is it seems expensive. Then again I'm not artsy like I said so maybe the masterpiece I created will one day be worth more than what we paid"},{"author":"Matt And Cathy G.","datePublished":"2013-07-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"What a great way for four kids ranging from 9 to 14 to all have a great time! They truly get to create and be inspired! The employees are professional, helpful and so patient. They make the kids feel great and give such good feedback to make sure they will be happy with their finished product.

While somewhat pricey, studio time + cost of item chosen, and a 3-4 day wait to pick up your finished product, it was well worth the investment if money and time. The kids are delighted and all chose things they actually are using (NOT JUST BANKS!)--switch plates, mug, keepsake box and post it note holder this time...I have a great kitchen collection of napkin holder, spoon rests and salt/pepper shakers too!

Pure FUN!"},{"author":"Sujatha H.","datePublished":"2009-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hands On Pottery is great for everyone. I prefer this location to the one in Darien, it's a bit more open and I didn't feel as cramped.  It can get pricey very fast, especially with lots of people but the end result is awesome.  I work with kids and have had them make presents for theirs parents here numerous times and they are always a huge hit.  

The staff is always super accommodating and very friendly offering advice and tips.  At this location and the Darien one all of the staff members I have encountered have been extremely patient and understanding with children with is a super plus."},{"author":"Mr B.","datePublished":"2010-10-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Fun for all ages, great personalized gifts, and qualified staff to help monitor complexity of project - as well as mess that comes with it."},{"author":"Kori R.","datePublished":"2016-10-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"This is tough because I love this concept, have mostly encountered nice people working here, and I once met the owner who was super friendly and had great energy, but recently I was there for a child's birthday party and one of the employees is clearly in the wrong business.  She was in charge of running the party but I'm pretty sure she doesn't like kids.  She didn't smile once, acted like everyone there was in her way, and rudely shushed the children when they were chanting in excitement over cake.  Is this a library or an art studio that hosts child's bday parties?!  I watched her be rude and unfriendly to outside customers picking up their pottery as well.  After reading another review it seems the owners really need to be more careful with who they hire.  If I were the paying mom of the party I would've been furious that that's who I got.  Try being a little pleasant if you're going to take a job that interacts with kids.  The second girl working may have been a nice girl but I can't say for sure, she stood silently waiting for something to do most of the time. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Hunt Ridge Montessori School","telephone":"(203) 254-1159","address":{"streetAddress":"834 Brookside Dr","addressLocality":"Fairfield","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CT","postalCode":"06824"},"review":[{"author":"Kellie R.","datePublished":"2022-05-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I nannied for a couple of kids who went to Huntridge Montessori, so even though I didn't personally have children who went, I've been going here for drop offs/pick ups for 5 1/2 years. 
I absolutely LOVE this school and the teachers. The children I nannied for blossomed here, made valuable friendships, and learned an incredible amount. The teaching style along with the patience and love that the teachers give is truly amazing. 
I did a few presentations for the children at this school, sharing personal photos and facts about Asia and Antarctica. The children love learning about the world and were so excited to look at the photos from my travels, especially Antarctica. 
Huntridge also provides after school activities for Lunch Bunchers as well as fun field trips for the older kids. 
The teachers, however, are truly the best. Ms. Suzie and Ms. Kathleen have been so kind and welcoming to me throughout the years even as a nanny. If you are ever looking for a preschool, Huntridge is the best school around!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Columbia Southern University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/H9QJrecu74JlRjQpAJfNrA/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 981-3771","address":{"streetAddress":"21982 University Ln","addressLocality":"Orange Beach","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36561"},"review":[{"author":"Kathleen A.","datePublished":"2019-09-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"CSU offers a variety of degrees and truly provides support all along the way. I was fortunate enough to get my MS in Occupational Healy & Safety from this wonderful inst. All classes were online and any time I had a question, there was someone on the other end of the phone to help walk me through things. Shout out to my former advisor Luke who always took time to answer my questions. 

 Not only does the curriculum and advising get five stars but so does graduation! It's a pretty awesome event where students from all over the world come together to celebrate.

Additionally, with respect to Safety degrees and careers, this school always represents at conferences and conventions in the industry. I know I can stop by their exhibitor booth and say hi. Everyone is friendly and helpful and they always put together great networking events to help current students and alumni meet other people in the field. Paul and Ernie- you are both awesome to say hello to during NSC and ASSP conferences.

How could I almost forget about graduation?!? People from all over the world coming together to celebrate. The staff put on an amazing event and I met some people that I am still friends with! Definitely a must when you finish your degree. Make the weekend into a fun beach vacation to celebrate.

If you are on the fence in deciding whether or not to further your education at CSU, I can tell you that my experience was amazing and I will go back when I am ready to get another degree!"},{"author":"Youknow M.","datePublished":"2022-01-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hi everybody! In my forties I thought it was too late to go back, I was so wrong, and glad that I did.  Online schooling is a challenge as one needs to think outside the box and sometimes be a mind reader of what their professors might be looking for.  I recieved both my BS and MBA at Columbia Southern University and learned confidence in areas and schools of thought that I did not have before.  The courses will challenge you and the college is at a great price.  And before any of you go running away at the challenge, remember that the challenge is what you learn from and need to overcome.  In many of the programs you will learn more than your education, and will find a staff that has your success in mind.  The extra things I learned were patience, professionalism, and the courage to seek clarity like a pro and within academic policies and chains of command.  They are flexible and even had life flexible terms that you can choose from.  Although only a nationally accredited institution and a member of the Distance Education and Training Council, they are as of 2022 under review for being regionally accredited. 
 They also have an alumni association that students can be recommended to.  Check them out.  Good luck to all of you on your degree pursuits, and good luck to CSU on becoming regionally accredited.  ~Sincerely, a CSU Knight Ambassador."},{"author":"Donna S.","datePublished":"2021-08-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great experience with this school. Consistently well-structured courses and support."},{"author":"Dru T.","datePublished":"2018-05-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Affordable tuition, excellent teachers and staff, very willing to work with your schedule to help you succeed.  MILITARY FRIENDLY to the max.  I really hope they get Regional Accreditation soon so their credits will transfer and be recognized at a higher level.  They are currently Nationally Accredited by the DEAC, the same accreditation as the "free" college, University of the People.  I put quotes around free because at UoP, the online courses are free but the final exams are $100 to take and receive credit for the course. 

From what I was told by my advisor at CSU, they are working diligently towards a Regional Accreditation sometime in the near future.

Once that is achieved I will highly recommend this school. In the meantime, I can definitely say I like their platform and I like where they are going!"},{"author":"Blanca G.","datePublished":"2019-11-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My only regret is not looking into this doctoral program before I signed up for it. https://www.columbiasouthern.edu/blog/october-2017/columbia-southern-university-program-recognized-by"},{"author":"Gil B.","datePublished":"2019-10-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Not a bad school, my issue is the national accreditation. Highly recommend!"},{"author":"Brian S.","datePublished":"2019-05-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"No stars. This place is terrible please don't enroll here. I will eventually finish my degree, but there has to be a university that treats their students better. I'm in my late 50s and I will never need the skill of properly writing an APA research paper."},{"author":"Connie S.","datePublished":"2015-09-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great university. Go Knights!!"},{"author":"Mitchell J.","datePublished":"2014-03-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Taking online classes, most of the teachers are great resources. Word of warning, keep in contact with your advisor and student services rep.
