But some of the professors need to work on their people skills."},{"author":"James C.","datePublished":"2012-08-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I received my bachelor's degree from here.  I think High School had a harder curriculum.  The chewbacca defense works when submitting essays to about 90% of the staff here.  If you want an easily attainable nationally accredited degree without having to exert basically any effort then this is your place.  Its pretty expensive too, but I don't mind.  The American Taxpayer paid my tuition!"},{"author":"Caren O.","datePublished":"2012-07-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great online university! Flexible hours and exceptional student services!"},{"author":"Shaun F.","datePublished":"2015-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Columbia Southern University is an excellent university. I have to disagree with the person who said that this college is as easy as or easier than high school. Yes, most of the work you submit is essays; however, that is the challenging part.  The coursework is very rigorous. I have attended both a b&m college as well as CSU, so I can attest that this college is definitely harder. You can't plagiarize essays because they use Turn It In for many of the classes and major points are deducted if the redundancy rate is too high. I have had this happen, even when none of my material was plagiarized. So, I had to learn to use more of my own words and and not quote so much material. If you can easily write essays, you might consider this university easy. However, if you struggle with writing and thoughts don't come as easily to you, like me, then you might have a different view of this school. In one class alone, I had to write 18 essays. It would be much easier to have multiple choice, like I did in high school or like I did when I went to my b&m college.  However, I will say that I have retained more information through my coursework at CSU than I have at any other school. I retain more information when I have to write than when I have to just memorize information for a short term. There is no extra credit or making up assignments. If you don't do the work, you will not get a good grade. I would recommend this university to any working adult who does not have time to go to college the traditional way. If you enjoy independent learning and don't have to be in a classroom,  you will like CSU.  I am a senior at CSU, graduating this year. I do not feel like my degree is being handed to me; I have worked hard for the degree that I will receive. This journey has been more time consuming and stressful than I could have ever imagined, but well worth it!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":20}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Kids Plus Child Development Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aziAlYEvZYkReXcjmIFrJg/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 970-1566","address":{"streetAddress":"900 S Bay St","addressLocality":"Foley","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36535"},"review":[{"author":"Lynn D.","datePublished":"2015-02-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"They must be good....the past 2 mornings my husband has came home disappointed & heartbroken because our grandson Kayson didn't cry to stay with his peepaw... when I pick him up he is always happy...and that's my heart"},{"author":"H M.","datePublished":"2012-08-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Dont take your kids here!  I dropped my kids off and went to pick them up on thier first day and saw my 1 year old daughter's teacher jerking on another childs arm, very aggressively.  I was in shock.  I pulled my kids immediately.  Management said they "talked" to the employee.  I can not allow my children to be somewhere that abuses children.  I am sure it wasnt the first time that the employee did it, and due to managements lack of action, it wont be the last."},{"author":"Amanda M.","datePublished":"2012-09-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot speak for the previous reviews, however, I cannot imagine any of that going on at Kid Plus. I have been taking my kids there for 3 years and they love it. My first born started as a baby, and my other child started at 6 weeks old. The staff is incredibly helpful and takes the time to get to know each child and their needs. I get a hand written report daily that lets me know what times their diapers were changed, how long they napped, and what they ate. Sometimes when I come to pick my kids up they don't even want to leave because they are too busy playing with the other kids and the teachers. They have excellent playing areas. The "big kid" playground has plenty of jungle gyms, swings, bikes, etc. as well as a lot of grass for them to run around and play tag. The teachers are always out there playing with them games such as duck duck goose, and red rover. The little kid playground has lots of smaller toys for the toddlers and the teachers are always pushing the babies in the swings. The meals are included in your tuition and my son always talks about how good the food is. He especially loves when they have corn dog nuggets. The center even has a K-4 program that my son will be starting next year that I am so excited for. Overall, I have seen a huge difference in my children compared to other peoples children who do not go to Kid Plus. My children are far more advanced due to the hardwork and dedication the teachers put into each child. They don't just sit them down in front of a TV or send them to the playground to do whatever they want. Every day is structured with a schedule which helps us out at home because my son has a routine, which helps his behavior out a lot. The teachers always do crafts as well, my fridge is covered in a million different pictures my kids have done over the years. They always bring home sweet little poems with handprints for mothers/fathers day. The teachers also try to have parties for the different holidays and nothing makes my kids happier than bringing cupcakes to school and getting to share them with their friends. I would reccommend Kid Plus to every parent out there. I could not imagine having a better day care facility to take my kids to. In fact, I will be sad when my oldest has to leave day care to go to the elementary school. I will probably leave him in their after school program so I can pick up both my children at once."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Accademia del Giglio","telephone":"055 2302467","address":{"streetAddress":"Via Ghibellina, 116","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Blue K.","datePublished":"2016-10-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"I studied at this school for a good chunk of time while living in Florence, and your personal experience can vary a lot here - mine was not so great.  They offer studies in the fine arts and in the Italian language, and I only studied art, so I have no idea how the Italian education was.  The school's art 'curriculum' is very misleading, seeing as they actually have none, and a lot of the 'subjects' they supposedly had only exist if you bring it up to the teacher yourself.  I think that the only redeeming quality about the school was the very dedicated teacher at the time, who was very knowledgable, pushed his students to do better, and clearly loved art.  Two out of three of the people who run the school didn't seem to care very much about the students nor their experience at the school, which is probably why some students were unhappy with the structure of the school if they were studying there long-term.  I'm not sure who the main art teacher is right now.  This very tiny school is a good option if you want a very simple and basic experience in Florence and in the arts, because you do get a lot of freedom to just study whatever you feel like doing.  In that case it's really nice, and a great option for people who want to learn art basics!  Also, they'll provide very, very basic art supplies if you need them.  However, I would not recommend staying there longer than 3 months at the most -- any more than that would be repetitive and the certificate in the fine arts that they offer doesn't seem to be very official.  If you want a long-term study look into another school or even better, a university!  So to summarize, good for less than three months of study, and think about what you want for your school experience."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Europass","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vx7ATVANTotUw60eUH74sw/l.jpg","telephone":"055 2345802","address":{"streetAddress":"Via Sant'Egidio 12","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Maria A.","datePublished":"2016-11-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"The school is located in a central area and the teachers are nice and well prepared. This is annoying, but at least the director was nice and offered me a cooking course as a compensation, so I am overall relatively happy."},{"author":"Dana S.","datePublished":"2014-12-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I spent a lot of time to choose the school and it's a really good choice. Everything here is nice. Especially Tatiana and Maurisio - they are great! Thank a lot! After 2 weeks i've felt the progress. I definitely could recommended this school for those who want to improve their oral skills and who want after school have a nice walk in centro storico."},{"author":"Cathy V.","datePublished":"2015-05-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"What I like very much of Europass, is that I had a conversation from the start just so we could see in which class I could start. Because I studied Italian before, I didn't want to learn the language from the very beginning. This way I could start at my own level, together with students who where as far as I was. It wasn't hard for me to get along with the other students, because they would make the same errors as I did. I was in a class with Rafaella and she is very sympathetic. She includes everyone and even though we only spoke Italian, she made everything very clear.  If someone makes a mistake, she takes the time to explain. This also makes lessons very intense. One lesson, that takes about four hours, can maybe consist of only the grammar of one aspect. We could talk about irregular verbs and tenses very extensively. Because of this I wished I could follow the course longer than two weeks, because not everything of my level, B1, could be covered. But for me, because I study Italian at home, it gives me the opportunity to ask questions whenever I do not understand something. I like the fact that there is enough room to make mistakes, I didn't feel 'stupid' at any time.  Rafaella will help you if you have a hard time putting sentences together. \n\nPractically: the school has a great location, in the heart of the centre. It is nice to walk to town when lessons are over. Also the school doesn't feel very 'crowded'. Its groups are small. When you are alone, the school provides tours with a guide and cooking lessons and aperitivi, which are great to do if you don't know the city and you want someone to tell you where you should go ;-) I really felt like the teachers and the staff in general know what they are doing, making everyone as comfortable as possible. And if you want to explore the city by yourself, it's also fine."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Scuola Toscana","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/I1c5Psttfs9ULayyj_VjTQ/l.jpg","telephone":"055 244583","address":{"streetAddress":"Via dei Benci 23","addressLocality":"Florence","addressCountry":"IT","addressRegion":"FI","postalCode":"50122"},"review":[{"author":"Seiji C.","datePublished":"2016-08-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I spent July in Tuscany going to school at La Scuola Toscana, a school that provides not only great education of a beautiful world language, but also of a rich culture.

First off, I should let you know that I am not a beginner in my travels or in my personal education, and that I come from the US where we have incredible customer service.  I am also an educator. I must say that this administration, as far as European administration goes, is superior in its customer service.  They are sensitive, efficient, and genuinely kind even to difficult students.  Specifically, there was a clerical error with my tuition. I was panicked as I didn't speak the language fluently and realized how difficult this situation could be.  Fortunately I saved all the necessary documents (as one should) showing that I had already payed.  As I approached the desk asking about the notification, documents in hand and ready to 'prove' my case, the director simply stated that he was sorry, and that it was a filing error on their end, and there was nothing to worry about.  No questions, no proof needed, and nothing but smiles and relief on their end. 

Also they have a 'welcome' package all ready for their new students.  It's full of little tidbits that will help you get through the first few weeks on your own. So thoughtful!  They make you feel welcome, are very sensitive to any anxieties you may have about being there, and can manage different levels of fluency in Italian seeing as the administration speaks a great deal of other languages fluently. (I personally witnessed, not only English, but Japanese, Spanish and Hungarian.) 

Secondly, the scaffolding of the educational system is very well done.  There were classes for beginners of all levels, intermediate studiers, and even for those who wanted to master the language.  Outside of grammer and conversation, are myriad classes to take, I chose the COOKING class with Signora Fiammetti. I have to say that this cooking course was far superior to any of the cooking courses I attempted to take in France.  When I tried to do my research to find a place in France to do this, I found that either the prices were outrageous OR the skill level of the educators in the kitched were disappointing either in the language pedagogy OR in the skills/products used or made in the kitchen.  Neither of these were true about the cooking course I took.  Signora Fiammetti is a professionally trained chef/caterer, raised in Tuscany/Italy and trained in Paris.  Her organization was unbeatable, exceptionally well paced, and her tips on cooking were among the top I have ever seen.  I am no stranger to the kitchen, but she was able to give me a very wide range of tips, even on the basics of cutting an onion, or tearing basil.  The 4 course meals we prepared were unbelievable in the subtleties of flavors and the colorful presentation of food.  If you are a lover of food and cooking, I highly HIGHLY recommend this as an option.  I also have to say that our course had about 3-4 people in it, and of different levels of fluency in Italian. No matter!  We still spoke whatever level of italian we were equipped with, and her patience and teaching skills still helped us learn while we were cooking!  Incredible!

Lastly,  the teachers were so well adapted for their subject matter.  One member of my family was in the beginners level, while I found myself in the advanced group.  The instructors for beginners had, for people just getting used to the language,  teachers with an unparalleled amount of patience, kindness, organization and genuinity.  The advanced group had teachers that were of university-level brilliance in their subject matter (literature, language, etc.) and while at times their pedagogy seemed unfamiliar, I found myself challenged not only on a linguistic level, but an intellectual level as well. The extra tours with Caterina were fantastic!!!

Areas of improvement:  

Air conditioning:  During the hot months (and I imagine the same of the cold months) the lack of air conditioning made the learning particularly difficult for everyone in the class.  

Pedagogy (differentiated instruction for different groups taught) schoolwide is probably needed on a small level.  Therefore it might be a good idea for the administration to sit in on all classes from time to time to comment on style of instruction and just to provide feedback.  Also, perhaps all the teachers get together periodically to discuss methods. I feel that it would improve the solidarity of the school and increase the available methodologies of instruction between teachers. Strengths of each teacher can benefit the entire school in this way.

In summary, I would easily go back to this school.  The school is unbelievably rewarding for anyone wanting to learn about not just Tuscany, but Italy in general!  Put this on your list!"},{"author":"John S.","datePublished":"2015-04-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hi guys, I were in Florence attendino a 2 week course, everyday Italian classes in the morning and every afternoon an activity (as you mention in your question): monday we went discovering the secrets in Florence, tuesday we had a cooking class, wednesday a Chianti tour and Farm visit, thursday we went shopping, then the Uffizi Gallery..great! We attended Scuola Toscana - it is located close to Piazza Santa Croce, something like  benci street. Very nice teachers, friendly atmosphere...what else? Ticket included. Do not forget my most important recommendation: do not sit in Piazza Repubblica to drink a cappuccino...10 dollars! 
Your John!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":2}}

There are two buildings in the Villa. The one with the information and administrative offices has gorgeous murals and decorative walls; even a hall of mirrors!

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Birmingham Conservatoire","telephone":"0121 331 5909","address":{"streetAddress":"Paradise Place
Fletchers Walk","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"GB","addressRegion":"XWM","postalCode":"B3 3HG"},"review":[{"author":"Raj B.","datePublished":"2012-06-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"If you ask someone whether they know where the Birmingham Conservatoire is, they're most likely completely oblivious that such a place exists. That's because it's a 60s retro building hidden in Paradise Circus but showcases some amazing musical talent.

I went there for six years whilst learning to play the sitar and was amazed at the number of concerts that are held there. Most of these are performed by musicians who learn here, but the Conservatoire has also played host to some big classical artistes from around the world.

The nearest parking is the Town Hall car park close to the Mailbox so if you have others with you that find it difficult to walk, you're better off dropping them nearby first. The building is in desperate need of a facelift and the facilities are outdated. A large coffee shop or bar would be useful for concert-goers too."},{"author":"Fiona H.","datePublished":"2012-06-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Birmingham Conservatoire is one of the UK's top music schools, along with the Royal Academy in London and the Northern College of Music in Manchester. In fact, it was ranked top first with the Royal Academy last year, in a national student survey. Nuff said. 

It continues to produce world-class performers and composers, such as John Webb, Jean Rigby and, errr, Rhydian. As you would expect from a conservatoire, there is a very practical focus to the courses studied here, with numerous concerts and gigs for the students to gain experience in performance, and ensembles, orchestras, choirs and bands to get involved in. 

The conservatoire was the first music school in the UK to have an active research programme, and is internationally recognised for its developments in electro-acoustics. All in all - top dollar."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":2}}

People sitting at the door staring The owner was very rude The feeling in this building was like they wanted you to buy and get out."},{"author":"Jared G.","datePublished":"2018-09-22","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Today was my first time going into The Glass Monkey. I was immediately greeted by Matt, one of the shops salespeople, and a talented glassblower himself. I let him know I was shopping for a piece for my friends wedding and I had a pretty strict budget. I realized right off the bat that there was a disconnect between everything that caught my eye and the resources I had to buy it. Matt showed me a lot of more expensive pieces he was willing to put into my budget but nothing really caught my eye like the stuff that was $300-$400 and rightfully so. I was being unrealistic with my budget. 

Just before I gave up and walked out, in walks Kevin the owner. I explained to Kevin that I wanted to give my friends a unique gift that stands out from all the soap dishes and bed spreads people receive at their weddings. After telling the story Kevin was all in. He explained that couldn't sell me a really expensive piece in my budget BUT he could sure as hell MAKE me a really expensive piece in my budget. We picked out the one I wanted and he was even willing to customize the initials of the recipients in the glass! I'm shocked. These guys bent over backwards for me from start to finish. They really cared that I got exactly what I wanted.

I've been to many glass shops in the area and have always been treated with indifference because I'm not shopping for $300 pieces. These guys both valued me as a customer and worked out a creative solution beyond my expectations. I won't go anywhere else!!!"},{"author":"Ellie E.","datePublished":"2018-12-31","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Somehow ended up in The Glass Monkey last night after Pigeons and was literal butter. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Goddard School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/r5CEVmz_U_iUtMhE52WCag/l.jpg","telephone":"(859) 331-8400","address":{"streetAddress":"205 Grandview Dr","addressLocality":"Fort Mitchell","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"KY","postalCode":"41017"},"review":[{"author":"Shawn E.","datePublished":"2019-10-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I knew we chose the right daycare facility when my son had his first febrile seizure on a Sunday. I notified the school after my son missed several days of school of his diagnosis. Juliana called me the first day he was back. She implemented a protocol that if he ever had a fever, they would give him Tylenol (with a doctor's note) and that a parent would have to pick him up right away. \n\nThis past Friday, my son's teacher Ms. Didi noticed his fever right away (even though it was only 99.5) and the school notified me. I arrived to pick him up within about 20 minutes. As I was putting him in his car seat he had another febrile seizure and started to turn blue. I ran him back inside and Gabbi very calmly called 911. The paramedics arrived within minutes. Meanwhile several teachers came to help apply ice and comfort the both of us. Gabbi offered to come with us to the hospital and without my insisting we were fine, would have. Gabbi even texted us to check in with our family later that night. I cannot thank the staff at Goddard Ft. Mitchell enough for their compassion and help in such a difficult moment."},{"author":"Sean B.","datePublished":"2010-01-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We researched dozens of daycare options in the Cincinnati area and nothing came close to the Goddard School. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Dr. Park's Academy","telephone":"(907) 240-0344","address":{"streetAddress":"","addressLocality":"Anchorage","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AK","postalCode":"99515"},"review":[{"author":"Vivian L.","datePublished":"2018-08-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I studied with this company back in high school and they helped with e v e r y t h i n g (math, English, SAT, ACT, and even applying to undergrad colleges & scholarships). They really encouraged me to set high goals and supported me to achieve those goals-- I am eternally grateful. 

By spending my time at Dr. Park's Academy, I was able to have all of my questions answered and followed by detailed explanations. It was obvious they cared about my edification. With their help, I was able to develop better study habits and skills that I carried with me to undergrad. I graduated from the University of California San Diego and will be starting my professional study at the University of California Los Angeles School of Dentistry. Thank you to Dr. Park's Academy because I would not be where I am today without them!"},{"author":"Lina Y.","datePublished":"2020-02-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Dr. Park was a huge help in my academic progress. From elementary to high school, I was able to soar in education  (AP Calculus, AP Chemistry, SAT, ACT, etc) with the help of Dr. Park's Academy. In my senior year of high school, I received tremendous help applying to college (Northwestern University, which I will attend this upcoming fall) was difficult but made easier with the help of Dr. Park.
The SAT prep helped me achieve a score of 1530 and a  34 in ACT. Furthermore, I was able to participate in group study sessions and private sessions that helped me tremendously in all subjects. Without the help of Dr. Park, taking numerous AP classes in addition to participating in sports and other after-school activities, all while maintaining a good academic performance would not have been possible. Overall, the academy greatly helped me stay on schedule with school (all throughout high school!), test prep (ACT, SAT, other school tests), applying to colleges, and scholarships."},{"author":"Dahyon K.","datePublished":"2014-10-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"When I was in high school preparing for the SATs, I prepped with this company. 

The academy's college prep program was a great help to me and with it, I was able to get into the colleges I aimed to get into. Despite helping you with SATs, they also were able to help me and give me ideas on how to apply to colleges. The academy wants to help you get into the college that you want to get into and truly care for your education. 

Although I did not end up attending my top choice colleges due to their high tuition fees and not enough scholarships, I was able to get a very good financial aid packet at Creighton University with a 2-4 Pharmacy program which allowed me to be closer to my goals of going to Pharmacy School. 

I truly recommend this company. Without their SAT prep class, I don't think I would've been able to get into the college of my choice or get a good scholarship. They stress a good education and prepare you to become a successful person inside and outside of school."},{"author":"JD C.","datePublished":"2013-04-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I prepped with this company back in the early days before it was a bigger company, and now I tutor here.  It's great to see growth.  I'm going to give an un-biased report:

I scored around a 2300 through prepping here, back when the "new" SAT was new.  I took the SAT once on my own and prepped through 2 more SATs here, and after prepping with them, obtained a perfect score on the Writing.  I also ACT-prepped here twice and got a 34 (out of 36).

The Academy helped plan my academic path early on and naturally, I used their college prep services, and got into Columbia University, University of Chicago, Northwestern, Georgetown, etc (oddly enough, I was waitlisted at University of Washington in St. Louis, though lol).  It came down to Columbia and Northwestern, but I ended up going to NU.

One thing I must emphasize about their college prep program is that it is truly comprehensive.  Like, they help you from A to Z and beyond.  Their philosophy is "Let me help you get your kid into his/her Harvard," but they don't stop there.  They aggressively focus on scholarships.  I got a full ride merit-scholarship into Northwestern (whereas, ivy league schools don't usually give scholarships but are great with financial aid if you need a lot of it).  So, at first, I was a bit sad not to go to Columbia, but in the end and looking back, I was really pleased that I walked out of college debt-free AND got a stellar education.
(P.S.- back in the day, Columbia was ranked #9 and Northwestern was #11, so it made little difference ranking-wise where I chose to go.  In 2013, Columbia is at #4).

So, even though I may SOUND biased, I mean, I did walk out with fantastically improved scores, a fantastic college prep package, and got into my absolute top choice schools.  I got results--and not just any, but the ones I wanted.
I am not writing this because I work here, or because I was asked to.  I try to be a very honest person in life, and I would never have chosen to work here if I didn't think their services or philosophy was up to par.  The truth is, I decided to teach here because I agree with the philosophy and practices.  They truly care about education and each student.  I've seen the founders help less privileged students by writing off hours and giving them scholarships, and I saw them do this before the company became bigger--usually the time of initial "company growth" is not the time most business people act so generous.  They're not in it for the money, they're in it because education makes the world a better place.  Their kids both went to phenomenal undergraduate and graduate programs but are working/will be working in the public service sector.

Trust me, and not just because I work here (though, it should encourage you to come, as I did score in the 99% and am one of their best tutors), if you are passionate about your education and being/becoming successful, you want to be here.  There is no other place you'd personally want to be, or send your kid.  I'll be using their services again for graduate school entrance prep."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":4}}

She informed me there was an incident report but refused to let me see it, read it, or sign it, despite the fact that I have signed three separate reports in the past. The receptionist said that they prefer the child's "real parents" provide a signature.

I have been a part of my stepson's life since he was only a few months old. This incident was an insult and was beyond disrespectful to me and my role in his life.

Not only that, but several times, upon picking him up, he has had a soiled diaper caked onto him. Of course, this always results in horrendous diaper rash and is extremely painful for him.

Save yourself the trouble and find another childcare situation for your children."},{"author":"Mekayla T.","datePublished":"2015-11-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"My 1 1/2 year old daughter has been going here for less than 2 months. Concur that this school is more of a conservative christian cult center than a University."},{"author":"Raquel C.","datePublished":"2014-05-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"This review is surface only.
We came about a month ago for a nationals competition.  The campus is very quaint and beautiful. The trees and the flowers, and landscaping. The facilities were very well kept. The dorms were very nice as well.  As far as I know they have a high school there as well, and I think a daycare or pre school? 
The food was NOT for me, I could stomach the salad bar but the rest had to go! A complete overhaul needs to be done with the menus and ingredients. 
As an overall observation the staff was semi friendly and the students were not so much, a little to much snotty attitude, it turned me off immediately.
This is all my review will be about. It's actually a 2 1/2 star review
I'm really not itching to go back, but whatevs."},{"author":"Stephen D.","datePublished":"2015-04-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Bob Jones University is, in short, a disgrace. It's true. But what is it that makes them a disgrace? Why do they deserve such a title?

Let's examine their academics. Often a freshman-level class is remedial in nature. English classes center around basic grammar, middle school-level vocabulary, and the basics of writing a paper. These are the things one should have learned prior to college. And while a review of the basics can be a good thing, students and their parents are paying thousands of dollars for these remedial courses for the first semester or two! The jump in difficulty after the first year is not something to be ignored either. The average student has to suffer through intensely difficult classes after taking a year to settle into an easier pace. And students soon discover that the grading system used is more of a measuring stick for how much you failed.

You see, students are not treated with respect at this school unless they have proven themselves to the faculty. There are many students who deserve respect at Bob Jones, but unless you're a suck up or a tattle tale, you often are regarded as nothing by the school. I've seen students work extremely hard throughout the year only to be humiliated during class by the teacher. And I've seen students glide through semesters because they were suck ups of the worst kind. Now, don't get me wrong, not all the teachers are bad. But in my experience, there were three kinds of teachers. There were the GAs, which were students working through graduate school. The GAs were pretty much all friendly and helpful. Then there were a handful of good teachers, Dr. Ormiston is an example of a tough but caring teacher. And then you have the rest of the teachers who looked down on most of their students. 

In the end, those who manage to make it through to graduation, will find that in most places, their degree is worthless. Because despite what BJU advertises, they aren't actually accredited. Sure, they're "accredited" by a group of southern religious schools, but that doesn't mean anything outside of Christian circles. That's four years (at least) and thousands upon thousands of dollars wasted, unless you plan to get a job with Bob Jones. And that would probably work out, since those that make it through are trained to think just like the school wants them to think. Students are not prepared for the outside world. The students are trained to fear the secular world, and jump at the mention of something unbiblical. One might call this level of conditioning "brainwashing." And that wouldn't be too far off.

You see, despite claiming the Bible to be their foundation, the school actually wrote their own book of authority. This handbook claims to be inspired by the Bible. But that is an outright lie. While other schools might have rules like "Don't run in the halls." or "Don't bring drugs to school." BJU's rules are "Don't be outside your dormitory past 10:30 PM." and "Don't bring an iPod on campus." In a dystopian fashion, the lives of all the students, be they on or off campus, is invaded by the school's rules. Regulations cover everything from the kind of music they can listen to all the way down having to ask permission to leave campus. Students actually sign a contract that basically states that they will not exercise their first amendment rights.In fact, the school is so paranoid, that they reserve the right to revoke a graduate's diploma within the first three months after a student graduates. There is no appeal process for this. The school can literally make all those years worthless if they decide that you are not the kind of person they want you to be. Of course, they'll keep all the tuition they took from you.

Finally, BJU ignores the concept of grace, while flaunting the concept of judgment. Students have to fear for their safety, lest they break a rule. Students are forced to fill out forms about what they did over break. If they broke any of the rules, they are subject to discipline. If a student is struggling with sin in their life, they cannot seek help. Because the most help a student is offered is mandatory therapy sessions. And that can still come with a side of demerits bringing them closer to suspension or expulsion. They practically thrive on punishing wrongdoers. Unless  the wrongdoer is on their board of directors, as was the case a couple of years ago. It was then that they virtually threatened the entire student body to be silent about what happened. 

BJU is a disgrace. I urge you to stay away."},{"author":"Austin A.","datePublished":"2018-02-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Beautiful campus, there are some lovely people there. However they have allot of rules like what you can and can't we're, or listen to or even watch"},{"author":"rob s.","datePublished":"2005-09-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"I could rip this university up but I'll be fair.  It's an ultra conservative 
"bible" university that woman CAN only wear dresses and dating a colored person is still forbidden - YES, you heard me correctly!  This is THAT school that DUBYA once did his speech and got a lot of complaints.  Now they "say" such policy isn't endorsed BUT many, including myself, doubt it.  With my luck, my son will probably say one day: " dad, I want to go to Bob Jones University .................." oh my bejesus!  .............

They claim that they can convert your gay son/daughter to be straight "again" as well  - holy shit, can you make my wife do the dishes too?"},{"author":"Dimitrios K.","datePublished":"2012-02-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"After reading some of these novel-like, multi paragraph negative reviews, all I can say is,  WOW! Maybe too much time on their hands, or a cry for some kind of help? 

If indeed a school had such influence in a city or even a state, would it really just stop there? These disgruntled, angry people conveniently  dismiss the fact that there are "many" universities in SC that have more influence e.g. Clemson, Furman, USC etc. 

I attended between '92 -  96 and had a quality education. If one wants to see what the school's really like, then one should take advantage of the many opportunities to visit the campus and find out first hand what a fine school it really is.  There are also opportunities for high school students to live on campus for a few days to experience campus life."},{"author":"Kim W.","datePublished":"2018-07-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I went to BJU in 72-73. If you don't want to obey the rules, you have a choice not to go there. I was happy about the rules. I liked the dress code. At that time, Sunday morning church was on campus and the woman students wore hats. I had several different hats to wear. I loved the food and the campus was beautiful. I have been back to visit three times since 1973, the last being in 2016.  As a student there, I placed in the advanced New Testament Survey class, being that I had previous Bible training at my Christian high school. I always recommend a Christian teenager go to a Christian college or university."},{"author":"Marcy B.","datePublished":"2016-03-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Some of the finest people I know are graduates, faculty, or staff at BJU.  They are truly reasonable, caring people who love and seek to honor the Lord with their lives.  The academic standards seem to still be high after almost 100 years in existence.  No school is perfect (all schools are comprised of imperfect people) but at BJU they are striving for excellence and blessing many lives with their training."},{"author":"R P.","datePublished":"2012-04-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Is it a college or is it a cult? 

Go waste $18000 a year only to get expelled ten days before graduation for posting the lyrics to a Christian song on your facebook page, and then answer that question.

Seriously, if you have to send your kid to a crazy fundamentalist Christian college, at least pick one that is accredited like Clearwater or Liberty. This place is a farce."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":23}}

Is it a great University? I have no idea.  I attended U of AZ.  The students appear to be quite smart.  I hear it's a good school from US and World magazine.  I root for them everytime they play Clem'p'son."},{"author":"Rick S.","datePublished":"2015-05-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"JUST SOME FACTS about Furman I looked up. Founded in 1826, Furman is the oldest private university in South Carolina. The school is named for Richard Furman, a clergyman considered the most important Baptist leader before the Civil War. Furman was pastor of the First Baptist Church in Charleston, S.C., and became the first president of the Triennial Convention, the first national body of Baptists in America. The South Carolina Baptist Convention established Furman's original campus in Edgefield, S.C., but over the next three decades, the campus changed locations three times before arriving in downtown Greenville, S.C. in 1851. Originally founded as a men's academy and theological institute, the theological school broke away from Furman in 1858 to become the Southern Baptist Seminary. In 1924, Furman was named one of four collegiate beneficiaries of the Duke Endowment. The Duke Endowment grants sustained Furman through the Great Depression, helped the university coordinate with Greenville Woman's College in the 1930s, and bolstered the university's effort to pursue a new campus location. Furman broke ground on its current location north of its home city in 1953. The school would also become independent in 1992, breaking ties with the South Carolina Baptist Convention. It is a wonderful campus the RASMAN says go there and just walk around. Go watch a game."},{"author":"Amanda O.","datePublished":"2014-02-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Beautiful and welcoming campus with great walking paths. Several great options for a quick lunch by the lake.  Like the others,  I can't say anything about the school because I have only been a visitor."},{"author":"Nicole P.","datePublished":"2009-06-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This is a beautiful campus, I have enjoyed coming here to read a book or write a letter. {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sugar & Spice Child Care & Learning Center","telephone":"(251) 865-4628","address":{"streetAddress":"9851 School House Rd","addressLocality":"Grand Bay","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36541"},"review":[{"author":"Nicole E.","datePublished":"2014-09-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I started my son here several months ago when he was around 8 months old.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"New Beginning College Of Cosmotology","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/EB75RnmDrPeRSCct6_2i6w/l.jpg","telephone":"(256) 878-6430","address":{"streetAddress":"421 Martling Rd","addressLocality":"Albertville","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35951"},"review":[{"author":"Michelle A.","datePublished":"2017-07-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I don't live in the area, so I had my hair done when I came to town to see some close friends. I had heard from my best friend that there was a cosmetology school nearby. They were easy to find via search on maps online. I've always had good experiences with haircuts, trims and color around the country at cosmetology schools but this was by far the most professional looking school I had ever encountered! I don't know who runs it but I'd like to find out. 

First off, when I went inside, I was greeted by a beautiful, calm, almost spa-like atmosphere instead of the usual smell of perming solution and color. I don't know if I was just there on a good day or if this is the usual way, but bravo to the owner and staff for the ambience. (See picture, had I not been in a hurry that day I think I would have indulged in a full line of services and took many more pictures of the mottos on the walls).

The students and instructors, most of whom I did notice were younger and female, had well put together looks...ranging from conservative to alternative/experimental. The clientele that day were like myself: ranging from middle aged women up to the elderly. 

The young lady who did my hair consult seemed to immediately understand my hair type and I opted to get wash and waves similar to what she was wearing that day. I was going to get a trim but it wasn't necessary and I like that she didn't talk me into unneeded services, something I have unfortunately experienced at many salons.

We had a good chat about a variety of topics as she worked on my look. 

I left there feeling more confident. I should have took a before picture, as my hair was a complete humidity-trashed messed when I had arrived. 

The only downfall to the experience is despite a light dusting of hairspray, my look didn't last two days as I was hoping; it lasted twelve hours. I don't know whether to attribute that to my hair or maybe it needed the humidity-proof hairspray I have used in the past, but all in all, I give Kristen and the others a 5 out of 5 and will definitely return when I am in the area again one day."},{"author":"Kelly C.","datePublished":"2020-09-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Here's an update! One word: VANESSA! I had another woman I think her name was Aly or Amy but she was getting tutored by Vanessa who knew all the ropes around textured hair and how to maintain curly hair! She gave me a ton of advice and hair styles on how to make my hair less frizzy and what haircut to get that won't lose the pattern of my curls! If you have curly hair make sure to ask for her!!! Vanessa is amazing and she has short curly hair. She's the sweetest girl ever and has definitely changed my mind on this salon."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"DriveWell Canada","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/TzcANwJlXKDP2Wq5JlzJyA/l.jpg","telephone":"(905) 977-9633","address":{"streetAddress":"21 Stonechurch Road W","addressLocality":"Hamilton","addressCountry":"CA","addressRegion":"ON","postalCode":"L9B 1A1"},"review":[{"author":"Travis H.","datePublished":"2018-11-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Getting my license has been a many year hurdle, and I don't know if I would have gotten it were it not for Steve and DriveWell.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"McMaster University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/aEnvXWCe9bzBSb3B3dz23g/l.jpg","telephone":"(905) 525-9140","address":{"streetAddress":"1280 Main Street W","addressLocality":"Hamilton","addressCountry":"CA","addressRegion":"ON","postalCode":"L8S 4L8"},"review":[{"author":"Owen R.","datePublished":"2021-09-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"A great vibe wandering around campus...
Excitement of new beginnings, higher learning.
I like the campus store, quality clothing and reasonable price."},{"author":"Tawny T.","datePublished":"2019-07-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"One of the best Universities in Canada , MAC is well known for its Health Sciences.  Pioneering in pedagogical methodology of teaching and learning, it focuses on small groups, problem-based self-directed research and learning versus just being told what to do and memorizing in big lecture halls. MAC has also been innovating in creating new degrees and programs to meet the changing needs of Canada such as joint MD/PhD , joint Bachelor of Health and Business, joint Health and Engineering.  MAC is also the only university with an active stock trading floor.  Unfortunately, unlike University of British Columbia (UBC), it is no where near the beach and doesn't have a nude beach next to it, only a ravine called Cootes Paradise that houses the largest wetland biodiversity in all of Canada ."},{"author":"Kristy N.","datePublished":"2016-01-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"How can I dare give anything less than a five star for THE BEST UNIVERSITY AROUND.

GOOOOOOOO MAC! 
As a Marauder, my blood bleeds maroon, but I'm going to be an alumni REAL soon :( 
My reason for choosing this university still remains true, because of Science, because of the students, because of the campus, to that I say I do!

McMaster has been around for almost 130 years (next year I believe is the 130th year). Originally built in Toronto, later moved to Hamilton, McMaster is located in the city of the falls- definitely a beautiful place in the summer and fall to go hiking and explore all of the waterfalls and the trails. Spring, summer, fall and winter, McMaster is beautiful, well actually, spring is not so beautiful, but hey, that's when Lake McMaster reappears in the middle of the campus. Fall however, is LOVELY. Definitely see quite a few people taking their wedding photos here!

Centro, Bistro and Bridges are delicious places to eat. I'm so proud that Mac has such great chefs! Mary Keyes, Bates, Brandon Hall, Hedden Hall, Les Prince, Matthews, McKay, Moulton, Wallingford, Whidden and Woodstock - you've been home to many students at McMaster each year!

Cheers to graduates of 2016!!"},{"author":"Mary T.","datePublished":"2016-02-23","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"I visited McMaster with my manager to conduct co-op interviews. We held six interviews at the John Hodgins Engineering building. 

It had snowed the night before, so it took us twice as long to get there. And, yes, we were late with our first interview. Thank goodness our first candidate was so patient with us.

The staff in room A214 was great showing us the room where we were to conduct our interviews. We also got hot water and tea to start our day right.

Our room was spacious with desks and power outlets. The downside is that it kind of looked like a storage facility. None of our candidates made any remarks about the boxes and such, so we were good.

It was a nice touch that lunch was paid for. We had to go across the street to the medical building (I forget the name of it). It had a fine selection of Tim Hortons, Pizza Pizza, and more products.

Parking is typically expensive on campus. Luckily, the flat rate was capped at $20. The weird thing about the payment kiosk is that the receipt prints in the bottom area, but the plastic flap swings away from you, making it difficult to retrieve your receipt. It took me a good minute to fish it out.

I would be fine returning to McMaster to conduct another set of interviews four months from now and explore the campus more."},{"author":"Christopher F.","datePublished":"2017-11-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Excellent campus in the underrated metro area of Hamilton. Could not believe the amount of study areas encompassed within the campus! Beautiful views of the mouth of Lake Ontario. Plenty of greenery around campus to explore. Exquisite meals in each residence, with help from campus restaurants/bars. Athletic facility is rustic, yet contains all necessities. Lecture halls provide great lighting and spacious seating/work space. Would recommend to anyone that has an appreciation for nature and a clean work environment. All residences were impressive, although the suites were much of the craze. If you can afford the costly prices, a 4 or 6 person suite is the way to go for the best on-campus living experience. Much appreciation for McMaster University and all it has to offer."},{"author":"Bernie C.","datePublished":"2014-06-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I'm slightly biased and I haven't been back here in close to 8 years (crap, I'm old), but I would like to say the following:

-From 2001 to 2005, while I attended, they were constantly adding new buildings, such as new residences, new food vendors, new facilities, etc.
-One of the new facilities was a state-of-the-art gym (as of 2006 when it was built) with an indoor rock climbing wall.  
-The schooling itself was pretty good.  I would say that the math, science and medical programs are excellent while the business (Degroote) is not bad either.  
-I studied business there and while I wouldn't say the actual education was the best, they are very good at placing people in jobs.  I did an internship after my 3rd year and I got placed at PwC as an associate for 1 year.  

While I didn't go back to PwC after my 4th year, it proved to be invaluable experience as it taught me that the real world isn't anything like university. That you couldn't slack off and have no consequences.  That you can't just "cram" your work like you do for test.  It also helped me get a job after graduating.

Verdict: if you study business, try to do an internship.  It'll be very valuable."},{"author":"Markus Zachary Xavier H.","datePublished":"2010-09-15","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My alma mater so kinda bias that way.  It does have a world class Health Sciences faculty :))) and kick-ass history department.  Where else can u study Russian, Habsburg, Imperial Germany and Imperial Islamic empires under one Humanities roof??? I should have gotten into grad school :(  maybe not cause 'gotten' is not a word, baaaaa!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":7}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Columbia Southern University","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/H9QJrecu74JlRjQpAJfNrA/l.jpg","telephone":"(251) 981-3771","address":{"streetAddress":"21982 University Ln","addressLocality":"Orange Beach","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"36561"},"review":[{"author":"Kathleen A.","datePublished":"2019-09-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"CSU offers a variety of degrees and truly provides support all along the way. I was fortunate enough to get my MS in Occupational Healy & Safety from this wonderful inst. All classes were online and any time I had a question, there was someone on the other end of the phone to help walk me through things. Shout out to my former advisor Luke who always took time to answer my questions. 

 Not only does the curriculum and advising get five stars but so does graduation! It's a pretty awesome event where students from all over the world come together to celebrate.

Additionally, with respect to Safety degrees and careers, this school always represents at conferences and conventions in the industry. I know I can stop by their exhibitor booth and say hi. Everyone is friendly and helpful and they always put together great networking events to help current students and alumni meet other people in the field. Paul and Ernie- you are both awesome to say hello to during NSC and ASSP conferences.

How could I almost forget about graduation?!? People from all over the world coming together to celebrate. The staff put on an amazing event and I met some people that I am still friends with! Definitely a must when you finish your degree. Make the weekend into a fun beach vacation to celebrate.

If you are on the fence in deciding whether or not to further your education at CSU, I can tell you that my experience was amazing and I will go back when I am ready to get another degree!"},{"author":"Youknow M.","datePublished":"2022-01-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Hi everybody! In my forties I thought it was too late to go back, I was so wrong, and glad that I did.  Online schooling is a challenge as one needs to think outside the box and sometimes be a mind reader of what their professors might be looking for.  I recieved both my BS and MBA at Columbia Southern University and learned confidence in areas and schools of thought that I did not have before.  The courses will challenge you and the college is at a great price.  And before any of you go running away at the challenge, remember that the challenge is what you learn from and need to overcome.  In many of the programs you will learn more than your education, and will find a staff that has your success in mind.  The extra things I learned were patience, professionalism, and the courage to seek clarity like a pro and within academic policies and chains of command.  They are flexible and even had life flexible terms that you can choose from.  Although only a nationally accredited institution and a member of the Distance Education and Training Council, they are as of 2022 under review for being regionally accredited. 
 They also have an alumni association that students can be recommended to.  Check them out.  Good luck to all of you on your degree pursuits, and good luck to CSU on becoming regionally accredited.  ~Sincerely, a CSU Knight Ambassador."},{"author":"Donna S.","datePublished":"2021-08-29","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great experience with this school. I'm in my late 50s and I will never need the skill of properly writing an APA research paper."},{"author":"Connie S.","datePublished":"2015-09-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great university.  From a former student, my advise is that you do not get student loans.  Pay as you go and finish with NO DEBT.  For a very source of information Google "Dave Ramsey" and learn how to manage your money, how to avoid debt and pay off what you currently owe.  A university degree is personally meaningful, but make it a personal goal - not necessarily a career goal."},{"author":"steve m.","datePublished":"2015-10-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great school with good people. Attended my wife's graduation this week and CSU showed us s great time. Go Knights!"},{"author":"John B.","datePublished":"2017-08-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Graduated with a Master's degree in Human Resource Management. It was cost efficient, the classes were great. Received credit for prior graduate coursework. It's an accredited college with the Department of Education. I'm glad I chose CSU as my graduate school. Go Knights!!"},{"author":"Mitchell J.","datePublished":"2014-03-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"Taking online classes, most of the teachers are great resources. Word of warning, keep in contact with your advisor and student services rep. They are helpful if you do run in to problems with professors or course work."},{"author":"Sara S.","datePublished":"2010-07-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"For the most part I don't have a problem with the home office staff. But some of the professors need to work on their people skills."},{"author":"James C.","datePublished":"2012-08-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I received my bachelor's degree from here.  I think High School had a harder curriculum.  The chewbacca defense works when submitting essays to about 90% of the staff here.  If you want an easily attainable nationally accredited degree without having to exert basically any effort then this is your place.  Its pretty expensive too, but I don't mind.  The American Taxpayer paid my tuition!"},{"author":"Caren O.","datePublished":"2012-07-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great online university! Flexible hours and exceptional student services!"},{"author":"Shaun F.","datePublished":"2015-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Columbia Southern University is an excellent university. I have to disagree with the person who said that this college is as easy as or easier than high school. Yes, most of the work you submit is essays; however, that is the challenging part.  The coursework is very rigorous. I have attended both a b&m college as well as CSU, so I can attest that this college is definitely harder. You can't plagiarize essays because they use Turn It In for many of the classes and major points are deducted if the redundancy rate is too high. I have had this happen, even when none of my material was plagiarized. So, I had to learn to use more of my own words and and not quote so much material. If you can easily write essays, you might consider this university easy. However, if you struggle with writing and thoughts don't come as easily to you, like me, then you might have a different view of this school. In one class alone, I had to write 18 essays. It would be much easier to have multiple choice, like I did in high school or like I did when I went to my b&m college.  However, I will say that I have retained more information through my coursework at CSU than I have at any other school. I retain more information when I have to write than when I have to just memorize information for a short term. There is no extra credit or making up assignments. If you don't do the work, you will not get a good grade. I would recommend this university to any working adult who does not have time to go to college the traditional way. If you enjoy independent learning and don't have to be in a classroom,  you will like CSU.  I am a senior at CSU, graduating this year. I do not feel like my degree is being handed to me; I have worked hard for the degree that I will receive. This journey has been more time consuming and stressful than I could have ever imagined, but well worth it!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":20}}

I understand that students are working on our hair and am open to improving their learning experience, but I did not like the job done on my hair at all. The teacher seems to know what she was doing, but the student messed up a few times. I did not think anything of it at the time because I knew she was still learning while working on my hair and I thought that the teacher was fixing it as she went. Anyways, long story short, there is so much damage to my hair and I have to cut 3 inches off now despite putting oil on it everyday along with taking really good care of it. It's not my first time getting my hair dyed, so I know how to minimize damage. Also, she did not ombre it. It looks more like highlights starting at one point on my hair and does not blend into a gradient at all. It has a lot of chunky pieces and some parts of my hair near the roots are really light and my ends is really dark. I didn't noticed it at the salon because of the lighting, but it's very noticeable. Anyways, I would not go here again because all of the hard work I put into growing my hair out just to get it ombre is completely ruined. I'm basically cutting off what I paid Winonah to do. That's a waste 70 dollars that I could have used at a normal salon that would have done a better job. Now I have to pay more to get the damage out of my hair along with color correction."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2,"reviewCount":7}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Broadwater Elementary School","telephone":"(406) 324-1130","address":{"streetAddress":"900 Hollins Ave","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MT","postalCode":"59601"},"review":[{"author":"Tea W.","datePublished":"2019-02-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I went to this wonderful school k-5. It really truly was a family to me. I made one fantastic friend and many other friends. Now I didn't give it 5 stars because I was bullied from one person for basically all my elementary school career. I would not blame that bully on my teachers not caring, because they did. They helped me get through the struggles  a lot of the time. The teachers all care about you and make excited to learn. I hope this helps and you are considering to go to Broadwater. Have a wonderful day."},{"author":"Morgan N.","datePublished":"2018-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"i went to school here from first grade to fifth, and honestly. not great. i had a lot of problems with bullying, the teachers didn't seem to care about their students well being when it came to bullying, or education for that matter. i did have some good teachers, don't get me wrong, but the bad outweighed the good by a lot. one time\nmy fifth grade teacher took me to the back of the room after school and yelled at me to apologize to her, because i had called her out after months of scrutiny and just absurd rudeness to other students as well as myself. other students were SO rude and cliquey, which seems weird for an elementary school. not to say that doesn't happen but it was out of character, i think. i actually moved schools one year because of family reasons, and i was behind on everything. i could go on, there are so many more topics i missed. there was SOME good at this school, i really liked some teachers and there were some fun projects, and i still have some\nfriends from elementary school. but, don't take your chance with this school. if you live in the area, don't consider this school for your kids. just take them somewhere else, it's not worth it."},{"author":"Tessa M.","datePublished":"2012-02-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"My children went here one year. We specifically chose this school because it is the one my husband attended as a child and the one in our district was over capacity and not taking more students. We only stayed the one year due to the problems we experienced at this school. Bullying was a major issue amongst the children and none of the staff or administrators seemed to take the issue very seriously at all. Children who were mild mannered were often paired with children who were aggressive and out of control because "they could handle it" even though they were only children. My child specifically was paired with an aggressive child because my child was mild mannered and they considered him a "good influence". While I understand that helping out others should be encouraged, 8 year olds are not counselors and certainly should not be responsible for dealing with aggressive children. When our children left that school, my youngest was a full year behind in math when we transferred to another local school. I was never contacted about there being a problem at all. I also volunteered to be at the school for special events or whatever, but was never called. As a matter of fact, I felt parental involvement was highly discouraged instead of encouraged. The reason we left was to find a better school."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":2.5,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"The Tutoring Center","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/T10lmU9C2kCSM0dIdHLK_w/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 987-9577","address":{"streetAddress":"2804 John Hawkins Pkwy

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside). 

Concession stands had the typical staples you'd expect to find at a High School football game, including hot dogs and burgers as well as an assortment of candy and drinks. Also, it looked like they had brought in Chick-fil-A sandwiches and were selling those too!

Good atmosphere for all ages! Would recommend for a place to check out some local HS football."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sleeping Giant Flying Club","telephone":"(406) 443-0066","address":{"streetAddress":"3080 Airport Rd","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"MT","postalCode":"59601"},"review":[{"author":"Bob S.","datePublished":"2017-03-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Brent Vetter, a mechanic with Vetter Aviation and Sleeping Giant Flying Club, is EXTREMELY racist, unprofessional, and unwelcoming. I was receiving ground school from another club instructor in the Vetter Aviation building, and Brent Vetter was in the adjacent room saying disparaging remarks against black and Hispanic people to one of his students. Brent used the word "n*gger" about a black hotel clerk he was unsatisfied with on a vacation. Additionally, how he "received a free whopper from Burger King for submitting a comment saying 'he wants to be able to understand peoples English when he comes through the drive-through' and not the trash they speak south of the boarder." I thought this was supposed to be a classroom??\n\nThis behavior cannot be tolerated in general aviation or anywhere in our community. I was a new pilot obtaining my private pilots license and this incident has forever tainted my outlook on the general aviation community in Helena. I am no longer a member of this club because of this incident. And I refuse to give my hard earned money to an organization that tolerates this behavior. We need to take a stand against people like Brent Vetter, who is intolerant against those who are different, and be welcoming of EVERYONE regardless of who they are."},{"author":"Dan K.","datePublished":"2013-04-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The Sleeping Giant Flying Club (SGFC) is a non-profit flying club based at the Helena Regional Airport in beautiful Helena, Montana. Whether your goal is to become a Private Pilot (PP) or work your way all the way to Airline Transport Pilot (ATP), we can take you where you want to be."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Montessori Kids Universe Homewood","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/tTj3FqfkmO95t4n2gaaRsA/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 848-2714","address":{"streetAddress":"2041 Brookwood Medical Center Dr","addressLocality":"Homewood","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35209"},"review":[{"author":"Rashmee S.","datePublished":"2019-05-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"We very much appreciate MKU. When we were looking for childcare and early education options for our son, we knew MKU was our choice school upon witnessing first hand the method, the facilities, the teachers, and the diversity of the student body. As American Muslims raised in Alabama, navigating the intersectionality of our various identities was often challenging, and upon becoming parents, we wanted to ensure our son would be cared for in an environment that embraces each individual child and their unique attributes. The staff here is highly professional and caring. The facilities are clean and uncluttered. I'm continually impressed by the activities that our now 14 month old partakes in: various fruit tastings, artwork, Spanish lessons, circle time, etc...So far, despite the expense (comparable to similar facilities in the area) we are so happy with our choice and eagerly look forward to our son's continued growth and development at this school/daycare."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Mathnasium","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/h01vxUVecY7XwHIqpTv-vw/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 437-3322","address":{"streetAddress":"410 Inverness Cors","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35242"},"review":[{"author":"Steve L.","datePublished":"2019-07-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"So five years later, all three kids making straight A's in math.  My oldest daughter wants to do advanced math with her twin brother.  She asks to return back to Mathnasium.  We have all three  go.   My youngest daughter was super strong in all areas except two.  

My oldest son is doing algebra I in 8th grade.  He was strong in most areas with a few missing.  Both older kids struggled on some parts of the assessment because they were not allowed to use calculators.  

Apparently, they both make straight A's in middle school because they know how to use a calculator.  Thirty days later attending 3 days a week and oldest son and youngest daughters are great with masteries on weak areas. My oldest daughter is going 4-5 days a week to get ready for Algebra I after taking no pre-Algebra classes.

I ask my kids how is it?  All of them say...Mathnasium teaches math in such a way that makes it easier and faster to learn.

I am a huge fan of this place because I have seen how they took two young kids confused by common core (youngest does not have it) and turn them into A students and confident in math.  This summer will hopefully give all three a strong foundation to continue as they prepare for high school!"},{"author":"James N.","datePublished":"2019-09-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"These guys are VERY good at what they do. Daughter was in an accelerated math class, when she missed several days of school. Upon returning, she was hopelessly behind. Thinking she had an understanding, she proceeded to take and fail the next two exams. Mathnasium turned things around. She caught up and, after managing a C for that grade period, she got an A in her subsequent period. Thanks again to Mathnasium."},{"author":"Sue W.","datePublished":"2015-12-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is one of the best math tutoring places I've been to, and I have been to a lot. Excellent tutors, great communication and reasonably priced.  I can't recommend A+ high enough."},{"author":"Catherine F.","datePublished":"2015-12-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I have recommended Mathnasium to many friends and family, as well as on social media. As a parent, my stress level greatly decreased after my child started going to Mathnasium. They helped my child when I couldn't. The flexibility of mathnasium cannot be beat for busy families."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":4}}

It breaks my heart from the last review I read and I cannot look away without writing something. From the school, kids, teaching staff I have NEVER had any bad experiences and the love of Christ is definitely in this place. The kids are taught to love each other as the Bible teaches us to love. After graduation each of my children have remained in contact with their college professors who have been supportive long after graduation. Visit and see what  you think.
