Our daughter is learning so much from only an hour session (and she loves it!)"},{"author":"'chenna C.","datePublished":"2016-11-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"It has been ONE Year since I started tutoring for Teacher Tutors, so please allow me to give my opinion of them and how they work with their tutors.

As you may suspect, I've also worked with other tutoring companies - online and on-the-ground (with a real-life office).  All you tutors know how these companies charge clients a large amount of money and pay tutors almost nothing in comparison. Teacher Tutors tells you upfront how much you will be paid for the students you agree to tutor.  Work for Teacher Tutors and you will be paid very well.

Just as I'm sure every tutor wants to work for a quality company and have quality (serious) clients, Teacher Tutors wants to work with quality tutors. They want to get to know you as a tutor.  They want to know how you will work with their clients. They do the client recruiting, the set-up, the pay, the customer service.  What do you do as a tutor?  You tutor. :-)  You provide a session report that both Teacher Tutors and the parents/student can read.  It's for you too, so you can keep track of what you've been covering with each student.  

Teacher Tutors is a Great company to work for.  They are always available to guide you through the tutoring process.  They want to know your schedule, so they can work around it.  They want to be sure their tutors represent them well, that their tutors are comfortable with them, and that their work is exceptional.  

The people at Teacher Tutors are laid back, inviting, and very professional.  Teacher Tutors is a top-notch tutoring company.  I should know; I've dealt with many of the others.  Of those I know, Teacher Tutors has THE HIGHEST PAY RATE of them all.  Trying to find a tutoring company that does all the footwork for you, works with your schedule and pays well is hard...but I found it.  It's Teacher Tutors!!  

If you are considering working for a tutoring service, Teacher Tutors is the way to go.  They bring the clients.  You bring your tutoring skills.  And so long as there is mutual respect and professionalism, neither party will be disappointed.  Teacher Tutors deserves many kudos for the work they do and the services they offer.  I'm giving that to them in this review....

"Kudos, Teacher Tutors....Kudos!!!!"

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Cane Creek School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/Ebl5qH6dHXP_VGniG2Uwsw/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 477-5711","address":{"streetAddress":"12632 Confederate Pkwy
Tannehill Ironworks Historical State Park","addressLocality":"McCalla","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35111"},"review":[{"author":"Melissa B.","datePublished":"2014-03-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The Cane Creek School was built in 1923 and moved from Warrior to Tannehill in 1981. It has two large rooms, one with old school desks that can be moved within the room and the other is an open room with one twelve foot long "permanent" table and three short pews against the walls. There are folding tables and chairs that can be setup. Off the open room the cloak closet has been converted to a partial kitchen - a sink with cold running water and a refrigerator. The school has two restrooms, air-conditioning and heat. There is a handicap ramp, convenient parking and about four picnic tables outside.

The cost for using the school is $135.00 per day. Folks coming in the park pay regular gate admission which is $3.00 for adults (12-61), $2.00 for seniors (62+), $1.00 for children (6-11) and children ages five and under free.

When making a reservation for the School, a $60.00 deposit is due at the time of scheduling. The balance is due 2 weeks before scheduled date. A $10.00 service fee is assessed on all cancellations. You must cancel 14 day before the reservation date to receive a refund less the $10.00 service fee. However, if you cancel less than 14 days before the reservation date your deposit will be forfeited. You may notify the office of the cancellation by phone, but you must send a written request before the refund can be made.

For an event that you wish to pay the gate admission for guests, we can provide tickets based on an estimated attendance. You distribute the tickets and folks turn them in at the gate for admission. You only pay for the actual number of tickets turned in at the gate. Please remember to call in advance about tickets so you will have time to receive and distribute them."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside). 

Concession stands had the typical staples you'd expect to find at a High School football game, including hot dogs and burgers as well as an assortment of candy and drinks. Also, it looked like they had brought in Chick-fil-A sandwiches and were selling those too!

Good atmosphere for all ages! Would recommend for a place to check out some local HS football."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}

I am sure it wasnt the first time that the employee did it, and due to managements lack of action, it wont be the last."},{"author":"Amanda M.","datePublished":"2012-09-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I cannot speak for the previous reviews, however, I cannot imagine any of that going on at Kid Plus. I have been taking my kids there for 3 years and they love it. My first born started as a baby, and my other child started at 6 weeks old. The staff is incredibly helpful and takes the time to get to know each child and their needs. I get a hand written report daily that lets me know what times their diapers were changed, how long they napped, and what they ate. Sometimes when I come to pick my kids up they don't even want to leave because they are too busy playing with the other kids and the teachers. They have excellent playing areas. The "big kid" playground has plenty of jungle gyms, swings, bikes, etc. as well as a lot of grass for them to run around and play tag. The teachers are always out there playing with them games such as duck duck goose, and red rover. The little kid playground has lots of smaller toys for the toddlers and the teachers are always pushing the babies in the swings. The meals are included in your tuition and my son always talks about how good the food is. He especially loves when they have corn dog nuggets. The center even has a K-4 program that my son will be starting next year that I am so excited for. Overall, I have seen a huge difference in my children compared to other peoples children who do not go to Kid Plus. My children are far more advanced due to the hardwork and dedication the teachers put into each child. They don't just sit them down in front of a TV or send them to the playground to do whatever they want. Every day is structured with a schedule which helps us out at home because my son has a routine, which helps his behavior out a lot. The teachers always do crafts as well, my fridge is covered in a million different pictures my kids have done over the years. They always bring home sweet little poems with handprints for mothers/fathers day. The teachers also try to have parties for the different holidays and nothing makes my kids happier than bringing cupcakes to school and getting to share them with their friends. I would reccommend Kid Plus to every parent out there. I could not imagine having a better day care facility to take my kids to. In fact, I will be sad when my oldest has to leave day care to go to the elementary school. I will probably leave him in their after school program so I can pick up both my children at once."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside). 

Concession stands had the typical staples you'd expect to find at a High School football game, including hot dogs and burgers as well as an assortment of candy and drinks. Also, it looked like they had brought in Chick-fil-A sandwiches and were selling those too!

Good atmosphere for all ages! Would recommend for a place to check out some local HS football."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Vallley Swim Club","telephone":"(719) 444-8926","address":{"streetAddress":"1111 N 31st St","addressLocality":"Colorado Springs","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CO","postalCode":"80904"},"review":[{"author":"Tim K.","datePublished":"2018-07-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Valley Swim Club is a members only facility, but thanks to friends my wife and I were able to visit as guests the other day. Great location on the westside, family friendly environment, and friendly staff - those are just a few of the things that get people in the door.

I don't know all the specifics about membership but there is a high dollar (but partially refundable) up front membership fee, and annual dues as well. Members' guests are $5 a person.

The pool supplies two massive BBQ grills (could use some new BBQ tools). Nice perk so you can eat what you want and on your own grocery budget dime. Alcohol is allowed (no glass though), that's another perk!

Plenty of grassy area for lounging, picnics, and napping. 

There are two pools: one kiddie pool that has a max depth of 1.5 feet and the other pool has lanes for laps, a 12 foot deep part with a diving board and slide.

We went on a Friday evening, it was perfect. Not too many people and a great vibe.

Oh. There's a sand volleyball pit too."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Madison Glass Academy","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/JO5HZ9sYl2JbPDBDgdwcVg/l.jpg","priceRange":"Pricey","telephone":"(608) 422-5033","address":{"streetAddress":"438 N Frances St","addressLocality":"Madison","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"WI","postalCode":"53704"},"review":[{"author":"J. G.","datePublished":"2020-03-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Not something I would normally elect to do but my daughter gave us the groupon for two so why not?  I'm really glad we did this, I think you will too if you are thinking about it.

Park in the Frances Street ramp and walk a short distance to the basement of the white house just before State Street Brats. No bathrooms but it's just an hour for the beginner class. Reservations were a bit funkie and it is a cramped head-shop with a workbench in the back.  Nothing unexpected for down town Madison.

The class was awesome, the instructor Adrian is the one that made it that way.  Knowledgeable, informative, patient and engaging.  Not only explained what he was doing but the why, including some of the physics & chemistry that go into glass blowing.  It's not as easy as he made it look but you come away with something you made that you will likely keep forever including the experience you had doing it."},{"author":"Java P.","datePublished":"2019-09-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Bought a Groupon for a 1hr Glassblowing Class for 2, great deal especially since I got it with a 20% discount.

Pros:
-Adrian was a great instructor/coach, patient and highly knowledgeable. He was chill and safely guided us through the various techniques to properly use/apply the blow torch, thermal art theory, and glass properties.
-Total active time including instruction and making glassware is about 1hr, then about 20-30min wait to collect your art. The glass needs to cool down gradually in a blanket to avoid thermal shock: good thing the class is located off of State Street, so wander off but don't forget to come back.
-The class is in a small room in the back of a CBD store. Small workbench and 2 stools to sit on during demo with a spot in the corner to hang your coat. Plenty of space to work in.
-During creation, you will be standing in front of the blow torch. I don't think you're allowed to sit, due to safety: proximity to the fire and gasses.
-One stop shop for some people. Curious place for those new to functional glass art.
-Small private class for 2, special request for bigger groups. Good idea for a date night, everyone walks away with something cool!
-During introductions, Adrian showed us a tray of the things we could make (pendants, stir sticks, ornaments) to showcase beginner class techniques we would learn.

Cons:
-Location is a little bit hidden, the shop is in the basement of the white house looking establishment NEXT to State Street Brats on N. Frances St. watch for the small street sign next to the sidewalk.
-The CBD Store has a lot of locked displays on the floor, so it can get pretty cramped in there.
-Originally made our reservation online, the site said it was confirmed but I never got the email confirmation. I had to email them to verify the reservation (48hr response), by the time they replied my chosen time was booked by someone else so the shop gave me the next available time slot which, luckily, turned out to be a better option for us. But still, when you register online take a screen shot of the preliminary confirmation page before you exit the page, then double check your inbox for the confirmation email. There are penalties for cancelled reservations and no shows, read the MGA policies.
-No restrooms in the shop. If you need it, go to State Street Brats: use the closest entrance from MGA, go through the door on the left, and the ladies' room will be immediately on the left."},{"author":"Emily W.","datePublished":"2018-03-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Extremely friendly staff, and very informative. If you're a first time customer, they offer you a free gift! The owner took the time to speak with us about products and was very dedicated to making sure we were very happy. Amazing service!"},{"author":"Justin O.","datePublished":"2014-09-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"not just a head shop this place actually has high end art items and a lot of gear. Teaching staff for personal or group classes has me recommending them for one of the stops on your next downtown shopping venture"},{"author":"Dustin D.","datePublished":"2015-07-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This place was pretty cool. The staff working was super nice. We did the beginners glass blowing class with a groupon. It was pretty expensive, but most other glass blowing places are. The dude teaching before us seemed very experienced with glass blowing, but we ended up having a guy who had just recently started there. However, he was nice and helpful. There were two options to make, a stir stick or a pendant - we both made pendants. The guy did a good job of showing us how to make it. They gave us water bottles while we were waiting. It was about a 30 minute wait for the pendants to cool off before we could take them. They also print you a certificate of completion to bring home as well."},{"author":"Ben P.","datePublished":"2016-05-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"When it comes to which places I shop at obviously quality and price and important, but my deciding factor is customer service. This shop has the best customer service I've ever had the pleasure of experiencing; willing to help you find what you need with a vast knowledge of the products and after purchase service being beyond exceptional as they've helped me so many times. The people who work here are understanding and empathetic with customers leading to great deals and transactions. I have not had a single problem with this store and only have good things to say. This is the best shop on State Street and more people to know that."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":6}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Edgewood College","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/kuOPUbssASrDvxbyk8FmUw/l.jpg","telephone":"(608) 663-4861","address":{"streetAddress":"1000 Edgewood College Dr","addressLocality":"Madison","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"WI","postalCode":"53711"},"review":[{"author":"Joyce G.","datePublished":"2012-10-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Undergrad Review  from a visiting lecturer perspective:

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Sage Oak Charter Schools","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/d9FIPkMi09oQGpL3EBmHXQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(888) 435-4445","address":{"streetAddress":"1473 Ford St
Ste 105","addressLocality":"Redlands","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92373"},"review":[{"author":"Eileen R.","datePublished":"2022-09-04","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I started working for Sage Oak just after the 2021/2022 school year began, soon after I saw what they had to offer I transitioned my own children to Sage Oak. The 2022/2023 school year will; be our first full year and so far the journey has been amazing with Sage Oak. There is a high standard for teachers and students while still allowing flexibility."},{"author":"Alison W.","datePublished":"2021-03-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"As a vendor for this school for almost a decade (along with several others) they have recently made themselves hard to work with. I have several students who have begged me to sign back up but they now require certain items, such as a website, and when they go through it they won't approve you if a link is not working, or it doesn't have what they want. Even if it fulfills their "requirements" they will translate those into something else, such as having a "working website" means no link on your site can be "broken". Lots of working websites have a broken link and it doesn't mean the site is not working. 

Then they tell me, after approving the site over 2 weeks time, that I have to pre-record my tutor lesson or do in person lessons (amidst the pandemic) but live virtual lessons are no longer allowed (last year they were all that was allowed and that is the only way the students are allowed to meet with the sage oak teachers). So basically I can either visit with a dozen+ families (and contaminate all of them if I become infected) or give my students a pre-recorded lesson where they might as well just buy a dvd of lessons somewhere else to save $. Tutoring doesn't work that way. I sense a lack of common sense here...

The staff is all but helpful. They don't seem to care about how it affects their students. It doesn't affect me since my sage oak students pay me out of their own pockets right now but it bothers me because they shouldn't have to. Many parents have decided to move schools because this became an issue with their vendors so it's just a matter of waiting this year out. All my other charter students with other schools are blessed with payments by their schools. Springs Charter School, in comparison, has been much easier to work with."},{"author":"Erin C.","datePublished":"2020-09-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My kids have been with Sage since they started. I think it's a great charter. I find they respond extremely fast to any questions. The only area we have had any issues in 5-6 years is field trips. The staff in charge, has been less than patient and sometimes very rude."},{"author":"Cheryl M.","datePublished":"2020-03-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"My Daughter and her friend have been attending and do all their work together. They ended up with 2 separate teacher facilitators, and have been given different workload expectations with no real assessment of learning abilities or capabilities. After 5 months without any form of communication about the possibility in face to face meetings, I received emails about performance improvement plans with 2 learning periods worth of work to complete in 2 weeks. Which was a lot more than her friend's teacher was having her complete, and with no improvment plan issued to her. They seem to let the teachers do what they want with workload based on no set expectations. If you are looking for something more independent from the public school, I would not suggest them."},{"author":"Karen W.","datePublished":"2020-03-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Both my kids are a solid year ahead in math and ELA. We have been with Charter Schools since pre-K and followed our amazing TF to Sage Oak a few years ago. The school will allow you to find the best tools and resources for your kids. They are there for help and guidance anytime. It's been an amazing program for us and has allowed the kids multiple other opportunities. They have more time for extracurricular activity and can advance in their studies faster than in traditional school. They both test above grade level on their state testing as well. We have an amazing program and our curriculum works for us. We do pay extra for some classes. Education is important."},{"author":"Lisa B.","datePublished":"2020-01-06","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"They responded , but it's no reason for them to not act for six months . Simple fact is I was approved to go there and they had no staff ! I stand by my review ."},{"author":"Anthony D.","datePublished":"2020-03-03","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"We were with Sage Oak Charter for only 6 month's and it was a horrible experience. The cirriculum we ordered in Summer at the beggining of the school year didn't come through and there was no response from the Vendor. I tried ordering a second time in December and the same issue occurred. We also waited 2 month's for his Science experiments which my son was supposed to receive monthly but never did. Then once our TF finally received our Waldorf Curriculum we had to move out of the area and the Charter refused to give us it even though it was considered non-reusable. To add they also cancelled our 2 field trips at the last min. We arrived at one of them and hadn't been informed. We had been asked by the TF if we would still be attending and I said yes because we had previously paid for them and also I paid put of pocket for the adult. It was clear all they cared about was the money and not enough about the principle and doing what was right. I've known other's who have gone through Charter's like Inspire and never had these issue's. I thought positively at first but now after all the hassle would never recommend Sage Oak."},{"author":"Emily G.","datePublished":"2017-11-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This has been a very good homeschooling experience for my daughter and I. I have Mrs. Holton as our T.F (teacher you meet with once a month that helps or doesn't help whatever you want) she's been amazing. I told her I would like her to be involved and let me know how she thinks my child is doing and so far she's doing great. This gives you the chance to homeschool but with help if u need it. I don't feel so lost I have someone I can ask questions to. They do field trips and park days as well so there's opportunities to meet families going the same route. They allow your student to have a set amount of money to buy their school books (that you get to hand pick!) and field trips with and extra circular activities with. They have everything from singing, dancing, karate, cooking, you name it they have it. My daughter is in preK and so far it's been a good choice. We hope this is our school of choice for my daughters years in school. This is also considered public school so if tomorrow I wanted to put her in a traditional Monday-Friday public school I can.

Update: The year ended today 6/8/18 and it was a success. I am so glad I found this charter homeschool. I highly recommend Sage Oak!"},{"author":"M C.","datePublished":"2018-09-16","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is my first year homeschooling and I love it and more importantly my son loves it. 

  My TF is amazing. She makes it easy for me to contact her. She answers questions immediately or within 24hrs. She orders items immediately as well and if there is any delay in an order she is on top of it by calling the company to figure out the issue. She also makes it easy for my son to talk to her during our monthly meetings. 
 
There are so many opportunities for socialization for the children. There are park days, field trips,  social events (reptile education, lending library so far but more events to come), also trips to college campuses. 

The curriculum options are amazing. I chose curriculum that was not common core.  The opportunity to change the curriculum is there. If I feel it is necessary to adapt to my child's needs I am able to adjust it.
 The curriculum is paid through educational funds SO IT'S IMPORTANT TO RESEARCH BEFORE PURCHASE. The educational funds are NOT REIMBURSED once spent.  Once you run out of educational funds you're responsible for purchasing additional resources or curriculum."},{"author":"Jenna C.","datePublished":"2019-01-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I absolutely love this charter. It's the independent study with support! We have been with Sage Oak for 3 years now with the same TF and it has been enjoyable! Plenty of funds for my elementary school child and tons of planned activities if you don't already have your own support group. Highly highly recommend!"},{"author":"Kacey J.","datePublished":"2017-02-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I love Sage Oak and our T.A. is fabulous.  Miss Katie make things so simple.  She gives home schoolers as much or as little help as they need. I love that she stops by my home each month and keeps us accountable. We get around 3K in home school funds for each kid which actually goes pretty far.  We were new at it this year and I am overjoyed that I made the choice to home school my 4 girls. First, and most exciting is that by dropping out of public school,  we got our family life back!!   At public school, we often had 2.5 hours worth of homework and much of it was "busy" work.  God forbid we wanted to go out to dinner or watch a movie on a school night!  No chance.  And this was when our triplets were in SECOND grade and our older child was in third.  Don't get me started on Common Core Math and what we had to go through with that.  Now, we do all of our school work during the day and there's no early morning scramble to get to school.  How nice!  My kids have made huge progress learning this way. One of my daughters has epilepsy and thee public school had her in a Special Ed class that was horrendous.  Her goal last year was to write her name.  So pathetic. Now she is reading!  Of course, we do it with outside help including tutors at Kumon and Within Reach.  Seriously, I feel like we stepped off the hamster wheel of life.  I can't recommend home schooling enough and especially through Sage Oak."},{"author":"Alicia T.","datePublished":"2016-11-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"This school is a joke! Gives children very little support, gives parents no back up. Will not allow you to change courses if even deemed too hard. Gives special treatment to different parents and kids. If you are not one of the "chosen ones" you get little to no support. If you ask for a new TF they will not give you one. I will not be telling anyone anything good about this school. If your child has any special needs please don't even enroll. I thought this school would be what our family had been looking for they promise more then they can give. The TF we had talked down to us and belittled my husband who has a Masters degree. The TF acted like we were beneath her and like she had no time for us. What a waste of my time and our child's. This school could care less about you and your child's needs. Please go check out other schools before this one. If I could give this review 0 stars I would."},{"author":"Hilary S.","datePublished":"2016-08-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This charter school is the perfect fit for people who want to homeschool their children but want a little support.  They offer a teacher to help guide you through the process of setting up lesson plans and setting appropriate goals for the year.   Also, they have an extensive list of vendors, that meet their stringent requirements for approval, for you to order lessons (my kids use their lesson money for piano, spanish and a robotics programing course there is a full list here http://www.sageoak.education/vendors/vendor-list).  The staff are quick to respond to any concerns or areas requiring extra support.  If you are looking for a supportive homeschooling partner look no further -- Sage Oak is a great fit."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":13}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Vanilla Bean","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/PwfO-VYnzBHUHf1coYEKHQ/l.jpg","priceRange":"Moderate","telephone":"(608) 833-3050","address":{"streetAddress":"6805 Odana Rd","addressLocality":"Madison","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"WI","postalCode":"53719"},"review":[{"author":"Sarah F.","datePublished":"2020-10-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Whether you own a baking business or you are making cupcakes for a friend, Vanilla Bean is one of the best places in Madison to find everything you need. Their selection is better than any big box store (including the nearby Joann) and they have the boxes/packing for all your needs.

I started my baking company a year ago and Vanilla Bean has been everything I wanted and needed. They keep a stock for all the upcoming holidays and have a wall of cookie cutters of everything you could possibly imagine. Then they have cake and cupcake toppers and plastic characters for parties and milestones also ok that wall. 

They have a huge selection of flavors and food coloring -- both are highest quality. Their gel colors have been my saving grace! Also, all of their tools, accessories, little things you can use are available. It makes this an awesome place to explore for any baking enthusiast. 

When I was in the State fair, Vanilla Bean had the cake dummies (styrofoam) I needed and at cheaper prices than Joann or online. They also have all the boxes and cake rounds for the bases that you could need. They also have pans for shaped cakes and characters.

It's one of my favorite places in Madison -- go visit!"},{"author":"Kathy R.","datePublished":"2022-02-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I can honestly say that this store is great and has everything/anything you would need for baking on any level! I'm just starting out, but the people in here know their stuff and have been super helpful with questions and inquiries. Now I'm thinking that I can't live without it, but I guess I don't have to. It's also close to home. Win-win!!"},{"author":"Sarajane L.","datePublished":"2021-02-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"We visited in mid-February 2021. Half empty shelves. No effort whatsoever to limit the number of people allowed inside the store to shop at one time, never mind any encouragement for customers to socially distance in the store's narrow aisles. This is a store design that screams for one way only aisles. Clearly unhappy, bordering on surly, cashier. The pandemic has hit this formerly beloved store hard, and they aren't rolling with the punches as they could and should be. We found about half of the things we went in for, and left feeling very stressed out by the whole experience. Very sad to have to give a much lower rating than usual. The bright spot was the high school age girl who was very smiling, friendly, and earnestly trying her best to get us what we needed, but unfortunately also seemingly unaware that unrelated people cannot stand right next to each other during a pandemic. Felt so bad for her. I hope she stays well. I won't shop in the store again until the danger has well passed."},{"author":"Ryan P.","datePublished":"2020-11-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"Usually, I like Vanilla Bean as they have a large variety of products.  I called to inquire if they carry hot chocolate bomb molds.  I was informed, yes - but due to high demand they are limiting to one per CUSTOMER.  Great - no problem.  My mother-in-law drove over and purchased one and the clerk informed her it was one per FAMILY.  I met her there in order to purchase one for myself.  The clerk then changed her mind and said one per GROUP and demanded my name to write in a book as they are tracking purchases of the molds.  We don't even live in the same house.  I'm very DISAPPOINTED and won't be going back anytime soon.

I have no problem with the limit.  It is the manner in which the "rules" constantly changed and the tone in which it was conveyed.  Also, you can purchase the same item as 2-pack of molds for $6 on amazon versus $8.95 each at Vanilla Bean."},{"author":"Lauren H.","datePublished":"2017-01-19","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I really like this store! I have purchased several unique baking items at Vanilla Bean that I haven't been able to find at the grocery store, craft stores or Amazon. Because I've now found so many unique items at Vanilla Bean, I now only purchase baking-type items at Vanilla Bean. I don't even look at other retailers. 

Vanilla Bean is my go-to place for purchasing cellophane treat bags and foldable treat boxes. Because my parents and most relatives live outside of Wisconsin, I do lots of baking for their birthdays and for Christmas and ship them treats. The bags and boxes at Vanilla Bean are perfect for packaging up my treats. I've also purchased some unique colors of food coloring as well as melting chocolates at Vanilla Bean.

The staff people are always helpful and know the answers to my questions. The credit card machine at Vanilla Bean is a little slow, so you won't have the speediest transaction at the register. But you're buying sprinkles, so you're in a good mood. 

I recommend Vanilla Bean for anything and everything you might need baking!"},{"author":"Cristabel R.","datePublished":"2020-09-05","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Love this place. I took a few advanced decorating classes and they were well taught. It is a bit on the expensive side but they have a good selection of cake decorating supplies."},{"author":"Caroline M.","datePublished":"2009-05-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"The Vanilla Bean now carries high quality gel paste colors!  They are called Americolor and provide more vibrant and "true" color shades than the Wilton ones.  

They also now have Sugar Art brand petal and luster dusts!

I'm so excited by this and I don't even live in Madison :)   Happy cake decorating!"},{"author":"K V.","datePublished":"2018-01-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Wow.  Who'd-a-thunk you could get something for about the same price as Amazon at a small, locally owned, specialty store?  In my case, I needed some simple 8" round cake pans.  The usual suspects (Wal Mart, Target, BBB) all had the more common 9" pans. This place had 8" pans (and about 10 other sizes), well stocked and well priced (I expected to be charged out the wazoo).  Their website kinda sucks, so be forewarned that they don't seem to sell any ingredients (besides decorations), but when you want to do baking right, with the right gear (or at least not screw it up with the wrong gear) this place is great."},{"author":"Erin B.","datePublished":"2016-11-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This is the perfect place to find decorations for whatever you're baking! I always come here for holiday treat supplies. Cookie cutters, gingerbread house supplies, sprinkles and other cool things to put on cupcakes, and that's pretty much just one aisle. Boxes, baking sheets, stuff for fancy cakes and a bunch of other things I don't know anything about. But that's ok, because the staff is very friendly and helpful! They offer some classes too. One downside, much of their merchandise is pretty expensive.  But to get some fun holiday supplies, this is definitely the place!"},{"author":"Matt W.","datePublished":"2014-02-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"The selection is incredible - I've yet to leave empty-handed, no matter how esoteric my search.  They cram an unbelievable amount of inventory into a very small space, so the layout of the store takes some getting used to.  Pricing is reasonable, slightly more than on-line sources, but a good value considering the expertise of the staff.  They also have a decent selection of kitchen gadgets, though not to the level of Orange Tree Imports or the Kitchen Gallery.

While the staff members are not over-the-top friendly, they are incredibly knowledgeable.  I also like the fact that they will let my daughter and I browse freely when we have the time to explore.  The store also offers a variety of baking and cake decorating classes for all skill levels.

Finding a parking spot in front of the store is a breeze, but navigating the congested Odana Road corridor to get to the store - not so much fun.

If you are in need of baking supplies, I encourage you to check out the Vanilla Bean."},{"author":"Jen W.","datePublished":"2015-07-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I made my sister's wedding cake last month and without Vanilla Bean I'd have been SOL. They had all of the supplies I needed, from cardboard circles (that you can buy individually whereas at Michael's or Joann you need to buy a pack of 8) decorator tips (even the obscure ones), fillings, flower nails and boxes and also knowledgeable staff people who were able to offer advice and talk me off the ledge I was perched on after baking for 14 hours straight. If you fancy yourself any sort of baker, this is your shop."},{"author":"Kelly N.","datePublished":"2012-09-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"If you are looking for cake decorating and baking supplies this is where you need to go!!

Although their hours aren't great, they do have everything you would need to make an adorable birthday cake, Christmas cookies, and more! The selection of cookie cutters is the largest I've seen anywhere.  

I've also taken a Wilton cake decorating class through them, and it was fabulous.  It was more work than I expected, but I learned a lot!"},{"author":"Laura Kate S.","datePublished":"2012-10-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"A fabulous local shop. It had been a number of years since I last visited Vanilla Bean, but I stopped in looking for a specialty cake item today. Sure enough, they had it! (A number of other stores didn't even know what I was talking about when I enquired!). Very reasonable prices for specialty baking items and a very great selection  - especially considering the size of the shop. Many items for cakes, cupcakes, candy making, half a wall of cookie cutters and supplies for making traditional Scandinavian desserts. Get thee to Vanilla Bean!"},{"author":"Barbara W.","datePublished":"2010-11-20","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I can't say enough wonderful things about this store.  I've been buying candy-making supplies and related gift boxes and other things there for years now; I can't say that I've ever gone in there and left thinking that I couldn't find something that wouldn't work for what I wanted.  I've always especially enjoyed their basic candy discs (chocolate and other flavors, plus extracts you can add) and the huge variety of molds and accessories you can use to create your own gourmet candy.  Now they have extra dusts and bits that you can decorate the tops with to add a little special something too!

I'd always given the candy I'd made as gifts for my son's teachers and to friends, and Vanilla Bean has a ton of special boxes and bags you can assemble, as well as inserts and cards.  You can make so many personalized, yummy gifts from top to bottom here.  It's just my favorite place to go when I want to get crafty with sweets."},{"author":"Timothy S.","datePublished":"2015-02-07","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"This place is awesome.  Bakers, weddings, cupcake and cookie ideas, ingredients, kitchen supplies.  Wonderful store.  Be creative and get new ideas."},{"author":"K E S.","datePublished":"2009-04-09","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I completely agree with the first poster. This is THE place for anyone who has a bit of a creative baking side- or wants to get ideas so they can pretend they're Martha Stewart. Or are looking for specific cookie cutter shapes, candy molds, cake garnishes, etc. They have an entire wall of cookie-cutter shapes that is my favorite! It's kind of a hidden gem in Madison- if you didn't grow up here, you might not have heard of it or know where it is, but it's definitely worth stopping by on your way to/from West Towne, just so you know what all they have here!"},{"author":"Michelle F.","datePublished":"2014-09-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"This rating does NOT reflect the fabulous selection at The Bean--that's amazing. I was irritated by the customer service. It STARTED well, with a lady greeting me as I came in the door and asking if I needed help finding anything. When I said no, the lady walked over to her associate, and the two proceeded to engage in an epic--riveting, I'm SURE--conversation that was still going on 10 minutes later, which is when I walked (unnoticed) out the door. The conversation transpired in the middle of a crowed aisle, which I, along with another patron, were having no small amount of difficulty navigating. The two were completely oblivious to the fact that we were trying to see (and move) PAST them. When the other patron met my eyes and shook her head in bewilderment, my suspicion that this is NOT normal behavior for business proprietors was confirmed. I didn't stick around any longer. I found what I needed at JoAnn's right around the corner."},{"author":"Jessica D.","datePublished":"2011-10-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"An awesome store and even better place to learn Wilton's techniques on cake and cupcake decorating. Suzanne is an excellent teacher and the store staff is very friendly and helpful. Whether you are a newby or an experienced baker this store has everything and if you have a question they definitely have the answer and will sell you the right product/tool/whatever it is you are looking for. GREAT STORE!"},{"author":"Madcitymom H.","datePublished":"2012-10-14","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Oh my!  This place is impressive!  Everything you need for cake and cookie decorating except the cake and cookies.  I loved the big tubs of buttercream frosting.  Was able to purchase individual pastry decorating bags and tips.  The selection is incredible."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4.5,"reviewCount":19}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Yucaipa High School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/vCsntp2HasF5sU7A925hOA/l.jpg","telephone":"(909) 797-0106","address":{"streetAddress":"33000 Yucaipa Blvd","addressLocality":"Yucaipa","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"CA","postalCode":"92399"},"review":[{"author":"Skittles M.","datePublished":"2015-11-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"Football games: \nThe school itself is just like any other public high school but the football games...\nMy husband and I went to a game because my daughter was in the band. The games are consumed by proud/loud parents and loud cheerleader wanna-bes in the audience. Very loud and they were throwing stuff everywhere. I watched an elderly woman get a pom pom thrown at her. They also sat this poor lady right in front of these loud and rude kids. There were a few lost kids running around, one in which was just 3. They charge admission and they will not allow you to re-enter. Not even Disneyland does that. My husband and I had our infant son with us and we were so very cold. So I wanted to go back to the car and grab a blanket for my baby, but they told us that once we leave, we can not come back for the rest of the night. Its Very Clean and Organized."},{"author":"David H.","datePublished":"2011-10-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Went here for a swim meet. Nice college with timers and everything was well organized."},{"author":"Mariah P.","datePublished":"2017-05-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Crafton has been a great experience. There are a variety of professors, classes and times / dates available for all types of students. The campus is beautiful. The pool is nice m, clean, big, and heated! They have a clean gym providing different classes as well. There is a lot of parking if you don't mind walking but they could benefit from a parking structure. I've been here for 2 years and I don't know where most of the offices are; such as security , nurses station, and barely the administration office. Its extremely hard to talk to anyone in the office and I've been redirected as well as misdirected several times. Plan to plan ahead and make an appointment with all of your questions so you don't have to come back. My first couple semesters here I talked to different counselors who gave me completely different advice on what classes I needed etc. Needless to say quite frustrating and did hold me back from being able to apply to a certain college prior the deadline. The school has a great fire academy and EMS program. They have beautiful hiking trails all around the campus for beginners as well as experts with well labeled and paved trails. The library is big and provides the tools necessary. The tutoring center is often a hit and miss. Sometimes the group sessions are helpful , other times they are not. I've also done one on one tutoring and would have to say it just depends on the person selected and once you find someone you like, matching their availability. A friend has experienced multiple tutors being late or not showing up at all for scheduled appointments. There is a lot of construction on campus that seems never ending and always ongoing which effects parking and walking. The hold many activities on campus during the week and hold marathons as well as the festivals on the weekend giving plenty opportunities to be involved. The campus also provides a student kept Garden and provides a program where any student without explanation or reason can go get fresh food, snacks, and a drink for no cost. There's a Queen Bee Cafe which offers a variety of hot/cold foods and drinks! Right next to it is the student store, again having just about everything one might need. Overall I've had a great experience here and it's my first choice in community college."},{"author":"J J.","datePublished":"2017-11-17","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":2},"description":"Crafton Hills college has a amazing view of the surrounding mountains on its newly remodeled campus but sadly, this college location has very low standards for staff. The professors here have a lazy approach and poor attitude towards students and administration is even worse. Students must work extra hard at teaching themselves due to the poor teaching skills these professor. I recommend saving time by taking classes online if you choose to attend classes here. By doing so you will be saving time and gas by not having to actually attend a class because the professors here are really not worth your time. I found myself being more confused when attending class than when I was at home or in study lab, reading, studying myself or with tutors. The teachers here truly are lazy or just carry bad interpersonal skills. I feel the tutors deserve the income the professors receive because tutors actually teach and help students learn. The professors here are getting paid to show up. The regulations here are also slightly twisted and the student panel are incompetent at making the common sense choices or decisions, which could help the progression of a students education in a more accelerated pace. This college creates unnecessary prerequisites that other community colleges do not require in a attempt to keep students enrolled couple semesters longer, which in the end is for their own capital gain. There are many politics students dont care or understand but these poor teachings are keeping these lower income students at community colleges longer rather than moving them quickly to a university in order to finish education. Financial aide and Administration here are also mis managed. My paperwork has gotten mixed up multiple times, costing me money! Its insane how mistakes like this happen, making students victims rather than successful graduates. If there is anyway to avoid community college take it. Even with all the financial aid, coming here will waste your time."},{"author":"Hannah R.","datePublished":"2015-10-01","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":""Let me put you on hold" is code for "I have no idea but I'm gonna try and get rid of you""},{"author":"Brenda W.","datePublished":"2018-09-24","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Horrible, horrible experience. This bull shit of going back and forth is ridiculous and no one own up to their mistakes and now I am out my money that I pay for class, uniforms, books and gasoline going to class every day. So sad that this is my first semester and I have to find another school because I don't believe in this one anymore. DON'T GO HERE!!! What a beautiful campus and great faculty!"},{"author":"Davyd F.","datePublished":"2018-02-25","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I graduated with an AST in Math last year and have to say that most professors are great and helpful. Was told by a counselor, after being there for three full-time years, that I'd have to take 2 more semesters of 18-20 unit loads each if I wanted a chance into cal poly pomona for Engineering. A week later, a cal poly rep said I could have applied a month earlier with a high chance of making it in with the classes I already had. The furthest distance on campus to class is just as far as having the best parking spot at my current school. Good luck guys, and take Hanley for math and Bailes for stats. Administration is busy but can schedule an appointment if you have the time. Its a good school and a good middle step if planning to transfer to a four year."},{"author":"Kips L.","datePublished":"2018-07-12","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Crafton Hills College is one of the most unwelcoming and discriminatory places I have ever had the misfortune to be at. There are numerous teachers there that are extremely transphobic and uncaring including students as well who have outed me where it brought bullying from other students. If you try to confide in someone - watch out for the dance people there. Desyah - a student there had no care for my life what so ever when I confided in this person about feeling extremely depressed due to bullying and personal family issues in which this person was treating me differently as well for being trans. I ended up saying how uncomfortable it all made me feel as this student had a very "oh well ok then we will be replacing you in the dance show". and was driving me into a deeper depression and isolation.. as time went on I made the fatal mistake of telling this student that I would tell the school how inappropriate it was all handled a week later - (ironically near trans day of remembrance). I had no idea what hell would be in store for me next as I was clearly retaliated on by this student.. as I  was to be placed in a mental hospital a WEEK LATER after mentioning feeling suicidal. I was pulled out of my class and handcuffed even after explaining to campus police. Obviously I would be a little upset. I was treated as if I was a criminal for being bullied and harassed instead. After being put within the mental hospital which was a traumatic experience in and of itself - I was made fun of by staff and treated horribly for being transgender. The campus police who escorted me tried to comfort me but she also lied and was very misleading while also telling me I must not love myself if I feel suicidal. Something that I felt extremely inappropriate to tell anyone. When telling the school about all this afterwards - the dean of student services Joe Cabrales mentioned in retort to me telling my story "I got up early for this.." at our meeting on me trying to find ways to making crafton a more LGBT friendly place and which he and also Rebeccah Warren-Marlott proceeded to tell me "maybe you should just leave" and that is where I'm at. Humiliated and degraded and never wanting to place foot on this unwelcoming campus again. Numerous students have shared with me also their sadness and the apathy this school shares towards making complaints on this student Desyah and her unwelcoming behavior - to transphobia to slut shaming other people it's a mess if you ever step into their sad excuse for a dance program. It's funny because that person isn't even an enrolled student - as I was actually paying and enrolled to be there. So much unnecessary pain and drama with this place and extremely misguided and uncaring staff. You've got some students who will physically harm and bully you for being trans and out you so beware because the school won't give a rip. I did not feel suicidal a week later during my class - but if you're a minority and people don't agree with your lifestyle ..be prepared to be discriminated against. Some of the teachers are just as rude.. confiding in Snezana Petrovic about feeling suicidal? You'll get nothing - not even a direction to help. She has made so many transphobic and cissexist comments as well as Colleen Maloney Hinds - who also apparently commissions students for drawing sexual imagery for her.. she literally told a student who outed me to draw her porn. I wish I could be making this shit up. Also wanna be made fun of and extremely rudely and sexually inappropriately talked to? Go chat with Mike Bedoya - he'll appall all your senses. The school doesn't give a shit - until a student is dead on their watch it seems to be the only case things would actually matter and change. I didn't find any truly helpful resources given to me by staff. I was just simply told "well.. your karate class was just an elective.. maybe you should leave..." amongst other atrocious gaslighting commentary and so I felt I had to. Some teachers have been kind to me I will say but they retired and said it was everything to get out of this school alive. I will never step foot on this extremely transphobic campus ever again. :) Good riddance to you all. Learn compassion and respect please and I can assure you will change the world. The golden rule works wonders."},{"author":"Jacquelynn P.","datePublished":"2015-10-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":1},"description":"Teachers are fantastic except Breanna Andrews who teaches ASL. The administration is awful, they talk down to you like you are a child. They are not easy to deal with at all. She told me that they received so many complaints. Financial is is also absurdly incompetent. CHC has their accreditation on probation.  Which seems to be a continual problem for them. CHC get your act together. It is about the students, not your jobs."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3,"reviewCount":27}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Corks And Canvases","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/QS-_oyciHDvZ9d6iyWNIHg/l.jpg","telephone":"(724) 519-4625","address":{"streetAddress":"4059 William Penn Hwy","addressLocality":"Murrysville","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"PA","postalCode":"15668"},"review":[{"author":"David S.","datePublished":"2014-12-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"My girlfriend has attended 3 different painting classes here and has had a blast each time. She enjoys the painting portion of it but you don't have to be artistic to go. 

There is a BYOB option and if you plan to drink you are required to sign a form that says they didn't give you the alcohol. Most people bring wine, however you can bring beer, mixed drinks, or non-alcoholic beverages. They provide cork screws and plastic cups in addition to everything that you need to paint. 

 Food is also allowed, however space is limited and there is not a lot of table space after canvases, paint brushes, and paint are all laid out. 

The reason that they received a 4 out of 5 rather than a 5 is because the instructors are really a hit or miss. While all of them do display artistic abilities, some are just better teachers than others are. If you find an instructor that you like, try to stick with them when you sign up for classes online."},{"author":"Leslie S.","datePublished":"2015-08-18","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I want to first note that Corks and Canvases has two locations, one in Murrysville and one on Main Street in Irwin. This review is of the Irwin location....and is long past due!

My sister-in-law has been wanting to try one of these painting classes and I saw that they had just opened a new place in Irwin. So, we decided to check it out. The class was on a Friday night in June and was supposed to be from 7-9pm.

The class was nearly full....since there were several small groups of ladies, as well as a bridal party of about 10. Luckily, we got there before most people and were able to get seats up front. This is a BYOB event, and it appeared mostly everyone (including us) brought a bottle of wine (or several) and snacks. 

The instructor was very nice. At the beginning, she gave us her credentials so we knew she was an actual painter with experience and not just someone they pulled off the street. She reviewed what we were going to paint and went at a nice pace. Actually, probably a little slow for me but it's better than her rushing through. She also gave us free reign and "artistic liberties", so the paintings didn't all have to look exactly alike. 

It was a fun event and I would love to go again. Biggest pro...the class was only $20! And I've seen other places as high as $35 or $40. 

The only reason I didn't give this event 5 stars is the following: It was waaayyy too long. Supposed to be over at 9pm; we didn't leave until well after 10:30. The biggest cause for this was when we got there at around ten minutes til seven, the instructor was just starting to set up. She did state that she had everything set up, but then a last-minute birthday party booked, so they had torn all of her things down, and she had to get them all back out. Not very professional of the company. We didn't really get started until about 7:35-ish. Plus, with a big class and people asking her questions, I think it just took longer than anticipated.

Also, it was a bit unorganized, which I do give leniency to since it's a new gig. I signed the two of us up online and also paid online. But, really, how was the instructor to know? We could have just strolled in from the street and said we paid. The site offered no receipt or confirmation number to take with you to the event. I asked the instructor if she received our payment, and she stated that she gets paid from the company, and frankly has no idea who paid and who didn't. 

Overall, a fun night out. Would go again!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":4,"reviewCount":2}}

In 10 weeks time, Sam attended his Paris program with the ability to get around Paris comfortably - and was complimented on his accent! Magnifique!"},{"author":"Sean F.","datePublished":"2018-07-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"An impending trip to South America was the impetus for me to finally brush up and build on the high school Spanish I'd never really used. Some of these are language basics, some are travel necessities, and some are specific to the area she knew I'd be visiting.  Along the way, she gently (yet firmly) kept me speaking in Spanish, so I could keep the conversation going, even when my limited vocabulary made it challenging. Gradually, my verb tenses have improved, and my vocabulary has broadened.  I've got a long way to go, but these are classes I could keep taking for fun -- not just as an emergency, pre-trip measure!  Muchas gracias, Karen!"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":4}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Bella Capelli Academy, A Paul Mitchell School-Monroeville","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/LjhZNt_PQof-tdmyFeeF8g/l.jpg","telephone":"(412) 373-6309","address":{"streetAddress":"151 Wyngate Dr","addressLocality":"Monroeville","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"PA","postalCode":"15146"},"review":[{"author":"Susan T.","datePublished":"2016-02-28","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I had a great experience at Bell Capelli last Saturday. I wanted a trim and my color touched up. The whole experience took 4 hours, so I'm glad that I allowed plenty of time for that. The time is the only drawback about this place. It was a lovely, clean facility. The student who worked on me (Miranda) asked me important questions about my hair that gave her info I wouldn't have thought to share myself. She worked with me to make sure I was getting what I wanted and asked repeatedly if I was comfortable and liked where the look was going. She was INCREDIBLY thorough. The supervisors walked around the room checking on students and assisting when they needed it. They stopped to look at my hair and ask the student who was working on me some questions. I had originally selected a hair color from a swatch of a dye that wouldn't have worked on my hair, but the stylists worked to mix up a dye that blended colors to adapt to my hair and give me the color I desired. I was very impressed by that. 
Overall, a wonderful experience. I'd recommend giving yourself a morning to enjoy the relaxation of being thoughtfully tended to by smart, kind students."},{"author":"Jennifer G.","datePublished":"2012-10-30","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"I recently relocated to the area and have not found a new salon yet. The downside is the amount of time that it takes.  Remember that they are students, so they have not built up the speed that a professional has.

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"University of Montevallo","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/i0gKSg9U4-nbALB0dXqEEQ/l.jpg","telephone":"(205) 665-6000","address":{"streetAddress":"","addressLocality":"Montevallo","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35115"},"review":[{"author":"Kelly B.","datePublished":"2018-08-26","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Our trip to Montevallo was for my sons middle school cross country meet.  I was very impressed with the amount of volunteers Montevallo had working during this meet.  They made it very easy to park and exit the parking lot with ease.  Several students were selling bottled water at entrance with A nice welcome for the runners and spectators.  You saw students every where changing garbage bins and keeping grounds clean.  Someone was always available if you needed assistance.  Very well organized for all"},{"author":"Gregory S.","datePublished":"2015-08-27","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"Great place to attend: historic buildings, red bricks are well-maintained, ghost stories, affordable Public Liberal Arts Institution, geographic marker on campus (exact center of the state), environmentally-friendly setting, cool seasonal local events, and individual attention from faculty, especially in the graduate Education programs:) Alabama's best kept secret!"},{"author":"Reverie B.","datePublished":"2018-02-10","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"I have been to several different colleges and the University of Montevallo is the best one I have been too. Normally when you go to school, you are lucky to have that one good teacher. Montevallo's instructors are all that good teacher. Every single professor is caring and do everything they can to help you. I have never been to a school that is so helpful and full of good people. Any problem I have, it gets resolved immediately or within a great amount of time. The campus is absolutely beautiful and it is set in a small town that is very safe. Never had a problem with anybody. Just use common sense and be smart. I recommend this school for anyone wanting to attend college, get a great education and experience, and save money.

Tips: There is a Student Emergency Fund for anyone struggling with their financial aid or books. This has helped me get my books for a semester when I had absolutely no means of getting them.

Second tip, there is a financial counselor that help you with anything financially, including food. I was able to get a box of food when I completely ran out and had no money or anywhere to go (I live off campus and pay for everything myself).

Third tip, become best friends with your financial aid advisor, Mrs. Nikki. She will help you with anything, any question or problem, big or small. She has helped me find scholarships and money that I didn't know existed and I could qualify for, which has helped tremendously with my tuition costs.

I will forever be grateful for everyone at this school from now, to the end of days."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":3}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Arthur Murray Pittsburgh East","telephone":"(412) 373-2101","address":{"streetAddress":"655 Rodi Rd\nSte 102\nOne Rodi Plaza","addressLocality":"Pittsburgh","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"PA","postalCode":"15235"},"review":[{"author":"Katelynn D.","datePublished":"2020-03-02","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"My boyfriend and I purchased a Groupon for two weeks of beginner classes at Arthur Murray Pittsburgh East and were pleasantly surprised with the outcome! {"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Helena High School","telephone":"(205) 682-3650","address":{"streetAddress":"1310 Hillsboro Pkwy","addressLocality":"Helena","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35080"},"review":[{"author":"Rob S.","datePublished":"2019-12-13","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"This review is really just based off of the stadium and going to the football game on a Friday night. 

It would appear that everyone in the town, and maybe all the surrounding towns, show up to support the Huskies when they play football. Tremendous police support for parking and traffic direction did about as good as could be expected for keeping people moving and finding places to park.

The stadium itself, for a high school, is quite large and there was a huge fan base that showed up to support the team. Always impressed when the opposing fans will give a standing ovation to the other team's band for a great halftime performance (Way to go Southside).

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Birmingham Conservatoire","telephone":"0121 331 5909","address":{"streetAddress":"Paradise Place
Fletchers Walk","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"GB","addressRegion":"XWM","postalCode":"B3 3HG"},"review":[{"author":"Raj B.","datePublished":"2012-06-08","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":3},"description":"If you ask someone whether they know where the Birmingham Conservatoire is, they're most likely completely oblivious that such a place exists. That's because it's a 60s retro building hidden in Paradise Circus but showcases some amazing musical talent.

I went there for six years whilst learning to play the sitar and was amazed at the number of concerts that are held there. Most of these are performed by musicians who learn here, but the Conservatoire has also played host to some big classical artistes from around the world.

The nearest parking is the Town Hall car park close to the Mailbox so if you have others with you that find it difficult to walk, you're better off dropping them nearby first. The building is in desperate need of a facelift and the facilities are outdated. A large coffee shop or bar would be useful for concert-goers too."},{"author":"Fiona H.","datePublished":"2012-06-21","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":4},"description":"Birmingham Conservatoire is one of the UK's top music schools, along with the Royal Academy in London and the Northern College of Music in Manchester. In fact, it was ranked top first with the Royal Academy last year, in a national student survey. Nuff said. 

It continues to produce world-class performers and composers, such as John Webb, Jean Rigby and, errr, Rhydian. As you would expect from a conservatoire, there is a very practical focus to the courses studied here, with numerous concerts and gigs for the students to gain experience in performance, and ensembles, orchestras, choirs and bands to get involved in. 

The conservatoire was the first music school in the UK to have an active research programme, and is internationally recognised for its developments in electro-acoustics. All in all - top dollar."}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":3.5,"reviewCount":2}}

{"@context":"https://schema.org","@type":"LocalBusiness","name":"Historical Powell School","image":"https://s3-media0.fl.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/R_S0ljaXn1aNSt0NhALvyA/l.jpg","telephone":"","address":{"streetAddress":"6TH And 24th","addressLocality":"Birmingham","addressCountry":"US","addressRegion":"AL","postalCode":"35233"},"review":[{"author":"Melissa B.","datePublished":"2014-03-11","reviewRating":{"ratingValue":5},"description":"On Saturday, March 8th, Tony and I was walking around downtown Birmingham checking out all of the old gorgeous buildings. We ran across this magnificent example of Victorian Architecture and the oldest school still standing in Birmingham.

Found this article about it:
The timing probably couldn't be better for the "for sale" to go up on historic Powell School.

Powell, Birmingham's oldest school, at 124 years old, was heavily damaged in a fire in January 2011. At first, thoughts were that the building would have to be razed, a significant loss to the city's history.
But the city of Birmingham wisely struck a deal with the Alabama Trust for Historic Preservation to control the building and see whether it can be saved.
So far, the news has been good. The Alabama Trust for Historic Preservation has cleaned up most of the fire damage and is continuing with plans to put a roof back on Powell to protect the structure from the elements and to stabilize the building's outer walls.

A February 5, 1970 article in the Birmingham Public Library Archives tells us that the Powell Elementary School is Birmingham's oldest school, dating back to 1874, having been founded immediately after the cholera epidemic swept the town, practically depopulating it. Woodlawn, Henley and Powell were known as the oldest white public schools in Birmingham, the others having been built after 1900.Actually, the school that occupied the site of the old Powell School that burned yesterday, was called The Free White School, and a picture of it appears in another article featured in the Birmingham City Archives' digital collection. 

HISTORICAL MARKER READS:
Birmingham's first public school was named for Colonel James R. Powell, the city's first elected Mayor. This energetic promoter also served as the first President of the Elyton Land Company (now Birmingham Realty). which founded the city in 1871. Two years later, Colonel John T. Terry led the fund raising to establish a "free school for white children." The school was "free" only of ties to a religious institution for fees were charged according to grade level. Mayor Powell donated his salary, police court fines and other city fees to support the school.
The present red brick Victorian Gothic style structure, designed by S. J. Hall of Cleveland, Ohio in 1888, is the third Powell School. Until 1918, the school accommodated grades one through twelve and for a time served as a training school for prospective teachers"}],"aggregateRating":{"@type":"AggregateRating","ratingValue":5,"reviewCount":1}}
